604847d5b5811b50a0e91968.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet TV network and we strive to bring engaging stories from many cultures to people all across the globe. With over 200 million members globally, the Data platform is the core foundation enabling all of our product decisions that directly impact our customer experience when they watch Netflix. 

Our platform runs tens of thousands of jobs and processes over a trillion events a day. We support over a thousand data analysts, data scientists, and engineers across the company to make business decisions. Having excellent reliability for such a large and distributed cloud infrastructure is paramount to a data-driven company like Netflix.  

The business of applying Data Science effectively and productively is far from sorted out. The Notebooks team exists to boost the productivity of the data science and engineering community at Netflix. This means that they can spend more time solving business problems and less time engineering lower-level systems. We're a diverse team with a shared passion for helping humans become more productive. We enable our colleagues in data science, data engineering, machine learning and analytics to rapidly, collaboratively and confidently explore and interact with Netflix data.

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to make a difference building our next-generation notebooks and data platform, to evolve our operations practices, and to build infrastructure to support our continued scaling for global expansion and our shift into more advanced support for machine learning, stream processing and data visualization. 

Specifically, you and your team will

  • Drive the on-going vision of improving user experience of a next-generation notebooks product.
  • Build scalable systems that improve the productivity of any data scientist and engineer at Netflix. 
  • Partner with the rest of the data platform team to drive our vision towards a ‘data-driven’ data platform.
  • Evangelize operational best practices and continuously look for opportunities to automate and build tools to lower operational barriers, improve clarity on problematic areas, and improve reliability.
  • Lead and grow a team of top-talent senior software engineers.

About you:

  • You have experience in building and leading distributed teams with senior engineers to reach their potential.
  • You have a high degree of empathy for users of your products. You've envisioned and seen to fruition delightful user experiences. Perhaps you even act as a product manager or designer when the need arises. 
  • You are a strong partner and enjoy driving cross-functional projects forward.
  • You are great at strategizing vision, evolving roadmaps based on changing business needs and motivating teams to execute on them. 
  • You are a people leader and a technical leader.
  • You have a passion for building and motivating teams to reach their potential.
  • You have experience building internal developer infrastructure that is shared across teams.
  • You are excited to be leading a team that is fundamental to the success of Netflix and making a big difference in revolutionizing internet TV!

609d4d14b5811b9f2707b11b.description:
Netflix is the largest production studio in the world. The Production Infrastructure Engineering team is responsible for building the infrastructure platform that enables artist collaboration on a global scale. We work closely with peer engineering teams in Digital Production and Animation Technologies, Platform Engineering, and the other central engineering teams at Netflix.

Do you have a passion for solving customer needs with technology and making their experience the best it can be? Would you enjoy being an early hire in a highly visible space with the opportunity to build a team and shape our products? Are you interested in defining and building the technical future of the studio production platform?

We are highly collaborative and focused on building scalable and foundational services for other engineering teams. Much of the content created today happens at the intersection of technology and art, and our platform is what powers the creative applications and tools artists use to make Netflix content across the globe. Our team provides the services such as workstations and rendering, as well as systems and software foundations that power a global footprint of collaborative artist work environments both in the cloud and near premises.
We are seeking an Engineering Manager to lead our Render Services team.

Our Opportunity

  • Leadership: build, lead, and grow a team of back-end engineers focused on developing a scalable rendering service.
  • Vision: influence rendering service design and development to deliver cutting edge functionality to serve a wide variety of use cases.
  • Strategy: define a roadmap and execution strategy in collaboration with peer engineering teams, central engineering, and studio product management teams.
  • Inclusion: create an environment where different backgrounds, cultures, industry and life experiences are embraced and valued.

Your Experience

  • You have deep experience with rendering technologies, processes, and workflows.
  • You are very familiar with rendering orchestration in the context of a visual effects and animation studio.
  • You have built and led teams of back-end software engineers.
  • You have hands-on experience building services that orchestrate large scale distributed computing workloads. 
  • You have led through ambiguity and are comfortable making decisions despite incomplete information and/or requirements.

Your Environment

  • You will be trusted by your team and the organization to make impactful decisions. We also provide support through mentorship and coaching.
  • You will contribute to a safe and inclusive environment by being curious and vulnerable.
  • We will learn how to build the best creative experience together.
For more information on what it’s like to work at Netflix, please take a look at our culture memo!

6089bff2aabfb4dc476ba762.description:
The Company and Product Strategy
Instant streaming on devices built by partners like Roku and Sony is a core part of Netflix's strategy of “watch anywhere on any device”. Our first partner product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008 and is now available on 100s of products. Our partnerships include global technology providers like Roku and Google as well as many of the world’s largest operators, like Sky, Reliance Jio, and Orange. The Netflix Device Platform makes this possible. 

The Team
Work with our partners to add Netflix experiences into consumer electronics and operator devices. We work very closely with these engineering teams to overcome any and all challenges. A key aspect to being successful is to build technical partnerships that can scale to a number of different solutions. The functionality of our platform includes streaming playback, dynamic UI, security, and API integrations. In addition to the integration of our application, you will be responsible for certifying that devices meet the Netflix quality bar before it gets in front of our customers as well as maintaining that quality over the lifetime of the device.

The Opportunity
You will be leading a team of experienced engineers to prototype, develop, certify, and maintain a high quality Netflix experience. You will need to work cross functionally with internal technical teams as well as external partner teams. The partner ecosystem includes 7-year-old set-top boxes, 30 dollar streaming sticks, and high end 4k HDR smart TV’s.  You will lead an amazing team and you will be empowered to make things happen.

Our unique company culture and values are essential to the way the Partner Engineering  team operates. Learn more about the Netflix culture here.

To learn more about our teams, check out this slide deck, listen to this podcast or our tech blog for a case study from the team.

Required Qualifications

  • You are a great manager who understands how to help your team get things done.
  • You're comfortable with proactive outward communication and technical leadership.
  • You have a deep understanding and appreciation for the complexities of embedded software development and testing
  • You ideally have a deep background in two or more of the following: Backend API (Rest/GraphQL) integration and development, embedded Linux, device drivers, embedded graphics, software development with a focus on distributed computing involving audio/video standards.
  • You enjoy working in a highly cross-functional leadership role.
  • You are proactive, seeking the best solutions for the company.
  • You have a B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or comparable experience.
  • You have experience building and leading teams with senior engineers to help them reach their potential.
  • You will be required to travel 1-2 weeks a quarter.

60772ed4b5811b0d637ddb8c.description:
The Team: 
If you’re a Netflix customer, you have benefited from the work of the Security Protocols Engineering team. We are responsible for securing the Netflix streaming client ecosystem, enabling you to enjoy Netflix on nearly every device, whether the Netflix app is built by teams at Netflix, integrated by a partner, or provided through a third-party package integration. This is a deeply technical team, who draws from knowledge of networks, cryptography, operating systems, and software architecture. 

The Client & Security Protocols team is responsible for designing and implementing security-related features in devices and cloud services while preserving a great Netflix customer experience. Our team is highly cross functional, inside and outside of Netflix. For instance, we work with cloud engineering teams and client development teams. We also work with device manufacturers and cable providers. Security in the Freedom & Responsibility culture of Netflix means that much of our work is accomplished through influence, not mandates. A highly collaborative mindset is key.

Our mandate is to validate that we have end-to-end, holistic security mechanisms in place. We are part of the larger Device & Content Security organization, which collaborates with device partners and DRM across the industry. 

To learn more about the Device & Content Security at Netflix, check out this episode of the WeAreNetflix podcast.

The Role:
We are looking for an experienced engineering manager to lead the team and help us drive security improvements across our ecosystem. You should understand how security protocols work and where the risks are. You are pragmatic about security and understand tradeoffs. Having a strong security background is critical to success in this role. You will have a significant impact and shouldn't be afraid to take on interesting challenges. Our subscriber base is growing fast, and so is our opportunity!

Responsibilities:

  • Leadership:Team building & ensuring excellent talent density: recruiting, evaluating, inclusivity, coaching, celebrating wins
  • Partnership: collaborating with partner teams to prioritize and help in addressing vulnerabilities
  • Strategy: together with the team and context from the broader Client & UI Engineering organization, determining and championing longer term team direction and technology strategy
  • Execution: establishing a plan and delivering on it, iterating and improving the plan along the way

Technical Experience:

  • Security protocols design and implementation experience
  • A deep understanding of network authentication and confidentiality (e.g., TLS and SSL), their implementation across various standards, and the various ways they can be attacked and defended.
  • Cryptography experience
  • Software development experience in object oriented programming languages preferred
  • Distributed systems and client/server development experience a plus
Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility. You can learn more via the Netflix culture memo and jobs site.

607db84ab5811bd7417dd49e.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 200+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. This is made possible, in part, by an engineering organization that enables our customers to stream content and our studio to produce content. 

The Security Services Engineering organization supports these engineers at Netflix by creating and operating authentication, authorization, and cryptographic software services. The teams in this organization operate at the intersection of software engineering, privacy, and security expertise. The Auth Services team is responsible for the enforcement layers of authentication and authorization policy; creating high availability, low latency, and high throughput services, that are critical to the Netflix ecosystem and the Security Paved Road. 
 
The Role 
As the engineering manager for the Auth Services team, you’ll be responsible for a team of high caliber security software engineers driving vision and direction for some of our most critical services. You enjoy giving and receiving feedback and will support your team to succeed and grow through candid mentorship and coaching. The role is highly cross functional, and you’ll help your team solve the right problems by sharing business and technical context derived from the partnerships you will build with key stakeholders.

If you are curious about some of the team’s work, you can watch this Building Identity for an Open Perimeter conference talk by our IAM engineers and this panel about Security Paved Road at Netflix.

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • You are a pragmatic security leader who believes in risk focused, scalable security approaches with a strong technical background in developing low latency, high resiliency, and high-availability, services. 
  • You have excellent communication skills and a product focused mindset to build the right solutions for your stakeholders and customers. 
  • Deep care for creating a team which models psychological safety and inclusivity, where team members can do their best work.
  • You prefer collaboration and problem solving over process and mandates.  
  • You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and independent decision making.
  • You have experience leading, hiring, coaching and cultivating an excellent team.
  • Ability to prioritize your team’s investments to align with broad business goals and risk-based security initiatives.
  • Well versed in identity and access management concepts.

609408127a9df82d95fe48d8.description:
The Opportunity:
With the explosion of Internet TV, Netflix has grown to serve over 200 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries worldwide. The Cloud Infrastructure organization’s mission is to increase the fleet-wide agility, scalability, reliability, and efficiency of our Platform. To do this, we build compute and networking abstractions that add opinions, drive standards, reduce operational burden on application owners, and allows for us to independently evolve our architecture.

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader who will lead and grow a team of senior engineers for the Application Networking group. The team provides solutions to ensure consistent traffic management throughout the Netflix ecosystem, by abstracting out the complexities of resiliency, security, routing, and insights. You will be partnering with engineering teams across all of Netflix, including service owners, platform partners, and other central teams, like our InfoSec and CDN teams to develop and execute on a cohesive strategy for how we evolve traffic flowing through our ecosystem.

If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of how Netflix scales into the future, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Drive the vision and strategy on how to evolve our Application Networking solutions
  • Build, scale, and mentor a cohesive team of amazing engineers
  • Form strong cross-functional partnerships to achieve alignment with many engineering teams and ensure our solutions meet their needs, while maintaining our focus on reliability, resiliency, security

What we are looking for:

  • Experience building and operating complex distributed systems at scale. 
  • Well versed in Java or other object-oriented languages.  
  • Deep knowledge of networking technologies and abstractions in modern architectures
  • Solid understanding of transport protocols (HTTP, HTTP/2, WebSockets, etc). 
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Deep empathy for users and their business goals
  • Proven experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity.
  • Tenacity and the ability to balance competing priorities across multiple cross-functional stakeholders and programs
  • Orientation towards long-term impact as the yardstick for prioritization, but able to strike the right balance between short term goals and longer-term vision
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Want to know more about our Cloud Infrastructure teams? Check out:

  • Evolution of Edge @Netflix
  • Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices

Netflix is reinventing how the world watches television. Over 200 million members around the globe enjoy our award-winning movies and TV shows, but most of our growth still lies ahead. Content Engineering is in a hyper-growth phase as Netflix continues to expand its content budget.

About the team
The Promotional Media Management Engineering (PMM) team is responsible for the digital asset management of our promotional assets for a growing number of titles with constantly evolving asset suites. The products and services on this team ensure that our promotional assets are discoverable, trackable, measurable, and reusable. 

About the role
The Promotional Media Management Engineering team is hiring a seasoned leader to drive Promotional Media Engineering’s most impactful projects. PMM is responsible for building products and services that enable us to manage the complete lifecycle of all our promotional assets. This team works closely with Product Management, Design, Analytics, UI and various business teams to define and implement strategies to optimize the cost and on time delivery of assets. 

About the space
Promotional assets are the key to discovering content you love to watch. The Promotional Media Engineering products make it easy to tell stories about our stories. We build products to get artwork and video assets in front of our members, both on and off-service. Our backend services power products that are used internally at Netflix as well as externally by our content partners,  fulfillment partners, creative agencies and freelancers that work with Netflix to curate one of the best entertainment catalogs in the world. 

What you’ll do:

  • Team Leadership: build and lead a team of server-side engineers adept at building distributed microservices.
  • Technical Vision: re-evaluate architecture choices on an ongoing basis, in anticipation of increased scale and ever-evolving technology to meet the demands of a growing business.
  • Demonstrate technical skills to successfully drive infrastructure & tool improvements for new products and existing processes and workflows
  • Product Leadership: define and execute the roadmap by collaborating with partners in Product, Design and Operations.
  • Build and lead an inclusive team of great engineers from different backgrounds, cultures, industries and life experiences.

Qualifications:

  • You have experience building and leading a team of server side engineers.
  • You are an innovative thinker and are comfortable pushing your own team to continue to push boundaries.
  • Track record of managing large successful teams and invest in actively mentoring and coaching every member of the team.
  • Ability to work through ambiguous requirements and make decisions to push forward. 
  • You are passionate about building highly scalable solutions with flexibility factored in to make quick pivots as business evolves.
  • Experience working with a product team to build a vision for how UX, UI, and the back-end will come together on a given product or features.
  • You have proven skills in building software systems in a distributed / cloud environment, deployed in a CI/CD fashion.

What Sets You Apart

  • You have worked on horizontal platforms/products that serve multiple engineering teams.
  • Great communication and collaboration skills working cross-functionally with multiple teams.

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with 200+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching  all without commercials or commitments. We are focused on disrupting the media and entertainment industry by applying innovative software development and data design practices.

The storage platform team has the primary charter to deliver storage and transport products that provide file and directory access to applications and users around the globe which is performant, secure, and centrally managed. This platform is a foundational building block to multiple studio engineering products.

The Role
We are looking for a seasoned leader for the storage platform team who is passionate about leading, coaching, hiring, aligning, and delivering critical storage solutions for the business. This is a cross-functional role where you will partner, collaborate and align with the platform, studio, product, and business teams. The scope and impact of the team are rapidly evolving and growing which will provide opportunities to evolve and grow the team in innovative ways.

Who Are You?

  • You are curious, enjoy hard technical problems, and are driven by big impact.
  • You are experienced in hiring, leading, coaching, and growing teams across different skills and traits.
  • You enjoy collaborating across cross-functional teams and connecting the dots.
  • You are a clear, proactive communicator with good written and verbal skills. 
  • You build trust and are capable of debating and understanding different perspectives but always be driven by making the right decisions for the business.
  • You lead the team with context and provide the guard rails for technical architecture, product vision, project execution, and production operations.

What (ideally) you already know or have experience in

  • Storage technologies like FUSE (File system in user space), File systems, Block storage, Object storage.
  • Platform development and operational experience in cloud infrastructures.
  • Delivered cross-functional complex products across multiple teams.
  • Building a team of stunning colleagues via hiring, coaching, context, feedback, and accountability.
  • Working through quickly evolving business requirements and multiple stakeholders.

As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers that help our members find the content they’ll most enjoy. At the core of all this innovation is reliable, high-quality data which fuels progress in the form of new user experiences and personalization.

Netflix is looking for a seasoned engineering leader to head the Product Analytics Data Engineering team. Your team of software and data engineers will directly interact with product managers and analytics leaders to identify product opportunities. We do this by building big data pipelines and services using Spark, Flink, Druid, Cassandra, Presto, and other distributed computing tools. This is an opportunity to lead and grow a team of world class engineers who build smart & interactive analytical apps and aggregate & curate the largest datasets at Netflix.

To be successful in this role, you need to be a strong people manager; great at giving and receiving feedback, fostering new ideas, and empowering others. You also need a strong software engineering background, to be a quick and data-driven learner, to have proven data engineering and system design skills, and the ability to lead large multi-disciplinary, cross-functional teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Recruiting: You are constantly on the lookout for talent and have a knack for recognizing and attracting top-tier engineers to your team. You understand the importance of building an amazing team and the value it brings to the overall company.
  • Feedback & Development: You will coach and guide employees through their strengths and weaknesses through regular feedback.
  • Contribute to Data Science & Engineering Leadership: You will be expected to participate in leadership conversations and interview for engineering teams across Netflix.
  • Vision: You intuitively understand business, analytics, and technology, and you leverage that to guide a team by providing relevant context and inspiration.
  • Partnership: You will continue to establish strong relationships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix.

Skills & Characteristics:

  • You are a natural people leader who also demonstrates humility. You care deeply about people, and their success. You invest in your relationships, so that you have an understanding of the whole person and their perspective.
  • You’re not afraid of hard conversations, and are gifted at coaching your colleagues through difficult situations. You are comfortable sharing your perspective on challenging people dynamics.
  • You seek to de-escalate tense situations, and are creative & flexible in finding balance with partners to maximize impact.
  • You are a strong communicator, and self-aware about how others perceive your comments. As someone in a leadership role you aim to be assertive, not passive nor aggressive, in providing input, support, and feedback.
  • You are forward-looking and able to anticipate the investments Netflix should be making to improve efficiency, innovation, and alignment. You identify areas for continuous improvement, and persistently advocate for action to address them.
  • You have an impeccable eye for technical talent, and a history of influencing hiring decisions across organizations. In this role you will be expected to understand how the Data Science & Engineering organization’s broad hiring strategy translates into the needs of our team, and our partners.
  • You’re allergic to micromanagement. You prefer to give context, delegate, and watch amazing people exceed your hopes and expectations.
  • You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines.

Preferred Requirements:

  • You have 10+ years software development experience. You have a mastery of object-oriented design and design patterns, and programming skills.
  • You have 5+ years of engineering team management experience.
  • You have a MS in Computer Science/Engineering, or related field.
  • You have used big data technologies (i.e. Spark/MapReduce/Hadoop, etc.) at one point in your career, and have built web-scale data pipelines.
  • You have used SQL and reporting tools at one point in your career, and are analytically savvy.

Two more things to know:

  • Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it at https://jobs.netflix.com/culture. 
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

The Detection and Response team at Netflix is a central security team that gathers security intelligence, responds to security incidents, and looks for attacker activity in our environment. You will lead a full-cycle security incident response program starting from identification to containment to mitigation. We are looking for a leader to scale and mature the incident response function through automation and promulgation of incident management best practices. 

The person in this role will own, build, and advance our incident response charter, including studio incident response and an insider threat program. You will closely collaborate with many other Netflix teams to actively defend Netflix’s assets across streaming, studio, and enterprise. This is an active and highly visible role that requires an appreciation for operational excellence and a solid ability to build cross-functional relationships. You will mentor people and encourage their personal and organizational growth in line with Netflix’s values. 

Desired skills and background:

  • You are a meticulous and responsive cross-team communicator and program leader.
  • Your technical background aligns with the current team operating at the intersection of software engineering, incident response, and digital forensics.
  • You are well versed in the latest adversary techniques, attack lifecycle, and incident response procedure.
  • As a manager, you can successfully coach and inspire a talented and senior team.
  • You creatively scale Incident Response Program with an emphasis on automation, testing, and training.
  • You lead with influence. 
  • You are confident in working with frontline teammates, executives, third-party organizations, and everyone in between to aggregate information and coordinate collaborative action.
Netflix Security Incident Response Team has often shared our work with the broader security community. We encourage you to learn more about us by reading about our open-source projects (Dispatch for crisis management) and conference talks (Reservist talk at USENIX Enigma and Learning from cloud, chaos, and Scale: Netflix SIRT talk at the FIRST Conference).

The Netflix culture permeates our work environment. It determines who we hire, how we work together, and how we make decisions. It encourages us to bring our best every day while valuing collaboration over individual achievement. If this sounds exciting to you, we encourage you to apply today so that we can learn more about each other.

604b09477a9df8979a474c9c.text: Engineering Manager, Data Platform Edge API Infrastructure
604b09477a9df8979a474c9c.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet TV network and we strive to bring engaging stories from many cultures to people all across the globe. With over 200 million members globally, Netflix depends on the data platform to provide the foundation for all of our product decisions - decisions that directly impact our customer experience. 

Our platform runs tens of thousands of jobs and processes over a trillion events a day. We support over a thousand data analysts, data scientists, and engineers across the company to make business decisions. Having excellent reliability for such a large and distributed cloud infrastructure is paramount to a data-driven company like Netflix.  

This team is building an API gateway and clients to unify access to Netflix's data platform and provide a consistent entry point making it easy and efficient for any data consumers. The API exposes a single GraphQL endpoint that expresses relationships between several discrete data platform entities and provides a query language that allows selective and efficient data retrieval with a strongly typed schema focusing on documentation and discoverability. When building a gateway, some of the challenges include maintaining consistency and development velocity while also balancing dimensions like scalability and operability. 

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to realize the vision for the data platform edge, to help evolve our operations practices, and to build infrastructure to support our continued scaling for global expansion and our shift into more advanced support for machine learning and stream processing. 

Specifically, you and your team will

  • Drive the on-going vision of how users will interact with the data platform. 
  • Build systems and services to continuously improve how we qualify systems failures and quantify systems health. 
  • Partner with the rest of the data platform team to drive our vision towards a ‘data-driven’ data platform.
  • Evangelize operational best practices and continuously look for opportunities to automate and build tools to lower operational barriers, improve clarity on problematic areas, and improve reliability.
  • Lead and grow a team of top-talent senior software engineers. 

About you:

  • You have experience in building and leading distributed teams of senior engineers, and with helping your team members reach their potential.
  • You have experience in building and managing large scale distributed microservices that are shared across teams.
  • You are a strong partner and enjoy driving cross-functional, cross-team projects forward.
  • You are great at strategizing vision, evolving roadmaps based on changing business needs and motivating teams to execute on them. 
  • You are a people leader and a strong technical leader.
  • You have a passion for building and motivating teams to reach their potential.
  • You have experience building internal infrastructure that is shared across teams.
  • You are excited to be leading a team that is fundamental to the success of Netflix and making a big difference in revolutionizing internet TV!

605a535caabfb42f97f821cb.text: Engineering Manager, Big Data Warehouse and Data Governance Services
605a535caabfb42f97f821cb.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by creating content people love and bringing joy to people around the world. 

As Netflix continues to innovate on its product and grow its member base, we also have a strategic goal to build a globally connected and data-informed studio that can manage hundreds of productions simultaneously. The scale and challenges of integrating production and studio data with the product data are unprecedented in the industry. 

In this mission, the data platform is at the core of Netflix’s success. The big data warehouse team is part of the data platform team. It is responsible for two key missions. We aspire to build an intelligent big data warehouse that works like a product to abstract the details of managing large datasets typically needed from its users in a large-scale big data environment. We are also building a coherent data strategy across Netflix. We are in the midst of devising the long term strategy and roadmap for our cross-organizational data governance initiatives. Here is the team's charter that has more details on the missions of this team. 

We are looking for a strong leader to make a big impact on both of these fronts. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates. We value what you can do, from anywhere in the US. 

Specifically, you will:

  • Drive the vision, evolution, and innovation of the intelligent big data warehouse and data governance initiatives.
  • Collaborating with all leaders in the data platform team and partners’ organizations to define the right scope in which to deliver the right product at the right time.
  • Be a technical advisor working alongside the team to build a cohesive ecosystem of systems/services to advance the team charter.
  • Lead and grow an inclusive and high-performing team where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the team’s mission. 
  • Helping and enabling engineers to grow and flourish in a relatively flat engineering organization. 

You find joy and have experience in:

  • Collaborating with partners to strategize, crystalize and build long-term roadmaps for ambiguous business needs. 
  • Leading cross functional and cross team projects and bringing it to successful completion.
  • Building and operating large-scale distributed services for use by other teams; ideally with experience in cloud-based platforms.
  • Building and leading a team of engineers; ideally with experience leading remote employees. Understanding team needs and learning new approaches to increase representation through additive hiring.
  • Exercising strong judgment and making thoughtful decisions with ambiguous situations. Striking the right balance between providing context vs. giving direction. Trading off short-term wins vs. long-term success based on various constraints. 
Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility and the accountability to do the right thing for Netflix. Read more about the Netflix culture here.

605a47b23d6b6258c795b873.text: Engineering Manager, Studio Tech Solutions - Creative Production & Promotion
605a47b23d6b6258c795b873.description:
As one of the largest content producers, Netflix Studio earned the most Emmy nominations and produced more films than any other studio. For the studio to continue to scale and produce quality content, various business teams in the Studio, Marketing, and Creative production work closely with Product partners to innovate and develop applications to support the studio operations.

In the role of Engineering Manager of Studio Tech Solutions - Creative Production & Promotion, you will be building and leading a group of Sr. Software Engineers focusing on understanding business users’ use cases and developing prototypes, short-term and technical solutions for the Marketing and Creative Production org. The partnership with the product management, other engineering teams, and information security is equally important to stay highly aligned in addressing the Marketing & Creative Production org’s technology needs.

With a strong background in software development in distributed systems architecture, you will provide technical guidance and inspire the team to make the best judgment around engineering practices as well as implementation directions. 

You belong in this team if:

  • You are motivated to build a well-balanced, high-performing team by hiring top-talents with various experiences and backgrounds.
  • You are comfortable with driving high aligned goals and strategies with the business on project prioritization and roadmaps.
  • You build a strong partnership with Product Management, Data Platform Engineering, and Content Engineering by collaborating effectively & selflessly.
  • You are passionate about solving problems and willing to provide technical solutions at all levels of complexity (Spreadsheet to the custom app) and drive business impact.
  • You find fast-paced, high-impact projects more intriguing than the long-term, well-defined projects.
  • You are excited about getting familiar with the available Netflix engineering resources and paved path tools and providing development guidance to the team based on the learnings.
  • You enjoy mentoring and motivating team members to follow the best engineering practices and seek personal & technical growth opportunities.
  • You are committed to collaborating and strategizing with peers to optimize inefficiencies in communication and solution implementation practices.

Qualifications:

  • 8-9 years of experience in full-stack development including 4+ years of proven hands-on management experience of building & leading a talented group of developers.
  • Familiar with React and at least one of the following: Python, Nodejs, Java 
  • Experience in cloud-based deployments
  • Passionate about problem-solving and working with engineering and non-engineering partners.
  • Ability to translate technical concepts into languages that the audience (business stakeholders and engineering partners) with various levels of technical background can understand to influence decision making. 

Bonus if you have experience with:

  • Google G Suite APIs
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Building a relationship with the studio/marketing business users

It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to over 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We’ve become the largest entertainment studio in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace. The Studio Innovation product team is front and center of this growth. We build software that fuels the production and creation of Netflix content. The Animation Studio Technology team within Studio Innovation builds products that power the Netflix Animation Studio ecosystem. Netflix is on a path to release six animation feature films per year, which no major studio has ever done, on top of the very healthy slate of animation series.
 
At Netflix, our animation product team is small so you have the opportunity to make a big impact, and our unique culture drives our approach to innovation. We’re seeking ambitious, analytical, and strategic leaders to join our team. You will hire the best engineering talent and will lead a team of engineers to identify new ways to create products that drive impact in Animation. You will collaborate with product, design, and data science leaders to set a vision and chart a course ahead. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways and the willingness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, a balance of creativity and analytic skills, and exceptional organizational leadership. The Animation team is growing at a rapid pace and needs a self-starter leader who has experience in strict prioritization and leveraging data to inform their decisions.

As UI engineering manager at Netflix, a typical day might include the following:

  • Having a 1-1 with an engineer on your team.  Building your relationship by getting to know them better, shining a spotlight on their clear communication with a partner, coaching them through a conflict and diving deeper into unlocking new ideas to accelerate developer productivity.
  • Preparing a discussion for your team meeting on topics ranging from empathy to execution.
  • Recruiting. Identifying and reaching out to UI engineering candidates who might strengthen your team by bringing a diverse perspective your team is currently lacking. Doing a phone screen with a candidate.  Prepping your interview team for an on-site interview.  
  • Leading a prioritization discussion with your product manager, backend engineering and design partners.  Recommending projects we might slow down on in favor of accelerating others so we can unlock more value for our customers.
  • Identifying risks, assigning ownership to engineers and clarifying what we are trying to achieve and next steps the team is accountable for. 
  • Partnering with product managers and data scientists to develop the metrics you’ll use to measure success of a new product initiative.  

What we are looking for:

  • Ability to build and motivate a diverse engineering organization to meet the needs of the Netflix Animation Studios
  • Someone with a proven track record leading large cross-functional engineering initiatives, while being a thought leader with PMs and Designers
  • Ability to work through ambiguous requirements and make decisions to push forward
  • A great communicator 
  • Someone with a passion for enhancing the quality of the products your team builds
  • Ability to work with stakeholders and tight-knit partners, many of them work out of the Animation Studio 
  • Ability to evaluate build vs. buy and licensing opportunities while balancing short term and long term perspectives
  • Ability to foster a learn-fast mentality and collaborate with operational teams to roll out products to our talent, employees, and partners.
  • Ability to work closely with data science and algorithm teams to generate insights and develop new ideas
  • Someone who thrives in a healthy debate of ideas while balancing to communicate your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization

What Can Set You Apart

  • Experience building and shipping workflow-based enterprise applications
  • First-hand knowledge of the production process for animated movies and TV shows
  • You desire a fast-paced, dynamic environment

5f89243082ecd35a9e31a1ed.description:
The Company and Product Strategy: 
Instant streaming is a core part of Netflix's strategy for the future. Our first product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008 and has since expanded to all relevant connected screens in the home, including TV’s, streaming sticks, and operator set-top boxes. Our reach and ease-of-use is enhanced through strong partnerships with many of the world's most innovative partners such as Sony, Panasonic, J:COM, and KDDI. In this role, you will help ensure we continue our strong innovation and partnership with our biggest partners in Japan.

About the role: 
In order to help our partners add the Netflix instant streaming service quickly to their device, we work very closely with these engineering teams to quickly overcome any and all challenges. We are looking to add to our team in APAC that currently works with local partners on integration, certification and in field phases of a product. You’ll apply your experience in software development to a wide variety of technical challenges to achieve the goal of helping our Japanese partners bring their products to market on time with the highest quality. The functionality of our platform includes streaming and playback, dynamic UI, payments, security and partner-specific adaptation for new types of devices. Willingness to travel to Netflix’s Los Gatos, CA headquarters to interface with the internal engineering teams, as well as periodic travel to Japan to develop and maintain strong ties with our partners. 

Our culture is a bit unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix at https://jobs.netflix.com/life-at-netflix

Required skills and attributes:

  • You are an experienced and current C/C++ programmer.
  • 5+ years of relevant experience integrating applications into complex embedded platforms.
  • You know what's important when releasing software to partners – ideally, you have worked as a software developer producing as well as consuming an SDK (Software Development Kit).
  • You're comfortable with proactive outward communication and technical leadership. 
  • You enjoy working side by side with partners on tough and ambiguous problems. Experience working with partners is a plus.
  • Ideally, you have a deep background in one or more of the following: embedded system development, Linux system-level programming, audio/video playback, embedded graphics, or UI programming. 
  • Experience with Android application and Android framework development is a plus.

607794c6b5811bf08f7dcdf2.description:
What you might not know about Netflix is just how much goes into building the world’s leading Internet TV network, and the technical innovation behind our storytelling. At the core of award winning content is our engineering team who imagines, creates, and delivers the technology that entertains the world.

As a recruiting team, we focus on finding great talent, anticipating business needs, and coaching our hiring partners to hire successfully. We don’t solely focus on metrics to determine a researcher’s success. Instead we also look at the qualitative impact in the form of coaching moments, successful long-term hires, and driving a forward-thinking streamlined recruiting strategy. We look for people who push the status quo, and enjoy spending their time finding smart and creative ways to source and attract talent. Our culture empowers people to think outside of the box, breaking the standard “recruiting process mold”. You will be empowered to be innovative when you think a process is inefficient and you’ll have peers who do the same.

 In this role, you will lead a team of researchers who are responsible for  identifying, engaging and attracting top engineering talent that is key to the growth, success, and innovation of Netflix. In order to do this successfully it will require a high degree of influencing, critical thinking and strong collaboration with your team, engineering leadership and your colleagues on the talent acquisition team. 

In this role, you will:

  • Hire and lead the industry’s best technical sourcers with compassion and with a global mindset 
  • Be a critical inclusion & diversity thought partner to your team and engineering leaders. Determine a plan for increasing representation within engineering 
  • Coach and advise your team as they partner with hiring managers and recruiters to develop strategies for attracting engineering talent 
  • Understand how to best use qualitative and quantitative data to influence decisions and continuously improve our overall effectiveness
  • Help engineering scale sourcing and interviewing efforts to become more efficient while also preserving aspects of hiring that lead to strong candidate experience and high offer acceptance rates 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years leading sourcing teams with 5+ years experience in technical sourcing
  • You have experience using sourcing tools and applicant tracking systems to identify and engage passive, qualified candidates and manage them through the hiring process
  • You have the ability to lead with empathy and compassion while setting a high bar for performance
  • You are fluent  with data and eager to get creative and curious about metrics that highlight opportunity
  • You have sourced and led teams through change and scale 
  • Experience working with both centralized and decentralized sourcing models

6014c25baabfb4f1d8882a3c.description:
Netflix has been changing the way people watch shows and movies. We strive to deliver a great Netflix viewing experience in over 190 countries so our customers can watch whatever, whenever, interruption free. Join us to help Netflix grow into the world's leading producer of premium content. Our Offices and Creative Spaces network engineering team designs, builds and operates networks to connect our internal users, creatives, production teams and partners around the world. We are looking for a Technical Project Manager that can own the successful execution of multiple build and deployment initiatives in parallel as we scale and expand our footprint around the globe. You will leverage your technical expertise and experiences, develop an understanding of Netflix and our customer and internal partner needs, and with your peers execute to deliver network connectivity and services to our users and offices around the world. 

Job Description

  • Partner with engineers, business and technical leaders, and real estate partners from internal and external teams to deliver networks to Netflix creative and business users
  • Work cross-functionally with internal teams and external vendors to plan and manage our growth around the globe
  • Own and maintain our backlog of network build and deployment projects globally 
  • Maintain and evolve milestones and a project framework to ensure timelines and deliverables are met
  • Socialize project timelines and maintain accountability on deliverables
  • Apply an understanding of networks, facility construction and build-out, as well as project management within the domain of network infrastructure deployment, engineering and operations
  • Work with VARs to manage logistic pipelines for network deployments
  • Work with VARs for asset management and licensing renewals
  • Work with management on FP&A for enterprise networking spend

Professional Qualifications

  • At least 5 years of relevant professional experience
  • Experience managing and working with engineering teams collectively
  • Sharp assessment skills with an ability to evaluate wants vs. needs and ability to negotiate prioritization accordingly
  • Knowledge of facilities construction planning and program management
  • Experience in asset tracking, asset management, and general logistics
  • Understanding of networking technologies, roles, functions and basic capabilities

Organizational Qualifications

  • Self organize, participate in cross-functional projects with our partners  
  • See a problem or opportunity, take ownership and act on it independently
  • Collaborate and manage efforts with peers and teams across responsibility areas, languages, geography and time zones
  • Be a self-starter, curious and not afraid to ask when in doubt
  • Clearly communicate status on project milestones, risks, blockers to critical path items and hold team members accountable for deliverables

Additional Requirements

  • Occasional travel
  • Experience working in media and studio environments is a plus

6151ef5caabfb4624ad77a7d.text: Engineering Manager, Creative Compute and Storage
6151ef5caabfb4624ad77a7d.description:
Netflix is one of the largest content creating studios in the world. The Creative Compute and Storage team mission is to develop an infrastructure platform that best supports the needs of our global creative population, helping them to work more effectively, efficiently, worry less about technology and more about sharing amazing stories with our members. We are working in the space between the public cloud and on-premise infrastructure, allowing us to bring utility to creative technologies and enable a globally connected content ecosystem. We are looking for an engineering leader to be part of that team, lead and work with some of the best and brightest talent in this space.  

As an Engineering Manager, you will lead portions of the development and build-out of our infrastructure platforms. You will work with internal engineering teams, technical creatives, production teams and external vendors around the world to deliver amazing technology experiences for our creatives. We are looking for an experienced engineering background that brings a broad set of technical knowledge, achievements and a development focused mindset to solving problems.

Be sure to review our culture page and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team.

In this role you will...

  • Have deep experience with development of an infrastructure platform, including product strategy, roadmaps and workflows.
  • Partner with engineers, business and technical leaders, and internal and external partner teams to design and build a technology infrastructure platform at global scale
  • Build, lead, develop and mentor a team of systems and software development engineers across multiple countries, time zones and technical disciplines
  • Look for opportunities to simplify the designs, operations, and deployment plans; reduce complexity while providing performance, agility, and scalability
  • Lead through ambiguity and be comfortable making decisions despite incomplete information or requirements.
  • Drive the team’s strategic direction and lead with a hands-on approach to problem solving; providing context, but enable the individual team members to lead their projects and initiatives.

About You

  • Infrastructure development and engineering experience in networking, systems and storage across tens of sites with hundreds of nodes per site
  • Experience leading a team of engineers and developers and growing to be multiple teams focused on very focused initiatives
  • Deep technical knowledge and hands-on experience with implementation, design, monitoring, and troubleshooting of systems and networks Be a self-starter, curious and not afraid to ask when in doubt
  • Experience and understanding of how to drive effectiveness and efficiency through automation and infrastructure-as-code
  • Sharp assessment skills with the ability to decipher “wants” versus “needs” and comfortable negotiating prioritization accordingly
  • Experience driving teams through large scale projects, identifying milestones and tracking deliverablesSelf organize and experience driving cross-functional efforts with external teams
  • See a problem or opportunity, take ownership and act on it independently
  • Collaborate and manage efforts with peers and teams across responsibility areas, languages, geography and time zones

61122b087a9df84ef4315e18.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming video service with over 200 million paid accounts and many more users in 190 countries. It's an exciting time to be working on Android at Netflix. Our members in international markets already outnumber domestic subscribers and we’re only getting started! Android engineering sits at the intersection of this accelerated global growth, compounded with an ever increasing use of mobile devices for streaming content. We love every minute of the complex engineering, product and operational concerns which come with building at this scale.

We are responsible for creating a personalized member experience through extensive A/B testing on a wide variety of devices by building highly performant and often custom experiences. We work on data driven optimizations in a diverse and sometimes unforgiving device and network ecosystem. We also create foundational client infrastructure used as building blocks for A/B tests and tie it all together with sophisticated testing and automation tools designed to support our high performance, fast paced culture of experimentation, autonomy and ownership.

In this role, you will lead a team of senior engineers to create the underpinnings of Android product engineering at Netflix. Solutions built by this team solve for shared opportunities across engineering teams in the areas of UI infrastructure, app architecture and developer frameworks working in sync with insightful release and production tooling.

Some qualities we're looking for -

  • Prior experience with owning roadmaps in service of product engineering teams through close cross functional collaboration with design, data and product partners.
  • Expertise in leading the development of shipped client infrastructure leveraged by a large and complex consumer offering.
  • Familiarity with the needs of continuous integration, automation infrastructure and developer ergonomics of a large and growing group of Android engineers.
  • Understanding of the engineering challenges accompanying frequently released and extensively A/B tested apps which are developed collaboratively with multiple teams.
  • Experience with hiring, supporting, coaching and growing senior engineers who are domain and platform experts.
  • Self starter engineering leader with a consistent history of proactively proposed and measurably delivered impact for the business.
  • Deep technical and product insight used to support objective data informed decisions backed by frequently published rationale and organizational buy-in.
  • Favor an action biased, feedback rich and results driven style of servant leadership that is deeply empathetic to the needs of the people, product and teams at Netflix.
In this role, you will work with other senior, high performing engineers and leaders where you will be constantly challenged by novel problems. We pay top of market with excellent benefits. Help evolve the way people watch content online. The Netflix culture. Not just a memo, but something we practice daily.

61402b367a9df8452bd4b2c7.text: Engineering Manager, User Focused Security Engineering
61402b367a9df8452bd4b2c7.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.
 
The Team
The User Focused Security Engineering team builds tools and products that help our workforce understand and participate in security. Our team aims to make security easy and accessible for all of our employees. Our innovative approach embraces Netflix's culture. As we operate, we consider tenants of our culture like "Freedom and Responsibility" and "Context not Control." We give our employees context about their work and what security risks are present rather than imposing blanket policies and restrictions. Equipped with security context, our employees have the freedom to make the right choices for Netflix but are also active participants and responsible for keeping Netflix secure. 

The Role
We are looking for an experienced leader who is passionate about creating excellent experiences for our users. As an Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for leading and setting the vision and direction for the team. You will provide context that empowers the team to build excellent experiences and products for our users. The team is centralized and highly cross-functional, you’ll foster healthy relationships with partner teams.

More about you

  • You have experience leading a high-performing team. 
  • You connect your team with business context rather than tightly controlling decisions.
  • You love building diverse, inclusive, and high-performing teams.

60f6f7cbb5811bdba223ec89.text: Data Science and Engineering Manager, Studio Production
60f6f7cbb5811bdba223ec89.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment and shaping the evolution of storytelling around the world. We deliver billions of hours of movies and shows per month to more than 200 million accounts globally, reaching new audiences every day. Our data-driven culture allows us to continuously innovate and provide the best experience for our diverse member base.

The Studio Data Science and Engineering team at Netflix is a talented group of analytics engineers, data engineers and data scientists who help scale our rapidly expanding Studio efforts. We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of creating more joy for our members. We work with Production leaders across Physical production, VFX, Post-production and Animation. Our stakeholders and culture support data-driven decision making and this uniquely positions us to innovate in the Production space.
We are looking for a seasoned leader for the team that works closely with our Studio partners and product management teams to drive innovation in the production space using solutions founded in data science, analytics and data engineering.

There has been significant progress made in answering critical questions including, but not limited to: How do we plan for resources for areas like VFX and Post Production? How do we predict what budgets might look like given our upcoming content mix? How do we provide effective visibility into the many aspects of production and meaningfully build metrics to inform decisions? The leader would set the team’s roadmap and charter to continue to drive significant impact for Netflix in the Studio space.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead & hire a world-class team of data scientists and analysts
  • Partner with various technical and creative stakeholders to define and execute on the team roadmap and charter
  • Drive significant impact for Netflix in the Studio space
  • Embody and steward the Netflix culture

This role is for you if:

  • You have been leading data science, analytics and data engineering teams for 7+ years.
  • You have a proven track record of working with novel problem spaces, have built and mentored teams and driven significant impact for your organization.
  • You are a deeply empathetic people leader focused on innovation and impact.
  • You excel at partnering with business & creative teams as much as you do with technical teams, and your partners consider you a strong thought leader.
  • You have deep technical expertise in analytics, and one or more aspects of data science (machine learning, statistics, experimentation, etc).

611d3cbd7a9df8ff55314e5f.text: Engineering Manager, Big Data Warehouse and Metadata Platform
611d3cbd7a9df8ff55314e5f.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by creating content people love and bringing joy to people around the world. 

As Netflix continues to innovate on its product and grow its member base, we also have a strategic goal to build a globally connected and data-informed studio that can manage hundreds of productions simultaneously. The scale and challenges of integrating production and studio data with the product data are unprecedented in the industry. 

In this mission, the data platform is at the core of Netflix’s success. The big data warehouse team is part of the data platform team. It is responsible for two key missions. We aspire to build an intelligent big data warehouse that works like a product to abstract the details of managing large datasets typically needed from its users in a large-scale big data environment. We are also building a coherent data strategy across Netflix. We are in the midst of devising the long term strategy and roadmap for our cross-organizational data governance initiatives by innovating on a Netflix-wide metadata platform. Here is the team's charter that has more details on the missions of this team. 

We are looking for a strong leader to make a big impact on both of these fronts. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates. We value what you can do, from anywhere in the US. 

Specifically, you will:

  • Drive the vision, evolution, and innovation of the intelligent big data warehouse and metadata platform initiatives.
  • Collaborating with all leaders in the data platform team and partners’ organizations to define the right scope in which to deliver the right product at the right time.
  • Be a technical advisor working alongside the team to build a cohesive ecosystem of systems/services to advance the team charter.
  • Lead and grow an inclusive and high-performing team where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the team’s mission. 
  • Helping and enabling engineers to grow and flourish in a relatively flat engineering organization. 

You find joy and have experience in:

  • Collaborating with partners to strategize, crystalize and build long-term roadmaps for ambiguous business needs. 
  • Leading cross functional and cross team projects and bringing it to successful completion.
  • Building and operating large-scale distributed services for use by other teams; ideally with experience in cloud-based platforms.
  • Building and leading a team of engineers; ideally with experience leading remote employees. Understanding team needs and learning new approaches to increase representation through additive hiring.
  • Exercising strong judgment and making thoughtful decisions with ambiguous situations. Striking the right balance between providing context vs. giving direction. Trading off short-term wins vs. long-term success based on various constraints. 
Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility and the accountability to do the right thing for Netflix. Read more about the Netflix culture here.

615210257a9df8b31cd4b7ee.text: Senior Technical Program Manager, Information Security Engineering
615210257a9df8b31cd4b7ee.description:
At Netflix we do one thing - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content at a massive scale. We have a strong engineering organization that enables us to achieve these business objectives and a unique and creative culture that guides us to operate with “Freedom and Responsibility”. This helps keep engineering velocity high, but also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility to do the right thing for Netflix. Instead of controlling engineers with process and security gates, we enable them to build secure code and provide them with adequate security context to make the right decisions for Netflix.

The Team
The Information Security Engineering Program Management team is a force multiplier for the Infosec organization; we partner closely with engineering teams across Netflix to deliver impactful and scalable security initiatives. The team is also a key driver for the success of Infosec’s partnership program which aims at enabling our customers and stakeholders to meet their goals in a secure way. We collaborate with leaders inside and outside the Infosec organization to align on strategic goals and vision to further the security roadmaps for our partnering teams in a business driven way. We then work with the right stakeholders to establish and drive initiatives that move the needle on this. 

The Opportunity
You will drive large, at-scale security initiatives across multiple stakeholders ranging from central engineering, studio leadership and teams, product managers, engineering managers, and developers. It is a great opportunity to help mature the security posture in the most rapidly growing parts of our business and gain intimate knowledge of Netflix’s security products and services. 

We are hiring for technical program manager roles in three domains. For each of these roles, we are leaning into the “T” (Technical) for this role. By technical, we mean that the ideal candidate has a strong understanding of each of these domains and ability to gain a technical understanding of programs across their lifecycle. Each domain will require the TPMs to have both strategy and execution skills. 
This job posting is inclusive of a variety of positions within the Information Security Engineering Program Management team. Based on your background, expertise and interests, we will route you to the appropriate position supporting one of these domains:

Identity and Access - The role is to drive the Identity and Access strategic programs that require engineering alignment across the company. Onboard, one of the first initiatives you will be responsible for is the execution of our new authentication strategy for Netflix’s workforce and partner ecosystem. This program focuses on consolidating our identity providers and paving the way for  the next generation adaptive authentication and authorization. 

Vulnerability Management - The role is to evolve and drive the vision of Vulnerability Management at Netflix. You’ll be responsible for crafting and executing the overall program including quarterly roadmaps and working with numerous stakeholders, from across infosec and engineering, on how to reduce the risk from vulnerabilities across the Netflix ecosystem. You’ll explore and solve vulnerability management challenges in a dynamic engineering environment that will expose you to the entire breadth of Netflix assets and technologies.

Studio Security - The role is to support the Studio Information Security team that is primarily focused on providing a balanced approach to securing our environment as Netflix builds and supports a world class studio. You will be responsible to manage and execute key initiatives in Studio Information Security and drive methodical delivery for the team. The Technical Program Manager will manage cross functional initiatives across multiple stakeholders ranging from Studio leadership and teams, product managers, and engineering managers.

Desired Background

  • You are passionate about leading by influence. This role requires advocating for change with a variety of teams in Netflix’s unique culture. 
  • You have a demonstrated ability to establish a vision and to execute on it.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience.
  • You are able to triage multiple initiatives to make a judgment to tackle the right problems at the right time.
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs technology tradeoffs.
  • You have developed and driven security initiatives such as building platform wide authentication systems, authorization at scale, vulnerability management, etc. 
  • You have an understanding of technical foundations in identity and access management, cloud infrastructure security, third party risk or security in general. 

Finally, here’s a few more reasons why we love this work, and think that you will too:

  • You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful security work for the Netflix engineering ecosystem.
  • You will be working with an industry leading security team with many opportunities to improve existing projects and identify new ones.
  • You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share them across the community.
  • You enjoy learning and working closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, data science and engineering, content delivery networks, and a production studio.
We are looking for thoughtful security professionals who enable our mission and support our culture of freedom and responsibility. You can learn more about life at Netflix by watching our security talks or exploring our open source work.

60ec7e7d7a9df85f6c315b51.description:
Netflix is a global company, and we are building a globally distributed creative studio to make more of our own content to bring joy to every one of our members. Producing content at scale is a complicated creative process that involves many steps taken by many creative and operational teams. With these teams scattered across the globe, it's the infrastructure, tooling, and automation we provide that keeps them connected, creating, and sharing. To be successful, we strive to support the creative process and stay out of the artist's way.

The Production Systems Engineering team builds and supports systems solutions to unblock artists at NetFX and Netflix Animation Studios (NAS).  Specifically, the focus areas include content creation applications, rendering, storage,  remote workstations, and enabling artists to collaborate globally. In addition, we work closely with peer engineering teams in Digital Production and Animation Technologies, Platform Engineering, and the other central engineering teams at Netflix to integrate new products into the studio.

About the Role:

We’re seeking a Manager to lead the systems engineers dedicated to NetFX and the software engineers focused on infrastructure common to NetFX and NAS. This role will also partner closely with the Director of Production Systems Engineering to ensure solutions best serve NetFX and NAS. You will be trusted by your team and the organization to make impactful decisions, provide support through mentorship and coaching, and contribute to a safe and inclusive working environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Leadership: lead, and grow a team of engineers leveraging cloud technologies to build the foundations of the global studio.
  • Vision: influence product design and implementation to deliver cutting-edge functionality to artists.
  • Strategy: define an operations strategy in collaboration with product engineering teams, studio production teams, and technical support teams.
  • Inclusion: create an environment where different backgrounds, cultures, industry and life experiences are embraced and valued.

Qualifications:

  • You have had multiple experiences leading and building customer-centric and innovative technical teams, including systems and software engineers.
  • You are an expert in fostering strong partnerships and collaborating cross-functionally with Production and Engineering teams.
  • You have a solid foundational understanding of IT infrastructure, networking, remote/virtual desktop technology, cloud computing, as well as familiarity with DevOps and data analytics tools.
  • You are very familiar with the data access patterns of digital content creation workflows and rendering orchestration in the context of visual effects and animation studios.
  • You have led through ambiguity and are comfortable making decisions despite incomplete information and/or requirements.
For more information on what it’s like to work at Netflix, please take a look at our culture memo!

614e46f87a9df8ee1bd4b1a8.text: Senior Software Engineer - Client & UI ENG
614e46f87a9df8ee1bd4b1a8.description:
Who We Are
Our purpose is to build meaningful bonds between fans and the Netflix content through new personal and vibrant experiences. We're here to help people discover and celebrate our shared love for TV, movies and Pop Culture.

Our focus will be building a web based experience for both desktop and mobile browsers. As part of our day-to-day work, we collaborate with product teams, peer platform engineering groups & marketing partners to deliver an experience that allows people to connect with the content that they love. 

Who You Are

  • An open and proactive communicator who shares context, ideas, and feedback while also engaging in active listening.
  • A generalist who can effectively collaborate with partners from across the company with various backgrounds and points of view. 
  • A systems thinker who can reason through the interactions of complex systems and services and understand technical tradeoffs.
  • Someone who is self-directed. Our team sets up our own processes and drives technical decisions.

What sets you apart?

  • You take into consideration and value technical areas to support a web based application at scale. 
  • You can work through ambiguous requirements to produce elegant solutions. 
  • Passion for frontend technologies. You have interest in learning React, TypeScript, and/or GraphQL.

Learn More

  • We believe safe spaces where everyone can be their authentic selves is the key to a successful team so we welcome and embrace all identities, cultures, and backgrounds.
  • Our US-based team is happy to embrace remote work. 
Want to hear more about what it’s been like to join Netflix as a remote engineer? 
Lucero Carmona is the Engineering Manager for this team and has shared her experience on joining a remote team in a recent episode of Front End Happy Hour. 

About Us
Netflix is a global entertainment company with over 200M members around the world. The Client and UI Engineering organization is passionate about building fantastic customer experiences on every internet-connected device imaginable. We live and breathe our freedom & responsibility culture.
