The Creative Technologies team at Netflix advocates for best practices and high production standards and evolves the tools and craft of motion picture production. From on-set to post production and final delivery, our team consists of experts in cameras, sound, data management, image science, editorial, color grading, VFX, virtual production, animation, and more.  

We are seeking a Team Administrative Assistant to provide support for our Creative Technologies group in Los Angeles. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and attention to detail. This is a position that require good judgment and significant initiative in engaging with internal and external parties. The team admin aims to create a productive environment for the rest of the team, and plays a significant role in contributing to a collaborative and open work experience, and keeping this global team united. 

As part of the Creative Technologies & Infrastructure team, you will be impactful by:

  • Maintaining calendars for a team of engineering managers including booking and confirming meetings.   
  • Scheduling meetings, internally and externally.
  • Managing shipment, receipt and return of equipment.     
  • Tracking projects and their status.
  • Taking notes in meetings and circulating information to the greater team.
  • Coordinating travel arrangements (domestic and international) and other administrative duties (i.e. processing travel and expense reports, digital and physical filing, etc...).
  • Navigating a heavy volume of internal and external  communications.   
  • Creating presentations and documents using Google Workspace.   
  • Assisting  with team projects and events as needed.
  • Coordinating team events. 

Experience you’re bringing with you:

  • 2+ Years as an assistant, production assistant, coordinator.  
  • Studio/Entertainment/Production and/or Technology Experience.
  • Understanding of production and post-production process.
  • Interest in technology and a love of sound and the moving image.
  • Events experience.
  • Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly.   
  • A love for collaboration. 
  • Naturally well organized with a knack for finding inefficiencies and a strong will to fix them.

Role Description

Bay Area, California/Remote, North America only

Web Foundation is a small team with a big mandate: developing, maintaining, and innovating the NodeJS and browser UI platform that powers Netflix.com. The Netflix website is composed of a collection of consumer UI applications and the web platform provides the infrastructure and unifying architecture to support these applications. Along with developing one of the largest licensed streaming platforms globally, our team provides support and guidance to the 50+ engineers building the Netflix UI experience on both the growth and streaming side of the business.

In this role, you will work on a large-scale NodeJS application that encompasses signup, streaming, and the member experience on the Netflix web platform. Some examples of projects you may work on include improving a JS/CSS asset compiler, optimizing network performance via HTTP/2, creating a logging library for UI clients, and identifying and fixing bottlenecks in the NodeJS build system. Along with solving complex engineering problems, you will lead projects where you’ll have the opportunity to work with many UI teams driving innovation and identifying opportunities for improvement to the UI infrastructure.

People who do well in this role are self-motivated, former UI engineers who relish complex technical challenges but find deep satisfaction in supporting their fellow developers. We look for individuals with in-depth knowledge of Javascript and who understand the nuances of large-scale codebases. A proven ability to lead projects and communicate with cross-functional partners are essential skills for this role. 

We believe talent is equally distributed but opportunities are not. Our US-based team is happy to embrace remote work and our general support hours are 10am - 4pm Pacific Time. We believe safe spaces where everyone can be their authentic selves is the key to a strong team so we welcome and embrace all identities, cultures, and backgrounds.

Primary responsibilities

  • Facilitating architecture discussions and providing best practices to UI engineers
  • Measuring and tuning the production environment
  • Championing projects and conveying impact to partner teams
  • Soliciting feedback and building a roadmap based on partner needs
  • Evolving the web platform to be best in class

Technical Skills

  • Ability to break down abstract problems into concrete solutions
  • Able to identify and componentize common abstractions
  • Passion for frontend technologies. You need to be able to distill hype from practical application
  • Eye for performance and stability of large-scale systems
  • Self-directed. Our team sets and implements our roadmap. No PMs here.

What sets you apart?

  • You have experience in GraphQL, TypeScript, and/or PWAs
  • Expert at managing large-scale web applications
  • Experience in building frameworks and libraries from scratch
  • You’re an advocate for best practices and newer technologies
  • Current/former professional experience as a UI engineer
  • You’re known for your excellent communication skills

Aspects Which May Be Appealing

  • Influencing decisions that impact millions of users and billions of requests
  • Advocating for improvements to system-level architecture
  • Working with peers that are top of their field

Take a peek at your future colleagues: 

Darren James
Darren is a co-author of the book Ajax in Action and is a Senior Software Engineer on the Web Foundation team.

Michael Ridgway
Mike is the creator of the popular hoist-non-react-statics library and is a Senior Software Engineer on the Web Foundation team.

Tim Branyen
Tim is a noted open source contributor and is a Senior Software Engineer on the Web Foundation team. 

Jem Young
Jem is a co-host of the podcast Frontend Happy Hour and is the Engineering Manager of the Web Foundation team.


About Us

Netflix is a global entertainment company with over 200M members around the world. The Client and UI Engineering organization is passionate about building fantastic customer experiences on every internet-connected device imaginable. We live and breathe our freedom & responsibility culture.

614139e77a9df8dba5d4b7cc.description:
The Android Product Engineering organization is responsible for continuously improving the Netflix Android experience to delight, attract, and retain our members. We are looking for a product-minded engineering leader who is passionate about building great customer experiences and adaptable, inclusive teams. You will be part of a cross-functional group of product managers, designers, data scientists, researchers, and engineers leading the evolution of our Android experiences across the Netflix app and key canvases in our newly-launched games initiative. 

Primary responsibilities

  • You are an experienced engineering leader comfortable with technical details and you use this knowledge to advocate for industry-leading engineering excellence
  • You have a demonstrated understanding of hiring, retaining and growing high performing teams through significant technical and product complexities
  • You’ve partnered closely with cross-functional teams and functions to propose, evolve and deliver large products built by several teams
  • You’ve built and scaled teams responsible for highly visible and fast moving apps which are frequently released to millions of users around the world
  • You have experience leading emerging market offerings, data-driven discussions, large technical infrastructure and product engineering initiatives across multiple teams
  • You are a strong communicator with exceptional listening skills, you can operate independently, challenge the status quo and you always play for the larger team

What sets you apart?

  • You establish and reinforce a clear technical vision with your team. You have experience making smart investments in Android architecture to meet the demands of a rapidly growing user base across the world. You’ve learned the difference between building flexible systems that can adapt to business needs and unnecessarily complex systems that attempt to guess the future. 
  • You have a passion for the customer experience. As the most senior Android engineering voice on the cross-functional product leadership team, you are always thinking about the user experience implications of what your team is experimenting on.
  • You are a thought partner to your business stakeholders and successfully influence product direction. Your ideas are actively sought out by Product Managers (PMs). You can take a conceptual idea and transform it into an actionable test that is both feasible and meets business needs. 
  • You can effectively prioritize and make tough trade-offs. You seek to understand other parts of the business, their limitations, and where product sensitivities lie. You balance competing concerns and make tough calls on where to cut scope vs. invest more heavily, and how to make resourcing trade-offs across multiple PMs.
  • You embrace adaptability and flexibility. You are always looking for creative ways to keep your team nimble, and foster a culture that embraces change. 

What leadership skills are important to us?

  • Strong judgment - a key element of our trust-based culture is relying on leaders to apply good judgment to the numerous decisions across all the areas they’re responsible for. When you make mistakes, you learn from them and transparently share with others so that we all improve and learn.
  • Thoughtful people management - you must be thoughtful and intentional in how you go about identifying, growing and managing the talent on your team. This includes both IC engineers and engineering managers.
  • Inclusion and empathy - your direct team and cross-functional partners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and cultures. As the leader of the team, you set the standard for inclusivity on multiple dimensions, and lead with empathy to help your team work through challenging situations both professionally and personally. 
  • Clear communication - clear and direct written and verbal communication are a must for any leader at Netflix, and especially so for senior leaders. You can take complex concepts and succinctly reframe them so that different audiences can engage and understand. 

Meet the team

  • View the team’s presentation on who they are and what they do (Haiyan)
  • Read about how we migrated our Android endpoints out of a monolith into a new microservice (Rohan and Ed)
  • See one of our pull requests for Epoxy (Emmanuel)
  • Read our take on Rx onError Guidelines (Ed)
  • See some of our work highlighted at a Netflix Women In Tech Event
About Us
Netflix is a global entertainment company with over 200M members across more than190 countries around the world. The mobile team’s goal is to make sure our members have something to watch or play on Netflix whenever, and wherever, they want to. Our freedom & responsibility culture isn’t just a memo, but something we practice daily.

6116d1ba7a9df8e2d731589c.text: Manager, Infrastructure, Data Science and Engineering
6116d1ba7a9df8e2d731589c.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment and shaping the evolution of storytelling around the world.  We deliver billions of hours of movies and shows per month to more than 200+ million accounts globally, reaching new audiences every day.  Netflix’s cloud infrastructure plays a pivotal role in making the product experience great for its global subscriber base.  We are a data-inspired company and we leverage data to make our product and the underlying infrastructure better.  
The Infrastructure focused Data Science & Engineering team enables software engineers to architect, scale and operate cloud infrastructure in a secure, efficient and reliable way and to secure subscribers and devices.  It also enables Neflix’s productive workforce to soar.  We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of future proofing Netflix as a business.  Check out this blog post to learn more about the area and some of the problems we're working on, and for more about our broader research and analytics work, you can visit the Netflix Research website.
You will lead a team within the Infrastructure Data Science and Engineering organization, a cross functional team of talented individual contributors with a diverse set of skills across analytics, data engineering, machine learning, modeling and experimentation to help scale data-powered innovation at Netflix.  You'll identify and build data products with an eye toward scaling analytics and access to insights to help improve Netflix's ability to stream to the world.
Infrastructure teams:

Core Data Science and Engineering (Hiring) - Responsible for making the Data Science and Engineering organization as productive as possible.  Partners closely with the Data Platform and other data and engineering teams to build productivity tooling, maintain highly reusable data sources, and promote innovation for data engineers, data analysts, data scientists, and other data professionals.

Platform Scale (Hiring) - Responsible for improving Netflix’s ability to scale the infrastructure to its global audience and evolving business needs.  Partners closely with Platform Engineering, InfoSec, Strategy and Finance, Demand Planning, and other engineering teams to add data insights to human and machine decision makers.  

Security (Hiring) - Responsible for securing Netflix’s information and application space.  Partners closely with InfoSec, AppSec, Legal, Data Platform, Networking, and other engineering teams to build scalable data solutions that improve Netflix’s trustworthiness and ability to meet regulatory requirements globally.  

Platform Innovation (Not Hiring) - Responsible for building leverage in the infrastructure that increased the productivity and innovation capabilities of our internal workforce.  Partners closely with Data Platform, Productivity tooling, and other engineering teams to create core datasets that expose patterns about the utilization and overall goodness of our tech stack, to enable automation, determine defaults, and allow for large scale migrations.

What will fill your days

  • Visionary: You intuitively understand business and technology and you leverage that to guide a team providing relevant context and inspiration.
  • Partnership: You establish strong relationships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix.
  • Technical Leadership: You lead from the front and are curious about the domain and able to find opportunities for impact to the business.
  • Recruiting: You are constantly on the lookout for talent and have a knack for recognizing and attracting top-tier engineers to your team. You understand the importance of building an amazing team and the value it brings to the overall company.
  • Feedback & Development:  You see people’s strengths/weaknesses and are both gifted and courageous in talking with them about it.

Character & qualities that will help you succeed

  • You’re willing to risk rejection. When you fail, you learn and are willing to try again.
  • You’re not afraid of hard conversations and sharing your perspective.
  • You embrace diversity in the workplace and you strive to seek diverse ideas and opinions.
  • You’re a creative revolutionary, forward thinking and proactive.
  • You possess a solid sense of business acumen.
  • You listen and communicate well.
  • You’re allergic to micromanagement. 
  • You prefer to give context, delegate, and watch amazing people exceed your hopes and expectations.
  • You’re a natural leader but your team and colleagues see your humility.

Who you are

  • You likely have a M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, Operations Research, etc. Technical publications and ties to academic communities are a plus.
  • You have hired and led cross functional data-focused teams comprised of engineers, analysts and scientists with diverse technical strengths.
  • You have experience building a technical vision.
  • You are an advocate for engineering excellence.
  • You have used big data technologies (i.e. Spark/MapReduce/Hadoop, etc…) at one point in your career and built large scale data pipelines.
  • You have a background in two or more of the following disciplines: software engineering, data analytics, statistics, modeling, machine learning, and experimentation. 
  • You have used SQL, Python and some reporting/visualization tools at one point in your career.
Culture
At Netflix, we build dream teams to solve real world complex business problems and set high expectations from each team member.   Everyone at Netflix cherishes the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment.  Our culture is unique and we strive to live by our values, so it's worth learning more about Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com.

612d07b8aabfb48a86d763a5.description:
Stories move us. They make us feel more emotion, see new perspectives, and bring us closer to each other. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are always looking to help you find your next favorite story.  We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 200 million paid subscribers.

Our story
Platform engineering is a team of stunning colleagues across the globe focused on providing technical products, tools, and services that enable Netflix to scale and innovate effectively and empower Netflix engineers to focus on building innovative experiences for our members and creators around the world. We deploy hundreds of services, on thousands of instances, across multiple regions, and millions of client devices.  Within Platform Engineering, the teams focused on core infrastructure focus on increasing agility, efficiency, and reliability across our compute, networking, and storage offerings, while reducing operational burden and enabling innovation for application owners.

The Role:
We are looking for an experienced product manager to partner with engineering to build product strategies, prioritized roadmaps, and clear product specifications for core infrastructure on which a majority of the various Netflix businesses run. Product Management is a new team in Platform Engineering and we’re on a mission to raise the level of product thinking across the organization. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Develop product roadmaps and specifications across cloud infrastructure offerings that inform engineering teams on objectives, scenario prioritization, and customer requirements,
  • Define longer-term product direction across cloud infrastructure that influences Platform-wide strategy
  • Partner with our customers (other internal Netflix engineering teams), to better understand their problems and work together to deliver needed solutions
  • Partner with other product managers to create cohesive strategies and roadmaps across organizational boundaries
  • Foster an environment that is customer-focused, data driven, and hypothesis/ experimentation based
  • Engage deeply with external communities to stay abreast of industry trends and innovations
  • Help evolve the product management discipline and practices within Platform engineering

What we are looking for:

  • 6+ years of experience in product management
  • A combination of deep technical knowledge and a customer-focused mindset
  • Demonstrated understanding of infrastructure technologies at scale, with deep expertise in one of compute, storage, or networking
  • Experience designing large scale production services in public or private cloud
  • Strategic thinker that can relate technology solutions to customer use cases
  • Comfortable handling and navigating ambiguity, working across different disciplines and teams, and applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to problem solve without perfect metrics
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Want to know more about our Cloud Infrastructure teams? Check out:

  • Opensourcing Titus
  • Disenchantment: Netflix Titus, Its Feisty Team, and Daemons
  • Evolution of Edge @Netflix
  • Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices
  • Performance Engineering YouTube channel
A few more things about us:
As a Platform team, we come from many different countries and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. Our team includes product managers, program managers, designers, full stack developers, distributed systems engineers, data scientists and folks have the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

614b9d017a9df824d5d4b254.description:
At Netflix, we are always on our way to bring even more joy to the members around the world. Within Product, we have a very high velocity in innovations within the core member experience and we never stop challenging ourselves and are constantly thinking about connecting with our members in new ways or even in new domains! 

Member Product Data Science and Engineering is at the forefront of these innovations. We are looking for accomplished data science and analytics leaders to join us. You’ll lead a team of talented data scientists that drive product innovations with our partner teams in product management & engineering via insights, behavioral research, causal inference & machine learning. You’ll be responsible for driving innovation roadmaps to improve our machine learning models and experimentation techniques. As leader of this team, you will also be a close partner to our business stakeholders and will help shape strategy. 

We're looking for

  • You have a deep technical background in applied data science, spanning some or all of: statistics, experimentation, machine learning, causal methods and behavioral analytics.
  • You likely have a M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, Operations Research, etc.  
  • You have demonstrated strength in applying statistics, experimentation, and modeling to applied business problems. 
  • You have experience in leading and building high-caliber, data focused teams with diverse technical strengths and more importantly are experienced in developing and fostering an inclusive team culture.  
  • You are skilled at operating in a complex, cross-functional organization or company where collaboration and integration with other teams across multiple disciplines is essential to the success of your team. 
  • You have exceptional communication skills, especially when partnering with business stakeholders to drive impact and shape strategy.
Netflix culture
Netflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

61312e963d6b623f4d607159.description:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment bringing moments of joy to 200+ million customers.  As we grow around the world, we have an increasing need to develop internal enterprise applications that cater to the needs of our customers - Netflix employees and the corporate teams.  The Enterprise Software Engineering (ESE) team is focused on building enterprise solutions to drive productivity, efficiency and effectiveness of our customers.  We are obsessed with user experience and like to build simple and intuitive products.  We focus on building business automation and deep interactive workflows that replace complex manual processes.

We are looking for a Product Designer to join the team and help build the next generation of enterprise products. In this role, you will focus on design strategy, vision and develop creative experiences for Netflix employees and corporate teams. 


About You:
You are curious, creative and have experience creating user focused designs.  You have a keen eye for rich interactive product experiences, act as a champion for the users and enable workflow optimizations through simple and intuitive designs. You are highly adaptable and when faced with challenges, you become more creative, not less. You are execution oriented and bring projects from concept to completion, doing everything possible to ensure successful product launches. 

You have a can-do attitude. You’re smart, confident and a skilled communicator who welcomes honest and candid feedback. You use data and experimentation to select the best designs for our customers. You partner with PMs, engineers and stakeholders to evangelize creative design solutions and bring these to fruition. You champion adoption of best design practices to keep our products on the cutting edge of innovation.

Responsibilities:

  • Quickly develop a deep understanding of Netflix Enterprise domains.
  • Juggle multiple projects by leading and creating design experiences. 
  • Lead user research to gain deeper understanding of and empathy for our user pain points.
  • Empathy for user experience and creating highly interactive user flows.
  • Understand user challenges and communicate design concepts through storytelling.
  • Iterate on designs in close collaboration with product managers, engineering and business partners.
  • Develop trusting relationships with PM, engineering, and stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with engineering throughout the development cycle to iterate on and deliver highest quality product experiences.

Requirements:

  • BA/BS in fine arts, graphic arts, human factors or equivalent experience. 
  • 4+ years creating consumer-friendly interactive designs.
  • A great portfolio that showcases deep interaction design skills with an emphasis on simple and intuitive designs concepts
  • Able to rapidly produce multiple UX/UI concepts   
  • Strong communication style to clearly articulate your concepts with rationale—and evangelize on users behalf.  
  • Experience designing web and mobile products.
  • Design with an ability to balance short term and long term product goals
  • Experience designing consumer and/or enterprise products

60f757e23d6b62ca0a83304f.description:
We are looking for a lead-level product designer to push the boundaries of mobile games on Netflix. Collaborating with the world’s best game developers, we leverage our product expertise to design experiences where viewers interact and engage with gaming content in memorable ways. This role will work closely with a talented team of designers, product managers, engineers and external game partners to help millions of members around the world discover and enjoy their next interactive game on Netflix. 

About You
You’re equally comfortable defining new UX patterns and UIs in order to help our team expand the definition of “interactive" across Netflix. You balance a passion for games and designing gorgeous and emotionally resonant products with a strong desire of understanding user behavior and success through data and consumer insights. When faced with limits and ambiguity, you become more — not less — creative. You love this zone. You bring projects from concept to completion, doing everything possible to ensure their success. 

You’re smart, confident, highly competent—and humble enough not to have an ego. You’re a skilled communicator who welcomes honest, candid feedback, and your first instinct is to collaborate with others to challenge and make your ideas even better. You partner with a cross-functional team to oversee the experience from conception to launch (and then some).

Responsibilities

  • Initiate, define and lead innovation initiatives and features from concept through launch.
  • Collaborate with a small team of designers and prototypers to explore, test, and evolve interactive experiences on Netflix.
  • Partner with external game studios and partners to design and implement new platform features that can be utilized at scale. 
  • Own the full-stack design process—from blue sky exploration to UX specs to polished UI designs to working with engineers to implement a flawless experience.
  • Develop and maintain positive relationships and collaborations with Product Managers, Engineering, Consumer Insights, and Game Studio partners. 
  • Help to create a strong interactive design point-of-view and help cross-functional teams clearly understand the vision. 

Qualifications

  • 8+ years of experience designing product features for games platforms
  • Deep understanding of game production methodologies, technologies and gaming industry trends.
  • Multiple successful game platform product/feature launches that drove meaningful impact to the business.
  • A versatile portfolio that showcases deep interaction and visual design skills 
  • Ability to quickly produce a great range of UX/UI concepts, as well as go deep to identify edge cases. 
  • The communication skills to clearly articulate your concepts—and evangelize on their behalf.
  • Experience with A/B testing and using data to inform design decisions is a plus.
  • Proven leadership and strategic ability to drive initiatives and projects.
  • Figma experience and working with established design systems is a plus A love of movies, TV shows and interactive media.

Why you’ll love it here:

  • Your work is enjoyed globally by 300M+ viewers (and growing) in 190 countries 
  • You are empowered to imagine what “interactive TV” means and create new delight for our members
  • You are surrounded by many talented people that you’re inspired by everyday   
  • On the spectrum from careful to reckless, we live right on the border of reckless (otherwise we’re not pushing boundaries)
  • You get control over how you approach solving problems

60ff9d683d6b629275832bab.description:
It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We’ve become one of the largest entertainment studios in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace.  The Studio Innovation product team is front and center of this growth. We build software that fuels the production and creation of Netflix content. The Animation Studio Technology team within Studio Innovation builds products that power the Netflix Animation Studio ecosystem. Netflix is on a path to release six animation feature films per year, which no major studio has ever done, on top of the very healthy slate of animation series.

About the Role:
We are seeking an experienced Technical Program Manager to join our Digital Productions and Animation Technologies (DPAT) Engineering team. The DPAT team builds products and services to power workflows for animated and live-action content creation. In this role, you will collaborate with Engineering, Product, Design, and numerous other cross-functional teams such as Platform, Infrastructure, and Security teams to drive complex strategic initiatives from inception to delivery. You have the opportunity to make a significant impact, and you’ll learn and grow alongside stunning colleagues who share your attention to detail and appetite for problem-solving.

Responsibilities:

  • Own and drive cross-functional execution of program deliverables.
  • Approach complex problems with a strategic perspective and develop strategies to address them.
  • Leverage your experience with various systems to improve overall engineering execution.
  • Proactively identify inefficiencies, risks, and gaps that stifle the program's progress and implement better and more efficient workflows.
  • Establish an overall plan for several teams to rally around by identifying the systems involved to build new solutions, align roadmaps, and weigh relative priorities.
  • Build strong subject matter knowledge to balance business demands with technological restrictions.
  • Assess and evaluate a program's technical implementation with engineering to determine the best strategy for the challenge at hand.
  • Drive complex technical discussions with audiences of varying technical and subject matter backgrounds.
  • Develop and own communication plans for communicating program status, big picture, challenges, and risks to stakeholders effectively and proactively.

Qualifications:

  • B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience
  • A strong understanding of working within product management, software engineering, or systems management
  • Deep experience working cross-functionally across several different product development teams and stake-holders to successfully build and deliver scalable solutions
  • Highly skilled, organized, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts: people, needs, and technologies
  • Operate autonomously across multiple teams, demonstrate critical thinking and thought leadership
  • Action-oriented and able to solve ambiguous, complex technical problems
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving experience with large-scale systems
  • Experience establishing trust and strong work relationships across multi-disciplinary teams and multiple partners
  • Comfortable collaborating and influencing a diverse set of people and teams to do what needs to get done and negotiate when approaches or timelines change.
  • Zoom in and out seamlessly to identify bottlenecks and stay focussed on the big picture. 
  • Love to dive into the technology aspect of a program, gaining rich context that enables you to be even more thoughtful and effective in making the initiative happen.
  • Drive the business forward through the programs you run
  • Stellar communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Knowledge of studio production is a plus 

Your Environment

  • You will be trusted by your team and the organization to make impactful decisions. We also provide support through mentorship and coaching.
  • You will contribute to a safe and inclusive environment by being curious and vulnerable.
  • We will learn how to build the best creative experience together.
For more information on what it’s like to work at Netflix, please take a look at our culture memo!

 Data Engineering Manager, Finance 
 Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment itself and pushing the limits of what it means to be a subscription business. From the Netflix Second Quarter 2021 Letter to Shareholders: "In Q2, revenue increased 19% year over year to $7.3 billion, while operating income rose 36% year over year to $1.8 billion. We finished the quarter with over 209m paid memberships, slightly ahead of our forecast ". 

With more than $25+ billion in revenues at Netflix, the Finance Data Engineering team (part of the larger Data Science and Engineering organization) plays a crucial role in supporting our business and finance teams to report numbers accurately while empowering them with analytical insights. This data is mission-critical. The team needs a Data Engineering Manager to help up-level and reimagine the financial data flows across various Netflix systems (ranging from upstream Revenue and Growth engineering and Finance technology teams to the impact of many experiments running continuously). You will be leading a team of incredibly talented data engineers. In addition, you will be partnering with many internal teams to help streamline our end-to-end systems for accuracy, efficiency, and analytical insights. 

To be successful in this role, you need a solid technical foundation, a passion for complex business data wrangling, and the ability to lead a team of experienced engineers. You also need to be great at giving and receiving feedback, fostering new ideas, and empowering others.

Responsibilities:

Recruiting: You are constantly looking for talent and have a knack for attracting top-tier engineers to your team. You also champion and value diversity on your teams.

Team Development: You see people’s strengths/weaknesses and are both gifted and courageous in talking with them about it. You love giving your teams a sense of identity.

Vision: You intuitively understand business and technology, and you demonstrate that knowledge to guide a team by providing meaningful context and inspiration.

Partnership: You establish strong relationships with both business and technical leaders across the company and have proven expertise in building and sustaining trust with partners.
 
  
 Who are you:
You derive energy from working with people - whether that involves 1:1s, partner sync ups, or chats with candidates. You are excited to learn more about folks and to work with them.
You love business complexity and building systems that simplify making sense of the numbers in a complex, ever-changing product landscape. 
You care deeply about compliance (e.g., SOX) and privacy. 
You are an advocate for raising the bar proactively and can convince teams about the criticality of these areas for Netflix.
You have preferably worked with Financial Accounting teams and understand their terminology and processes.
You can bridge the gap between engineering, data science, and business teams. 
You love to shape systems for the future. 
You can help us reimagine the Financial data flows in terms of inflows (the billions of dollars in revenue) and outflows (e.g., revshare, people costs, etc.)
You LOVE data of all sorts: big and small! 
You show thought leadership and partner effectively with our business and engineering teams to develop better metrics and more elegant insights.
You are passionate about engineering excellence, automation, self-service tooling, and building reusable components for multiple use cases and teams.

Netflix
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries that enjoy TV series, documentaries, and feature films in more than 30 different languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are always looking to help members find their next favorite story.

Our story
Platform Engineering is focused on providing technical products, tools, and services that enable Netflix to scale and innovate. We want to empower Netflix engineers to focus on building innovative experiences for our members and creators around the world. We deploy hundreds of services, on thousands of instances, across multiple regions, and millions of client devices. Platform Engineering Teams focus on increasing agility, efficiency, and reliability across our compute, networking, productivity, and data products.

Within Platform Engineering, the Data platform organization helps Netflix maximize the value of data by enabling teams to easily store, discover, and utilize data. The team provides data-related infrastructure for software engineering (e.g. data stores), data engineering (e.g. batch and stream processing), and analytics (e.g. Tableau).  Ensure that we appropriately account for broad concerns such as cost, privacy, and security. 

The Role
We are looking for an experienced technical program manager that will be focused on large cross-functional data infrastructure and big data-related programs that impact all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product managers, engineering managers, engineers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs. If you’re looking for a technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do

  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with technical teams (including product, engineering, UI/UX, Data Science, etc), that focus on building a scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure foundation
  • Leverage deep technical domain expertise to drive technical strategy, planning, and execution with engineering partners
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership
  • Champion breaking out OKRs into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays
  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly

What we are looking for: Functional Skills

  • You can partner with multiple cross-functional teams to define technical strategy and requirements
  • You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh in on product vs technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data-driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise
  • You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: cloud infrastructure, engineering productivity, or data

What we are looking for: Basic Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience driving large scale SW projects with engineering and product teams
  • 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or technical product/program management experience
  • Experience managing projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction

What we are looking for: Additive Qualifications

  • Experience in big data, compute platforms, data stores, analytics platforms, etc. 
  • Migration experience, moving from from on-prem to cloud architecture 
  • Data security/privacy architecture understanding

About the Engineering Support Organization
Productivity Engineering is forming a new team to serve as the frontline resource for all engineering support needs of our customers (i.e., our workforce). The Engineering Support Organization will be responsible for handling, troubleshooting, and resolving customer requests and issues. Not only is the team tasked with providing a high-quality customer support experience, but it will focus on ways of working, customer advocacy, support tooling, platform product offerings, and developer education. As the manager, you will have tremendous influence over this critical team’s formation, vision, development, and operations. With a centralized, dedicated team, Productivity Engineering will be better suited to scale to the ever-growing needs of the Netflix developer community. 

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Productivity Engineering, feel free to listen to this podcast.

The Role 
We are looking for a Support Engineering Manager with a passion for providing excellent customer service and building exceptional teams. You will be responsible for hiring and growing a team of Senior Support Engineers. The team charter includes monitoring and handling our customers’ requests, troubleshooting, solving issues, automating support needs, developing support documentation and runbooks, developing and maintaining support tools and infrastructure, and continuously seeking ways to improve our product offerings and the engineering support experience. Our ideal candidate has first-hand experience managing customer-facing, engineering support roles and has a breadth of experience across infrastructure, internal tooling, platforms, and cloud computing. You are excellent at understanding and solving complex and ambiguous problems and constantly seek improvement. You are an exceptional people manager who fosters a healthy culture of execution, inclusion, and learning.

Location
Remote is an option. We value what you can do from anywhere in the United States.
Our offices are located in Los Gatos.

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • You have managed engineering support teams and obsess over customer experience.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communications skills.
  • You have strong collaboration skills and excel at working cross-functionally.

61661ce3aabfb4c275d77083.description:
About Netflix

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

The Big Picture:

To support such a large subscriber base, we run a large, distributed, and ever-changing system. The Resilience Engineering team’s role is to make this complex system as well understood as possible to reduce the risk of making changes in our production environment. 

The Resilience Engineering team finds vulnerabilities, risks, and limits in our system before they lead to large-scale issues. To do this, we’ve built an Infrastructure Experimentation platform, which Netflix Engineers use to safely experiment with their services in production. Our platform runs controlled chaos, load, and software change experiments in production so that engineers can better understand the limits of their application and the Netflix ecosystem. 

Our production environment is complex, as are the platforms the team builds and operates. We are looking for an engineering manager to join our team that is comfortable with ambiguity, but also great at driving ambiguity down. We need someone that will help us realize the big opportunities we have in this evolving domain. As our team works closely with our partner teams at Netflix, being skilled at building relationships and cross-team collaboration is a must. We aren’t looking for someone that wants to write code or design systems, but it will be difficult for you to be successful if you don't understand how distributed systems work and what makes them fail, especially at scale.

Who you are:

  • You have a passion and proven track record for building and motivating teams to reach their potential
  • You lean on collaboration and continuous improvement
  • You strongly believe in transparency
  • You believe failure is a part of learning
  • You know how to build strong relationships with partners and stakeholders
  • You are familiar with Resilience and Reliability concepts

What you’ll do:

  • Create an environment where different backgrounds, cultures, industry and life experiences are embraced and valued
  • Create and promote a great work environment and positive team culture Build an exceptional team by recruiting, evaluating, and hiring stunning colleagues
  • Partner with the Resilience team engineers to create direction for the team and a plan that can be delivered on and iterated on as things change
  • Create strong partnerships to drive cross-functional projects forward
  • Influence experimentation infrastructure design and development to deliver trusted functionality serving a wide variety of use cases
  • Define a roadmap and execution strategy in collaboration with peer engineering teams, partners, and product management teams

At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing moments of joy to 200+ million customers. The Enterprise Software Engineering team drives productivity and operational efficiency for our corporate teams and the employees through business automation, workflow optimizations and targeted technology solutions. We focus on building custom enterprise applications that cater to the unique needs of our customers and keep our business functioning smoothly. 

We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead a suite of enterprise applications and drive engineering solutions to fruition. As an engineering leader, you will drive strategic enterprise programs in Talent, Corporate Operations, Travel and Legal operations domain, streamline the development of multiple critical initiatives and define the long term technology roadmap to support the product priorities.

Responsibilities:
As an engineering manager, you’ll be responsible for technical direction, implementation and execution of key enterprise applications.  You’ll partner closely with product management, product designers and cross functional partners to craft and evolve the vision, mission, and strategy on team projects.  You’ll help implement effective project logistics that emphasize quality and drive progress.  You'll create and fulfill the engineering hiring plan for the team, including sourcing  and interviewing. You’ll develop a diverse and inclusive team where team members are empowered to do their best work. You'll mentor engineers and look for opportunities to advance  their careers while keeping them engaged and focused on the product and the company vision.  


About you:
You are self driven, passionate, have developed engineering strategies and have a strong track record of delivering high-quality prod.  You thrive in a fast paced development environment with an ability to make rapid decisions.  You can deal with ambiguous situations, remove obstacles and guide your team to find the optimal product solutions.  You have experience working with a diverse group of cross functional peers - product, design, data science, and business stakeholders driving technical direction and decision making. You are adept at solving complex technical problems and removing roadblocks so your team can focus on delivery of the projects. You enjoy coaching, mentoring and developing a strong engineering team and do not shy away from having the tough conversations when needed.

The ideal candidate is someone who has:

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience with 3+ years of experience building and leading teams
  • Solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals and software delivery process
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Expertise in hiring diverse teams, creating an inclusive environment and retaining top talent
  • Experience working with product, design, business and leadership in setting the long term strategic direction for team and products
  • Experience with effectively creating alignments with multiple teams and operating well in ambiguity

616dbae47a9df84d7ad4a3e9.description:
The Engineering Chief of Staff is a senior leader in the Engineering organization, who will function as a strategic partner to the VP of Engineering to maximize business outcomes across the two thousand person engineering organization at Netflix. They will establish rhythm of the business practices and maximize performance through strong execution. Additionally, they will oversee cross-functional, organization-wide projects or initiatives, bringing together multiple stakeholders to help drive decisions and ensure alignment.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Develop and align with stakeholders on Engineering strategies.
  • Drive strategic, cross functional initiatives such as preparing for quarterly business reviews, long-term vision/roadmap planning, facilitating program review meetings around key engineering wide initiatives.
  • Establish and drive alignment and reporting around top line engineering metrics. 
  • Help with VP’s communication up, down and sideways by aligning on structured and predictable ways for her to engage through different communication channels and owning the rhythm. 
  • Examples include: maintaining a public engineering calendar with key dates throughout the year, driving a communication cadence of email/All Hands, etc. facilitating engineering wide surveys, collating feedback, next steps.
  • Work with the VP’s direct reports, VPs, HRBPs, and Talent partners to identify, surface, and execute on key areas of culture investment and organizational change. Examples include employee growth and development, leadership expectations, mentorship programs.
  • Work with key partners in Recruiting to ensure that Recruiting is aligned on hiring priorities and we have effective reporting and accountability structures.

Qualifications

  • 12+ years experience; background in top tier management consulting and/or program/product management in a high growth technology organization strongly preferred.
  • Awareness of technical challenges and understanding of how large engineering organizations operate.
  • Creative problem solving (i.e., excels at identifying trends and patterns, developing root cause analysis, and using a diverse toolkit to diagnose problems).
  • Ability to build rapport and influence quickly, both internally and externally.
  • Strong engineering and product acumen. Demonstrated experience leading high-impact projects for the business at scale, especially those which innovate, improve business execution, and/or span multiple products and teams. 
  • Structured thinker; good at framing decisions and unearthing critical logic.
  • Ability to develop strategic plans and organize projects across multiple teams and business functions.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to represent and showcase complex business or technical concepts with senior leadership.
  • Excellent time management, intentional prioritization and documentation skills required.
  • Bachelor’s or Masters’ Degree in Business, Engineering, Technology, or related field or equivalent experience.

6183d70daabfb47323869f92.description:
Netflix is responsible for over 30% of primetime Internet traffic with many Internet Service Providers (ISPs), and continues to experience amazing growth. The Open Connect Partner Engagement Team works to ensure the best end-user quality of experience possible through efforts with ISPs to maximize traffic throughput and minimize network congestion in the most efficient manner possible. Details on our Open Connect initiative, the Netflix Content Delivery Network, including peering and directed cache appliances (OCAs) are available at http://openconnect.netflix.com. 
 
This role is suited to a seasoned professional with more than 4 years of related experience in complex negotiations and relationship management with Internet Service Providers, who is looking for a new challenge at one of the largest internet content providers in the world.
 
The Manager, Open Connect Partner Engagement will report into the Director, Head of EMEA Open Connect Partner Engagement.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and deepen relationships with ISPs in Europe, the Middle East and Africa to optimize end-user quality of experience
  • Provide regular updates and capacity forecasts to ISP partners on Netflix traffic destined to their users. Suggest potential network optimizations where appropriate.
  • Monitor interconnection and OCA utilization to ensure sufficient capacity is available
  • Partner with the Netflix CDN operations team and service management on service availability and ISP communications
  • Contribute to relevant industry organizations and events to promote Open Connect and to help develop the global interconnection ecosystem

619d7e51aabfb4270b0e40f9.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 214 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Entertainment, like friendship, is a fundamental human need; it changes how we feel and gives us common ground. Netflix’s mission is to entertain the world. If we succeed, there is more laughter, more empathy, and more joy. Within Platform Engineering, we support this mission by providing technology infrastructure which enables Netflix to scale and innovate effectively, empowering Netflix engineers to spend more time building innovative experiences for our members and creators around the world.

The Opportunity
Platform Engineering offers an impressive suite of developer productivity products. Many have helped shape the industry and some, like Spinnaker, have become global movements with collaboration across many tech companies. However, there’s always room for improvement. Netflix engineers struggle to discover these products and are largely left to integrate and manage it all themselves. They also must keep pace with ever-evolving practices for ensuring secure, reliable, resilient, and efficient software. We believe that we can better support Netflix engineers by connecting our products across important engineering workflows and raising the level of abstraction to reduce the burden of software and infrastructure ownership.

The Role
We are looking for a senior technical product manager to help drive the next evolution of our developer productivity products. Your mission is to simplify and accelerate the software development experience at Netflix. You will deeply understand and triangulate across customer needs, product analytics, and external industry innovation to offer best-in-class experiences to Netflix engineers. Within Platform Engineering, Product Management is a new function and we’re on a mission to raise the level of product thinking across the organization. This is a unique opportunity for you to help shape our product management practices and partner closely with engineering teams through this evolution. 

What You Will Do

  • Drive product vision and strategy for developer productivity offerings and align with stakeholders
  • Develop product roadmaps that inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved
  • Partner closely with our engineering teams on the execution of product strategy and roadmaps
  • Define how we will measure the success and effectiveness of our products and drive the execution and continuous evaluation of those metrics
  • Create strong partnerships with Netflix engineering teams creating continuous feedback loops that allow us to better understand their problems
  • Ensure we are solving the right problems by sourcing input from multiple channels and prioritizing effectively to drive maximum impact for Netflix
  • Ensure that our product evolution thoughtfully addresses product lifecycle and adoption/migration experience and provides clear guidance and recommendations to Netflix engineers
  • Establish our developer experience principles: how our products should feel to developers and the core attributes that we want them to embody
  • Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, support strategy, and prioritization and planning/roadmapping practices

What We’re Looking For

  • A healthy blend of deep technical knowledge with customer-focused mindset and empathy
  • Demonstrated passion for developer productivity and experience
  • Strategic thinker that can relate technology solutions to customer use cases and think holistically about end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision
  • Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success and problem solving without perfect metrics
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations
More About Us
As a team, we come from many different countries, and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. We have a broad range of skills, backgrounds, and experiences, and folks have the opportunity to wear different hats. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and we are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!

Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix culture.

61a65afab5811bd043eddc3e.description:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing moments of joy to 200+ million customers. The Corporate Systems Engineering (CoSE) team at Netflix focuses on improving the employee experience, collaboration, and productivity of our global employees and support teams. We provide a broad portfolio of enterprise systems and software as a service from Active Directory and Google Workspace to Zendesk and Slack. As a centralized engineering team responsible for helping Netflix employees with how they work, we aim to remove friction, simplify workflows by increasing automation, and provide technical solutions so they can focus on bringing engaging stories to our members all over the world.

Among others, this means we:
• Design and build lightweight integrations between services in our environment (both built in-house and SaaS) that need to exchange data; 
• Actively work to automate (where possible) and transition (where not) support work to Netflix’s in-house world-class tier 2 support organization;
• Design the next generation of office-supporting infrastructure such as Active Directory-based authentication services, printing, etc.; 
• Improve and maintain identity-related workflows supporting critical processes such as onboarding, user and device provision, and offboarding

This role is responsible for setting the vision and leading the team.  You’ll be a key engineering leader in the Netflix Product Organization and contribute widely as a central team leader, especially given the substantial opportunities and need to work cross-functionally.  

You will likely spend your time networking both inside and outside the company, recruiting for your team, building effective and robust partnerships with stakeholders.  You will work closely with teams your team needs to collaborate with, providing and receiving feedback effectively and aligning on shared deliverables as needed.  You will collaborate with your team to set the vision for Systems Engineering within CoSE and work with other leaders within Corporate Engineering to help guide Corporate Engineering as an organization. 

  • You’re deeply passionate about inclusion, diversity, and equity and have some experience improving aspects of these where you’ve worked; 
  • You have experience leading teams with highly diverse skill sets; 
  • You can effectively hire and retain high-impact people from diverse backgrounds with diverse motivations; 
  • You can effectively partner with others in the organization and use your thoughtfulness and empathy to understand the challenges they face and how you can work together to better life for Netflix employees; 
  • You can operate both tactically and strategically and know when best to choose which of these approaches is appropriate in the moment; 
  • You’re humble, have some understanding of where/how you’d like to grow, and thirst for supportive, constructive feedback from others to continue to improve yourself; 
  • You’re courageous and willing to do uncomfortable things like giving people feedback.  
  • You have a passion for systems engineering, AWS, and SaaS management at scale; 
  • You have 3-5 years experience and success, leading engineering teams staffed with senior, autonomous engineers; 
  • You are well versed in technical principles like cloud engineering, operational excellence, and balancing performance, efficiency, and reliability;
  • You’re deeply interested in organizational culture and health and have enough familiarity with Netflix’s culture to both find it primarily attractive and to have questions about how it manifests on the ground and impacts your ability to do your job.
Does this list of attributes excite you? Better yet, do the majority of these characteristics describe you? If so, we’d love to chat.

We are seeking an ambitious, self-motivated Project Manager to join our growing Technical Infrastructure Delivery team under the Open Connect organization.  This position will be based out of our Los Angeles office.  As a Project Manager, you will collaborate with internal and external partners on the technical build out of our office and creative spaces globally specific to network deployments and low voltage data infrastructure. In addition, this role will support operational upgrades and engineering tasks to enable an excellent user experience.

Job Description:
A successful candidate will be a conduit of technology, and the driving influence in the delivery of our network infrastructure to support creative and business users. They will bridge the gap between our partners needs, and the resources and information required for a successful network delivery and further operational excellence. This individual will be proficient in communication skills and will act as a technical liaison on each project between the various technical teams it takes to deploy and support our networks, and the business stakeholders, partners and end users that consume it. They will lead the low voltage design and deployment across all builds which acts as the pass off point from our organization to the various teams we partner with and support. Additionally, they may manage operational projects where their expertise is impactful to our teams’ success.
This position requires someone to be detail oriented, and an effective multi-tasker with the ability to prioritize and carry out project requirements. They will need to be solution oriented, proactive in their work, quick thinking, and comfortable with a dynamic project slate. This Project Manager will be required to execute business initiatives, and manage internal teams’ time and expertise for the most effective output. They will need to share information broadly, and align tactical and strategic efforts.
Be sure to review our culture page and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team.

Qualifications:

  • Ability to coordinate projects, determine resource requirements, carry out logistics and follow through with deliveries and deadlines 
  • Proficient in tracking data, managing budgets, creating schedules, and carrying out progress checks to track performance and accountability 
  • Excellent at developing project plans, managing engineering based efforts, prioritizing deliverables and resources 
  • Proficient in low voltage infrastructure and layer 1 delivery, and the curiosity to improve and evolve our design guidelines based on tactical learnings
  • Ability to partner with engineers, business stakeholders, and technical leaders on task management to deliver network projects 
  • Sharp assessment skills with an ability to evaluate wants vs. needs and ability to negotiate prioritization accordingly
  • Understanding of networking technologies, roles, functions and capabilities
  • Excellent at building relationships and creating a strong team environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Effective communicator with partners across all technical levels
  • Strong management skills across internal partners and external vendors
  • Experience working in global regions, and scaling solutions 
  • Team player with a willingness to jump in with a positive attitude
  • Comfortable with a fast pace and the flexibility to navigate constant change
  • Skill in developing technical solutions and creatively applying them in operational problems

Additional Requirements:

  • A minimum of 5 years technical project management expertise
  • Ability to work across different time zones, and travel as necessary
  • Ability to respond after hours for timely or urgent matters
  • Experience in production and studio technology is desired

61bd6c097a9df85535e24f20.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.  
With an increasing slate of original content being produced every year, our products manage billions of dollars worth of content-spend. 
 
About the space
Promotional assets are the key to discovering content you love to watch. The Promotional Media Engineering products make it easy to tell stories about our stories. We build products to get artwork and video assets in front of our members, both on and off-service. Our backend services power products that are used internally at Netflix as well as externally by our content partners,  fulfillment partners, creative agencies and freelancers that work with Netflix to curate one of the best entertainment catalogs in the world. 
 
About the role
The Promotional Artwork Engineering team is hiring a leader to drive a strategic problem space for creating the best promotional assets for our global catalog. This team is responsible for building products and services that enable us to generate and surface insights about our promotional assets in our tools. This team works closely with Product Management, Design, Analytics, UI and various business teams to define and implement strategies to help our creative teams make the best decisions around promotional assets.

What you’ll do:

  • Team Leadership: build and lead a team of server-side engineers adept at building distributed microservices.
  • Technical Vision: re-evaluate architecture choices on an ongoing basis, in anticipation of increased scale and ever-evolving technology to meet the demands of a growing business.
  • Demonstrate technical skills to successfully drive infrastructure & tool improvements for new products and existing processes and workflows
  • Product Leadership: define and execute the roadmap by collaborating with partners in Product, Design and Operations.
  • Build and lead an inclusive team of great engineers from different backgrounds, cultures, industries and life experiences.

Qualifications:

  • Ability to lead a team of server side engineers.
  • You are an innovative thinker and are comfortable pushing your own team and influencing other teams to push boundaries.
  • Ability to actively mentor and coach every member of the team.
  • Ability to work through ambiguous requirements and make decisions to push forward. 
  • You are passionate about building highly scalable solutions with flexibility factored in to make quick pivots as business evolves.
  • Experience working with a product team to build a vision for how UX, UI, and the back-end will come together on a given product or features.
  • You have proven skills in building software systems in a distributed / cloud environment, deployed in a CI/CD fashion.

What Sets You Apart

  • You have worked on horizontal platforms/products that serve multiple engineering teams.
  • Great communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills working cross-functionally with multiple teams.

With the explosion of Internet TV, Netflix has grown to serve over 214 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries worldwide. The Cloud Infrastructure organization’s mission is to increase the fleet-wide agility, scalability, reliability, and efficiency of our Platform. To do this, we build compute and networking abstractions that add opinions, drive standards, reduce operational burden on application owners, and allow for us to independently evolve our architecture.

We are looking for experienced engineering leaders who will lead and grow teams of senior engineers for the Host Networking and Application Networking groups in the Network Platform organization. The team provides Layer2 - Layer7 networking solutions to ensure consistent traffic management at scale throughout the Netflix ecosystem, by abstracting out the complexities of resiliency, security, routing, and insights. You will be partnering with engineering teams across all of Netflix, including service owners, platform partners, and other central teams, like our InfoSec and CDN teams to develop and execute on a cohesive strategy for how we evolve traffic flowing through our ecosystem.

If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of how Netflix scales into the future, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Drive the vision and strategy on how to evolve our Network Platform solutions
  • Build, scale, and mentor a cohesive team of amazing engineers
  • Form strong cross-functional partnerships to achieve alignment with many engineering teams and ensure our solutions meet their needs, while maintaining our focus on reliability, resiliency, security

What we are looking for:

  • We are looking for multiple leaders with experience in some, not all, of the dimensions below:
  • Experience building and operating complex distributed systems at scale. 
  • Well versed in Java or other object-oriented languages.  
  • Solid understanding of transport protocols (HTTP, HTTP/2, WebSockets, etc). 
  • Experience in Kernel networking and Embedded software development. 
  • Deep knowledge of networking technologies and abstractions in modern architectures
  • Solid understanding of Layer3/Layer4 networking, QoS, SDN, Network Security. 
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Deep empathy for users and their business goals
  • Proven experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity.
  • Tenacity and the ability to balance competing priorities across multiple cross-functional stakeholders and programs
  • Orientation towards long-term impact as the yardstick for prioritization, but able to strike the right balance between short term goals and longer-term vision
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
A few more things about us:
As a team, we come from many different backgrounds and countries, and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science and we strive to give people the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity and agility has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and we are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here. 

Want to know more about our Cloud Infrastructure teams? Check out:
- eBPF Flow Logs at Scale for Network Insight & Enrich VPC flow logs at Hyperscale
- Titus, Netflix container management platform
- Evolution of Edge @Netflix
- Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices
- Open Sourcing Zuul 2

61e08d047a9df88c721a7d82.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing the entertainment industry with world-class technology. We are both a content distributor and a producer for original and premium shows. Our shows are watched by more than 208 million accounts around the world. We produce hundreds of new series, movies, documentaries, stand-up specials, and content across various other categories each year. This global footprint allows us to tell a diverse set of stories and inspire a global audience.

On the Creative Excellence and Valuation DSE team, we seek to maximize our members’ enjoyment of our content. Through analytical research and data science innovation, we develop metrics and models that measure economic value and the joy each title brings to our members. Our team consists of a mix of analytical engineers who perform statistical research and scale insights, as well as data scientists who prototype and place models into production. We work collaboratively with other DSE teams, consumer research teams, and Content Strategy & Analytics. We strive to enable our Content and Creative teams to make more informed decisions with our data-driven metrics, insights, and products.

We are looking for a leader that will guide the team to make new data science innovations that improve our understanding of content performance, enhance our measurement methodologies, and create title level insights. These outcomes enable data-driven decisions for our Content and Creative teams. You will work closely with our partner teams and create new collaborations that enable better use and understanding of our content for our members and Netflix.

As a Manager you will …

  • Are skilled at operating in a complex, cross-functional organization or company where collaboration and integration with other teams across multiple disciplines is essential to the success of your team.
  • Be a strategic partner for Content, Strategy and Analytics teams: identify critical analytical problems and find innovative solutions with data
  • Hire and lead a stunning team of Analytics Engineers & Data Scientists 
  • Guide analyses and machine learning models that inform content performance and create impactful decision making
  • Enact Netflix values in daily work and interactions.

About You

  • A leader that has experience and demonstrated success in leading and building high-caliber, data focused teams with diverse technical strengths and more importantly are experienced in developing leaders and fostering an inclusive team culture.
  • Are a strong communicator that develops relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders
  • An expert in analytics, including metric development, statistical analysis, and intuitive reporting, with exposure to common experimentation techniques 
  • Have a passion for machine learning techniques and bringing those models from prototype into production 
  • Deeply invested in creating an inclusive team environment and helping each team member grow
