61e4efb0aabfb46f1df37a88.description:
At Netflix, we are passionate about delivering ✨joy✨ to hundreds of millions of Netflix members around the world, whether they’re traveling or at home with family. The Mobile Product Engineering teams work on mobile product innovations that connect our members to the entertainment they love. Some of these have included Fast Laughs that lets you browse funny clips from your favorite TV shows and movies, as well as the introduction of Mobile Games that give you even more ways to enjoy Netflix.

The iOS Product Foundation team is responsible for building the core components used to support and enable large-scale A/B tests of features ranging from highly visible product experiences to performance improvements. Solutions built by this team address the needs of iOS UI product engineers as well as common opportunities across other client engineering teams; these include app architecture, feature flags, data access (e.g. GraphQL), quality of experience (QoE), and client observability. 

We are looking for an experienced engineering manager to lead the iOS Product Foundation team and drive technology investments needed to scale the iOS product portfolio. With Netflix’s focus on international growth and new forms of entertainment such as games, there is a growing demand for mobile product innovations that increase value for our members worldwide.

About the Role

  • Lead a team of senior iOS engineers who value inclusion, transparency, autonomy, humility, and an occasional game of Quiplash.
  • Empower, challenge, and coach team members to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback.
  • Strategically manage the engineering challenges and risks associated with shipping complex infrastructure solutions that impact the core product experience on a regular, rapid cadence.
  • Effectively prioritize, distribute, and manage the increasing number of projects on the technical roadmaps.
  • Collaborate, build alignment, and develop strong relationships with engineering partners across client, server, and productivity teams.
  • Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values.

What Sets You Apart

  • Experience building and leading high-performance mobile client engineering teams with high degrees of psychological safety.
  • Proactively gives and receives feedback; is not afraid to have difficult conversations.
  • Seeks different perspectives and relevant context to effectively navigate ambiguity.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to actively listen, adapt to different styles, establish best practices for a hybrid-remote work environment.
  • Fosters an inclusive team culture that enables team members of all backgrounds to succeed and thrive.
Meet the Team
Listen to our inaugural episode of the WeAreNetflix Podcast, as well as guest appearances on other shows!
   🔊 Episode 1: Making the Netflix iOS App - Jordanna Kwok, Jessica Berglund
   🔊 How big iOS teams typically operate (Swift by Sundell) - Carola Nitz

Watch Netflix event videos and conference talks featuring members of our team!
   🎥 Accessibility for iOS: Doing Well by Doing Good (App Builders 2020) - John Fox
   🎥 Eye Nav Hack (Netflix Hack Day) - Ben Hands
   🎥 Engineering the Customer Journey (Netflix Women In Tech)

61f226ff3d6b625a5843fb81.description:
Stories move us. They make us feel more emotion, see new perspectives, and bring us closer to each other. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are always looking to help you find your next favorite story.  We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, over 200 million paid subscribers.

Our story
Platform engineering is a team of stunning colleagues across the globe focused on providing technical products, tools, and services that enable Netflix to scale and innovate effectively and empower Netflix engineers to focus on building innovative experiences for our members and creators around the world. We deploy hundreds of services, on thousands of instances, across multiple regions, and millions of client devices.  Within Platform Engineering, the teams focused on core infrastructure focus on increasing agility, efficiency, and reliability across our compute, networking, and storage offerings, while reducing operational burden and enabling innovation for application owners.

The Role:
We are looking for experienced product managers focused on networking and storage to partner with engineering to build product strategies, prioritize roadmaps, and clear product specifications for core infrastructure on which a majority of the various Netflix businesses run. We are building a strong product management team in Platform Engineering to move towards a more product-focused organization. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Develop product roadmaps and specifications across compute, networking, and storage that inform engineering teams on objectives, scenario prioritization, and customer requirements
  • Define longer-term product direction and strategy across cloud infrastructure that influences Platform-wide strategy
  • Partner with our customers (other internal Netflix engineering teams), to better understand their problems and work together to deliver needed solutions
  • Partner with other product managers and engineering teams to create cohesive strategies and roadmaps across organizational boundaries
  • Foster an environment that is customer-focused, data-driven, and hypothesis/ experimentation based
  • Engage deeply with external communities to stay abreast of industry trends and innovations
  • Help evolve the product management discipline and practices within Platform engineering

What we are looking for:

  • A combination of deep technical knowledge and a customer-focused mindset
  • Demonstrated broad understanding of infrastructure technologies at scale, with deep expertise in either networking or storage
  • Experience designing large scale production services in public or private cloud
  • Strategic thinker that can relate technology solutions to customer use cases
  • Comfortable handling and navigating ambiguity, working across different disciplines and teams, and applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to problem solve without perfect metrics
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • 6+ years of experience in product management

Want to know more about our Cloud Infrastructure teams? Check out:

  • Opensourcing Titus
  • Disenchantment: Netflix Titus, Its Feisty Team, and Daemons
  • Evolution of Edge @Netflix
  • Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices
  • Performance Engineering YouTube channel
A few more things about us:
As a Platform team, we come from many different countries and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. Our team includes product managers, program managers, designers, full-stack developers, distributed systems engineers, data scientists and folks have the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

61f2dc8d3d6b6295cb44004d.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Compute Platform’s purpose is to build and support products serving cloud compute needs from building to operating infrastructure impacting all parts of Netflix including Streaming, Games, Studio and Content, Machine Learning, and more. From OS Engineering on our Ubuntu-based fleet to our worldwide highly available compute fabric provided by Titus, our multi-tenant Kubernetes-based container platform and runtime, we take an active role in driving our compute primitives forward, evolving them to meet our customer’s needs. We not only design and develop our large-scale tier one systems, but operate and support them 24x7.

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to join us in leading and growing our Compute Platform. As engineering at Netflix continues to grow and our compute container strategy expands, there is a growing demand for efficient and scalable solutions that improve the developer experience and operational effectiveness of all our teams and systems.

About the role

  • Drive the vision and strategy for our OS engineering and host runtime solutions
  • Hire and grow our team of exceptional engineers
  • Empower, challenge, and coach a team of senior engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap
  • Build and maintain strong cross-functional relationships across Platform Engineering partners and customers throughout engineering
  • Collaborate closely within the overall Compute Platform team to function as one team, delivering cohesive solutions

What sets you apart

  • A self-motivated exceptional people leader with experience building and leading high-performing teams, ideally with remote or hybrid teams
  • Proactively give and receive feedback with a growth mindset
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening
  • Focus on delighting customers with amazing user experiences and customer service
  • Experience working with and operating production compute infrastructure systems at scale
  • Thoughtfully exercise strong judgment in ambiguous situations
We believe talent is equally distributed but opportunities are not. Our US-based team is happy to embrace remote work and our core work hours are 10am - 4pm Pacific Time. We believe safe spaces where everyone can be their authentic selves are the key to a strong team so we welcome and embrace all identities, cultures, and backgrounds.

Does this sound interesting? Or does this sound interesting-but-intimidating? Please don’t self-select out, let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!

Netflix is a global company, with a diverse member base, which is why the content we produce reflects that: global perspectives, global stories. As we grow globally, we know that we must have the most talented employees with diverse backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to support our innovation and creativity. We are an equal opportunity employer and strive to build balanced teams from all walks of life.

The Role: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 200 million members in over 190 countries. We are creating original content at an unprecedented scale, and have become the largest studio in the world. 

Studio Algorithms sits at the intersection of Consumer Experience and the Netflix Studio. We are aiming to upscale the global pitch-to-play pipeline of our content with AI (such as computer vision, machine learning, and computer graphics algorithms). We lead algorithm-centered innovation projects but also partner across the company to scale Netflix Studio, improve our content’s creative excellence, and innovate the way storytellers and creative artists work. We influence, educate, and advocate on tactical product decisions as well as the strategic directions to enable the next slate of great product innovations in this space.

As Product Manager for Data Integration, you will be part of the growing Studio Algorithms team and work closely with a team of world-class scientists, researchers, and engineers, global and regional business stakeholders, and other Studio product management, design, consumer insights, and operational talents. You will lead the overall Studio data initiatives to help establish robust data quality, coverage and connect the data end-to-end across the entire content cycle, as well as build the data foundation for future AI applications. In success, you can help Netflix meet current production targets and discover new opportunities to optimize production operations so that we can produce more content in the same timeframe without sacrificing quality. Meanwhile, you can also empower the ML/AI community at Netflix to build better creative tools, optimize processes, and develop insights to empower better creative decisions to produce and distribute even better content for our members. 

A successful candidate will combine a deep technical background in e.g. data integration and management, machine learning, with a strong product sense, exceptional cross-functional leadership and communication skills, a hypothesis-driven mentality, sharp business acumen, creativity and courage to look at problems in new ways, to define, inspire, explain, and execute his/her vision. 

What will you do?

  • Craft and communicate a strategic vision and roadmap in building and improving Netflix Studio's data foundations. 
  • Partner closely with business stakeholders and relevant product and engineering teams to develop and roll out the data foundation initiatives to relevant content production workflows.
  • Work with senior management and executives to develop the vision for a data-driven Netflix Studio.
  • Partner with the algorithm research team to understand, prioritize, and address their data needs so that they can be empowered to develop relevant applications. 
  • Be an advocate for data and new technologies with creators and an advocate for creator experience with scientists and engineers.
  • Connect advances in data integration and management with opportunities to solve new problems at Netflix Studio. 
  • Foster an inclusive environment, where all viewpoints are welcomed and encouraged.
  • Think broadly about the Netflix business and contribute to efforts beyond your domain.

What we offer

  • Opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way. The Netflix product management model is different from most technology companies. Our key product management leaders - including this position - work with multiple sprint teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced product leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. 
  • Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate.
  • Freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment. 
  • Work with smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. 
  • A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our leaders started out as individual contributors.

What are we looking for?

  • 5+ years experience of building scalable data foundations, platforms, or products, in product manager, engineering, data science, or research capacity.
  • 3+ years experience in product management with a proven record of successfully identifying technical product/platform innovation opportunities, launching and scaling them. Preferably with experience leading enterprise or studio products. 
  • Proven record of successfully building and launching great products or platforms that have a significant algorithmic component and strategic ability to incorporate larger business context into algorithmic development.
  • Extensive experience and demonstrated leadership working effectively with data scientists, machine learning engineers, etc. 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to present technical content to diverse non-technical audiences. 
  • Ability to partner with people from different parts of the company, in roles with grey areas in authority, to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact. 
  • Ability to prioritize well, manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision. 
  • Post graduate education (MS or PhD)  in a applied quantitative field such as : Machine learning, Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Physics, Engineering, Economics or Statistics
  • Exposure to the entertainment industry, infra / system building, or related products and solutions in the past is a huge plus.
We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

62057a8c3d6b622172425121.text: Technical Program Manager, Content & Studio Engineering
62057a8c3d6b622172425121.description:
At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 220 million paid subscribers and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Engineering teams within Netflix work hard every day to scale and innovate this content production and member experience in an ever growing complex software landscape.  
 
Our Team
Studio Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners planning, producing and managing our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content investment and production, from the initial pitch of a title all the way releasing the final content on the Netflix service for play also known as pitch-to-play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. We deliver solutions that enable the business to make smart decisions about how we account, plan, and acquire content. We help make as many titles as we can, as quickly as we can, being smart about timelines, budgets and scarce resources. We deliver our shows to launch on the streaming service bringing joy to members watching titles they love. We do this by forecasting our content budget, automating and optimizing the content production process, globalizing our content with dubbing and subtitles, creating promotional artwork and video assets, and managing the launch of titles and marketing campaigns of our content on and off the service.
 
With an increasing slate of original content, including shows, films, and games being produced every year, our products manage billions of dollars worth of content-spend. In 2022 alone, we’re spending over $15 billion on content spanning a wide variety of genres and languages such as TV series, documentaries, and feature films. 
 
We are looking for backend engineers to build the technologies that allow us to scale our studio efforts across the globe, and do so effectively and efficiently! 

What you will do

  • Own and drive cross-functional execution of program deliverables
  • Approach complex problems with a strategic perspective and develop strategies to address them
  • Leverage your experience with various systems to improve overall engineering execution
  • Proactively identify inefficiencies, risks and gaps that stifle the program's progress and to implement better and more efficient workflows
  • Establish an overall plan for several teams to rally around by identifying the right teams, the systems involved to build new solutions, align roadmaps, and weigh relative priorities
  • Build strong subject matter knowledge to balance business demands with technological restrictions
  • Assess and evaluate a program's technical implementation with engineering to determine the best strategy for the challenge at hand
  • Drive and participate in the complex technical discussions with audiences of varying technical and subject matter backgrounds
  • Develop and own communication plans for communicating program status, big picture, challenges, and risks to stakeholders effectively and proactively

Key Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience
  • A strong understanding of working within product management, software engineering, or systems management
  • Deep experience working cross-functionally across several different product development teams and stake-holders to successfully build and deliver scalable solutions
  • Highly skilled, organized, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts: people, needs, and technologies
  • Operate autonomously across multiple teams, demonstrate critical thinking and thought leadership
  • Action-oriented and able to solve ambiguous, complex technical problems
  • Experience establishing trust and strong work relationships across multi-disciplinary teams and multiple partners
  • Comfortable collaborating and influencing a diverse set of people and teams to do what needs to get done and negotiate when approaches or timelines change
  • Zoom in and out seamlessly to identify bottlenecks and stay focussed on the big picture 
  • Love to dive into the technology aspect of a program, gaining rich context that enables you to be even more thoughtful and effective in making the initiative happen
  • Drive the business forward through the programs you run
  • Stellar communication skills, both verbal and written

6202bdc1aabfb4a090d5aff7.text: Technical Program Manager, Mergers and Acquisitions
6202bdc1aabfb4a090d5aff7.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.  This continuous growth is also fueled by the acquisition of new businesses to help us entertain the world.  In support, the Technology Management Services (TMS) team facilitates the integration of newly acquired businesses onto corporate technology platforms.  To that end, TMS is partnering with many other Netflix teams to orchestrate and execute all the tech work involved post-acquisition.  And that’s where you come in. 

TMS is in search of a Technical Program Manager (TPM) to lead our Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) strategy for the technical integration of new business entities.  The primary goal of the TPM will be to orchestrate the work required of several cross-functional partners to ensure all aspects of the technical integration are completed in a safe, secure, and timely manner.  One of the desired outcomes will be to streamline our M&A approach over time so that the process is transparent, smooth, and predictable all around.

Your intended impact

As a Technical Program Manager at Netflix, you’ll lean on your technical expertise to lead multiple cross-functional M&A projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to align on goals, negotiate timelines, identify risks, and communicate clearly with many other teams across the company. Here’s more context regarding the strategic objectives of the TPM followed by the skills and background we’re after for this role.

  • Produce a cohesive vision for the technical integration of newly acquired businesses.  Based on feedback and direction from business stakeholders, the TPM will cast a compelling vision that describes the desired journey and outcomes for a new company that’s been acquired by Netflix so that these expectations are clearly understood by the people doing the technical integration work as well as by the people being introduced to the Netflix platform and application ecosystem. 
  • Manage the intake of new projects and their prioritization.  The TPM will also provide a central point of contact for business partners to discuss and initiate new M&A projects that will require integration with Netflix technology services.  The TPM will also enable the subsequent rationalization and prioritization.  This would include project backlog management.
  • Facilitate resource planning and coordinate project work.  Once a project is scoped and its goals well defined, the TPM will consult cross-functional partners (in and outside of TMS) to determine resources and assess the level of effort required for the project's success. This will include identifying technology leads and facilitating connections between acquired companies & technology leads.
  • Mitigate delivery risks.  The TPM will monitor all technology integration work to ensure that roadblocks and interdependencies are resolved to achieve successful delivery.  
  • Manage communication with internal and external partners.  Integral to the program's success will be maintaining constant communication and a healthy feedback loop between all partners and collaborators.  The TPM will also provide tailored context and communication to ensure the success of projects and the program at large.
  • Templatize technical integration plans. As our teams build experience and capture learnings from M&A projects, the TPM will help develop systems and workflow templates to help standardize future planning and execution for these types of projects.

Your Skills & Experience

  • At least 5 years of applied experience managing technology projects or programs relevant to mergers and acquisitions of new companies
  • Strong and relevant program or project management skills within a technology services team context (preferably at a company with a global workforce)
  • Project experience working with cross-functional engineering teams to drive the design and execution of technology solutions
  • Exemplary facilitation skills when it comes to managing communication and priorities with multiple partners and stakeholders
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (e.g., able to draft memos, reference documentation, and flow charts to explain business workflows)
  • Experience leading projects that include the implementation and/or integration of SaaS products (e.g., working with vendors and internal technical teams to enable APIs or Single-sign On integration)

620ac541b5811b5f4f8d81f9.text: Senior Analytics Engineer - Games & Title Launch Management
620ac541b5811b5f4f8d81f9.description:
We are seeking a Senior Analytics Engineer to lead, define and execute the data and analytics strategy for a thriving data-rich domain within Netflix called Games & Title Launch Management. As part of the Data Science & Engineering team, you will work with product, operations and technical experts to design metrics, run deep-dive analysis, build dashboards and innovative data products to quantitatively influence members and our business strategy. 

Your stakeholders, the Games & Title Launch Management teams, are responsible for launching titles (shows & movies) and games globally, accurately and on time. Each launch is a delicate orchestration of often thousands of creative, operations, and technical experts working over many months (or years), both inside and outside Netflix, to produce and assemble thousands of assets (e.g. artwork, video, subtitles, synopses, etc.) that meet Netflix’s high-quality bar. Managing such a complex project consumes and produces a tremendous amount of data. Organizing, analyzing, and deriving actionable insights from this data is essential for launch risk management & scaling Netflix’s business. This pivotal role is central to that goal. 

It is worth calling out that Games Launch Management is a relatively new and growing part of our business with its own unique exciting challenges. There you’ll find additional opportunities to shape our data strategy in a space that is close to its inception. This is in contrast to the Title Launch Management space that is relatively more data mature. Thus this role offers a great mix of working on big data problems as well as building scrappy solutions with nascent data sets.

This is the role for you and if --

  • You know what it means to own a problem space through thought leadership.
  • You are as comfortable dealing with the details as you are with the big picture.
  • You enjoy finding problems as much as solving them.
  • You can communicate effectively with experts of all backgrounds.
  • You can collaborate effectively with product managers, engineering teams, and other analytics experts to achieve shared business goals
  • You are an expert data wrangler and can pick up any tool (e.g. Tableau, D3) to get the job done.
  • You dream in SQL and Python (or other similar languages). Experience in building and managing ETL pipelines, in addition to analytics, is a big plus.
  • You are comfortable with Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Presto, etc.
  • The Netflix culture resonates with you.

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million memberships in over 190 countries enjoying mobile games, TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.  On iOS we are passionate about delivering our experience to Netflix members around the world, whether they’re away or at home with family.

Every Netflix stream that plays on an Apple device is brought there by our iOS Platform team.  This team is responsible for delivering a best-in-class platform and player to its primary UI partner team and any other iOS teams within Netflix.  In addition to being the primary point for integrating with new Apple technologies in the video space, this team also focuses on developing A/B tests to make sure changes we make improve our members' experiences over time.

We are looking for an experienced multi-faceted engineering manager to join the Mobile Platform leadership group to lead this team.  Along with partnering with our content security and program management teams, and others, you will work closely with a newly formed team driving our most recent work in the games SDK space.

About the Role

  • Lead a team of Senior iOS and Test Engineers who value openness through inclusion in a transparent environment, where everyone is trusted to do their part.
  • Empower, challenge, and coach team members to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback.
  • Manage the engineering challenges and risks associated with shipping on a regular, rapid cadence.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional partners consisting of security, encoding, and our service layers.
  • Effectively prioritize and organize work to find the best outcomes for team members and partners.
  • Work with Apple to propose new features and constantly push the boundaries of what’s possible on iOS.
  • Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values.

What Sets You Apart

  • Experience leading high-performance engineering teams including a wide range of skills across different disciplines.
  • Exceptional technical acuity around decision making and guiding a team.
  • Seeks different perspectives and relevant context to effectively navigate ambiguity.
  • Fosters an inclusive team culture that enables team members of all backgrounds to contribute, succeed and thrive.

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Compute is critical to Netflix. From delivering the largest streaming service on the planet to encoding vast amounts of video content, flexible scalable compute capacity is at the core of Netflix’s success. The Compute team concentrates on building infrastructure abstractions to increase the scale, efficiency, and reliability across our compute, offerings from traditional VM based offerings, to containers via Netflix’s open-source Titus platform to serverless functions. Every engineer at Netflix relies on the products and expertise of the compute team to meet the demands of the largest streaming service in the world. 

We are looking for a Director of Engineering with a passion for building large scale distributed systems. You would lead and grow a team of engineering managers and engineers to evolve and implement a cohesive Compute strategy that underpins all Cloud usage at Netflix. 

What You will do

  • Drive the vision and strategy on how to evolve our Compute platform
  • Build, scale, and mentor a cohesive team of amazing engineers and leaders
  • Form strong cross-functional partnerships to achieve alignment with many engineering teams and ensure our solutions meet their needs, while maintaining our focus on scalability, reliability, and efficiency

What we are looking for

  • Strong understanding of cloud architectures and distributed systems at scale
  • Proven experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity
  • Perseverance and the ability to balance competing priorities across multiple cross-functional stakeholders and programs
  • Strong experience with strategic prioritization but able to strike the right balance between short term goals and longer-term vision
  • Ability to drive large initiatives to completion working in tandem with many partner and peer organizations
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Product driven mindset and previous experience of working hand in hand with Product and Program Management
  • A collaborative approach to building alignment with peers and partners

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships worldwide enjoying movies and TV shows across a wide variety of genres and languages. Studio Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners producing and managing our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content production, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. 
 
You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and produces shows such as “Stranger Things”, “Squid Games”, “ROMA”, and “¿Quién mato a Sara?” on a global scale. With an increasing slate of original content being produced every year, our products manage billions of dollars worth of content-spend.  In short, we make Netflix Originals happen!
 
We're looking for engineering managers who have strong product development background and experience leading a team of world class software engineers while forging strong trusting partnerships with Product Managers, designers, and customers.
 
This is an exciting opportunity to work alongside the engineering leadership team in Mexico to help build, scale and shape the new Netflix Studio engineering team.

As a Engineering Manager for Studio Engineering

What you’ll do:

  • Team Leadership: build and lead a team of frontend, backend or data engineers 
  • Technical Vision: re-evaluate architecture choices on an ongoing basis, in anticipation of increased scale and ever-evolving technology to meet the demands of a growing business
  • Technical skills: successfully drive infrastructure & tool improvements for new products and existing processes and workflows
  • Product Leadership: define and execute the roadmap by collaborating with partners in Product, Design and Operations
  • Team building: build and lead an inclusive team of great engineers from different backgrounds, cultures, industries and life experiences

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience leading a team of engineers across functional disciplines
  • You are an innovative thinker and are comfortable pushing your own team and influencing other teams to push boundaries
  • Ability to actively mentor and coach every member of the team
  • Ability to work through ambiguous requirements and make decisions to push forward 
  • You are passionate about building highly scalable solutions with flexibility factored in to make quick pivots as business evolves
  • Experience working with a product team to build a vision for how UX, UI, and the back-end will come together on a given product or features
  • You have proven skills in building software systems in a distributed / cloud environment, deployed in a CI/CD fashion

What Sets You Apart

  • You have worked on horizontal platforms/products that serve multiple engineering teams
  • Great communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills working cross-functionally with multiple teams

621533f33d6b62eb60a81100.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Productivity Engineering is the organization tasked with making Netflix engineers more effective by building and supporting the infrastructure to create, build, test, deploy, run and monitor the Netflix stack. As Netflix grows, so does the complexity behind our engineering systems. Our challenge is deceivingly simple: keep the developer experience amazing even as complexity increases. Our work impacts virtually every developer at Netflix and enables other platform teams to innovate faster. We are looking for a talented engineering leader to join our team. 

In this role, you will

  • Lead, empower, challenge, and coach a team of exceptional engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Drive the team’s overall strategy and vision to develop the building blocks that unlock the most value for our internal customers, Netflix engineers
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap
  • Build and maintain strong cross-functional relationships across Platform Engineering partners and customers throughout engineering
  • Collaborate closely within the broader Productivity Engineering organization, delivering cohesive solutions

Where you’ll focus

  • Learn about the ins and outs of the Netflix developer ecosystem to remove roadblocks and deliver cohesive solutions
  • Delighting Netflix engineers with amazing user experiences and customer service
  • Work to reduce toil through polyglot abstractions that tie into deep language integrations
  • Pave the path away from large microservices and into composable and managed components
  • Provide polished building blocks that are great out of the box but promote extending

What sets you apart

  • Experience building and leading high-performing teams, ideally with hybrid teams
  • Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset. You initiate the hard conversations.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening
  • Experience working closely with or on a central development platform and tooling team
  • Thoughtful exercising of strong judgment in ambiguous situations
While we use and support many different platforms and languages, our team primarily uses Golang for our tooling. Experience with the container ecosystem, cloud 
infrastructure, build systems, and CI/CD tools, will help you succeed at this job. US-based remote is ok!

Does this sound interesting? Or does this sound interesting but intimidating? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

The Netflix culture

62158849b5811bbe4a8b608e.description:
NRDP is a feature-rich product providing the platform for the Netflix TV application to run on. The NRDP SDK is deployed to various devices and partners, including in-house upgradable devices (gaming consoles and some Android TV devices), and external partner devices (TVs, set-top boxes, and other streaming platforms).

Historically, external partners would certify a version of the NRDP SDK onto their platforms once a year. In order to expedite feature updates to our members on those platforms, the SDK has recently shifted from a single monolithic architecture into independently versioned and upgradable components (network, 3D graphics, playback, etc…).

Role:
In order to support the new architecture, as a leader of this team, you will set a vision for creating the best-in-class test authoring and CI solutions for the NRDP teams (NRDP,  Nova, Ninja, PE), as well as maintain a healthy state of NRDP test devices used by TV platform stakeholders.

You’ll lead a team of engineers responsible for providing development productivity tools, maintaining CI infrastructure, and writing and evolving test cases. You will be providing foundational support for authoring new tests while adapting/evolving into other technologies as needed (Jest, C++, etc.). In addition, you will use your strong product knowledge to work with stakeholders to support test executions on NRDP devices.

What are we looking for?

  • Recruit, coach, and inspire a diverse team to deliver results while maintaining a healthy environment for all teams involved
  • Use their strong technical leadership to help the team talk through technical solutions and evaluate tradeoffs
  • Help the team arrive at key decisions in ambiguous situations
  • Maintain a team culture that promotes solving problems (across team boundaries as needed).
  • Partner with peer organizations that use NRDP platform to provide efficient testing solutions.
  • Partner with common infrastructure team to ensure common solutions are identified and made generic as needed

Must have:

  • A high degree of empathy for team and partners
  • A strong problem solving approach focusing on outcomes
  • Strong technical leadership
  • Strategic thinking, planning and execution

6224efac3d6b62c5a2c78a0c.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

The Ecosystem Solutions team builds tools that help people around the world integrate their technology with the Netflix platform quickly, with the highest levels of quality.  Some of the integrations we support are: Netflix Streaming, Payment, Content Discovery, and Games experiences.  The results of our work can be seen around the world by hundreds of millions Netflix members… and that number is growing every day.

We would like to find a leader who can help us build our Partner Core Components team in São Paulo.
  
What are “Partner Core Components?”  As we have deployed more and more “partner facing” products (like the Netflix application on Smart TVs, payment integrations, voice integrations, and our mobile game SDK), we’ve noticed that there are many similarities in the tools we’ve built to support them.  We are looking for a leader who can help us build a team to take the best of the capabilities from each of our tools and turn them into a set of common capabilities that can be used across our engineering teams and across our portfolio of over 60 internal and external products.  

The best candidate will be truly excited by the prospect of designing and building the common components that will allow us to continue the rapid growth of our portfolio; which underpins integration, certification and monitoring the experience for Netflix integrations across 500+ partners and over 1800 different device types (most likely including the TV sitting in your living room right now!). 
  
A proven leader and a humble, personable self-starter with broad technical skills will be successful in this role.  You should be passionate about helping others and completely unsatisfied with the status quo.  In our organization, you will never run out of business opportunities or technical challenges.  Let’s entertain the world – together!

  • You love Netflix and want to help bring joy to millions of people
  • You are a great leader who can build a dream team and inspire them do great things

  • You have a passion for finding commonalities between systems and refactoring them to drive efficiency
  • You savor the challenge of delivering software to other engineers
  • You love supporting other engineers and take pride in systems that are “always on”
  • When things go wrong, you manage and prioritize issue resolution to ensure stellar customer experience
  • You would like to impact the quality of consumer electronics on a global basis
  • You are humble, willing to learn from and collaborate with your peers, but will stand up for the ideas you believe in.
  • Your inclination is to cooperate with your peers vs. competing with them
  • You want to help shape Netflix’s first standalone engineering team in Brazil!

  • You have 7+ years of experience in either technology operations or engineering
  • You have 5+ years of leadership experience in cloud engineering, application development, full stack engineering, or front-end development
  • You are passionate about building capabilities and shared components (front end or back end) to make other engineers more productive
  • You have deep experience recruiting, hiring, and leading top talent
  • You have strong English language skills and have experience working with English speaking teams and stakeholders
  • You have experience with common Javascript full stack tooling like ReactJS and NodeJS, as well as Java Spring Boot.
  • You have knowledge of cloud computing platforms, like Amazon Web Services or Azure
  • You have experience deploying and operating high-availability RESTful or GraphQL services.
  • You have experience owning delivery roadmaps and leading teams who deliver what they promise 

Other Skills of Interest:

  • You have experience working in mobile or consumer device development
  • You have experience working with games developers or in game development
  • You have experience working with payment processing systems
  • You have experience with delivery of audio or video content

622f78293d6b6284b167a8bb.text: Productivity Engineering Manager Collaborative Tools and Infrastructure
622f78293d6b6284b167a8bb.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. 

Productivity Engineering is the organization tasked with making Netflix engineers more effective by building and supporting the infrastructure to create, build, test, deploy, run and monitor the Netflix stack. As Netflix grows, so does the complexity behind our engineering systems. Our challenge is deceivingly simple: keep the developer experience amazing even as complexity increases. Our work impacts virtually every developer at Netflix and enables other platform teams to innovate faster. We are looking for a talented engineering leader to join our team.

In this role, you will

  • Lead, empower, challenge, and coach a team of exceptional engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Drive the team’s overall strategy and vision to develop the building blocks that unlock the most value for our internal customers, Netflix engineers
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap
  • Build and maintain strong cross-functional relationships across Platform Engineering partners and customers throughout engineering at Netflix
  • Collaborate closely within the broader Productivity Engineering organization, delivering cohesive solutions

Where you’ll focus

  • Learn about the ins and outs of the Netflix developer ecosystem to remove roadblocks and deliver cohesive solutions
  • Partner with external vendors to help influence the direction of 3rd party tools Netflix leverages across the company
  • Invest in future initiatives to increase productivity for engineers across Netflix

What sets you apart

  • Experience building and leading high-performing teams, ideally with hybrid teams
  • Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset. You initiate the hard conversations
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening
  • Experience working closely with or on a central development platform and tooling team
  • Experience developing and maintaining strong partnerships with engineering teams
  • Thoughtful exercising of strong judgment in ambiguous situations
The Collaborative Tools & Infrastructure team is responsible for building and owning the health of integrations for developer tools that reduce friction and increase productivity for engineers across Netflix. The Collaborative Tools & Infrastructure team owns and maintains a lot of 3rd party tools like Artifactory, GitHub, Bitbucket, Confluence, JIRA, and SourceGraph that enable engineers across Netflix to be more productive. 

Does this sound interesting? Or does this sound interesting but intimidating? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you! 

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Want to know more about our team?
You can learn about us:
The Netflix culture 
Productivity Engineering Podcast

6239fad2aabfb42c97f16d66.text: Senior Analytics Engineer - Games & Title Launch Management
6239fad2aabfb42c97f16d66.description:
We are seeking a Senior Analytics Engineer to lead, define and execute the data and analytics strategy for a thriving data-rich domain within Netflix called Games & Title Launch Management. As part of the Data Science & Engineering team, you will work with product, operations and technical experts to design metrics, run deep-dive analysis, build dashboards and innovative data products to quantitatively influence members and our business strategy. 

Your stakeholders, the Games & Title Launch Management teams, are responsible for launching titles (shows & movies) and games globally, accurately and on time. Each launch is a delicate orchestration of often thousands of creative, operations, and technical experts working over many months (or years), both inside and outside Netflix, to produce and assemble thousands of assets (e.g. artwork, video, subtitles, synopses, etc.) that meet Netflix’s high-quality bar. Managing such a complex project consumes and produces a tremendous amount of data. Organizing, analyzing, and deriving actionable insights from this data is essential for launch risk management & scaling Netflix’s business. This pivotal role is central to that goal. 

It is worth calling out that Games Launch Management is a relatively new and growing part of our business with its own unique exciting challenges. There you’ll find additional opportunities to shape our data strategy in a space that is close to its inception. This is in contrast to the Title Launch Management space that is relatively more data mature. Thus this role offers a great mix of working on big data problems as well as building scrappy solutions with nascent data sets.

This is the role for you and if --

  • You know what it means to own a problem space through thought leadership.
  • You are as comfortable dealing with the details as you are with the big picture.
  • You enjoy finding problems as much as solving them.
  • You can communicate effectively with experts of all backgrounds.
  • You can collaborate effectively with product managers, engineering teams, and other analytics experts to achieve shared business goals
  • You are an expert data wrangler and can pick up any tool (e.g. Tableau, D3) to get the job done.
  • You dream in SQL and Python (or other similar languages). Experience in building and managing ETL pipelines, in addition to analytics, is a big plus.
  • You are comfortable with Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Presto, etc.
  • The Netflix culture resonates with you.

623b86e0aabfb4cad6f16f15.text: Senior Engineering Manager - TV User Interface
623b86e0aabfb4cad6f16f15.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying games, TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. 
The TVUI Core team builds the experience and spreads the best architectural patterns of the industry-leading Netflix TV app. We work with our design and product partners to deliver new product features to our users. We improve engineering practices across many canvases that work beautifully across hundreds of different devices, from powerful game consoles to streaming sticks and everything in between.

What’s Different About Us

  • Our team develops TV applications, not websites or mobile apps
  • Most of the features are validated through A/B testing product variants with real customers
  • Your work will have a direct and measurable impact on the business
  • Almost all of your code will be JavaScript and TypeScript, but all the features are built on top of our custom TV platform
  • We pay top of market. We work to attract the best and brightest and pay accordingly
  • Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about us at jobs.netflix.com

What Your Every Day Will Look

  • Engineering leadership of the team building the UI on the leading TV app that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible on performance and memory-constrained devices
  • Manage, nurture and help shape a team of talented engineers working on exciting product and engineering problems
  • Partner with other engineering teams to introduce technology and components that will be used in the product
  • Work with product managers and designers to organize the development of the experiences that will shape the future of entertainment on TV-connected devices
  • Collaborate with our device platform and backend service teams to define and create functionality

What we'll expect from you

  • You’ll be coding with JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and Redux, so while you don’t need experience with the frameworks, we do expect a strong JS foundation and architectural experience
  • Scale the adoption and knowledge of best practices, patterns, and components across a team of more than 70 engineers
  • Define and influence platform features and backend APIs to align with business goals
  • Experience managing projects and creating cross-team alignment
  • Experience working with product managers and designers
  • An inclusive mentality that fosters a safe, trusting, collaborative environment
  • Experience mentoring, teaching, evangelizing, or leading in your domain
  • Continual drive to make things better

623e5b1a3d6b6210051dcc94.description:
With the explosion of Internet TV, Netflix has grown to serve over 214 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries worldwide. The Cloud Infrastructure organization’s mission is to increase the fleet-wide agility, scalability, reliability, and efficiency of our Platform. To do this, we build compute and networking abstractions that add opinions, drive standards, reduce operational burden on application owners, and allow for us to independently evolve our architecture.

We are looking for experienced engineering leaders who will lead and grow teams of senior engineers for the Host Networking and Application Networking groups in the Network Platform organization. The team provides Layer2 - Layer7 networking solutions to ensure consistent traffic management at scale throughout the Netflix ecosystem, by abstracting out the complexities of resiliency, security, routing, and insights. You will be partnering with engineering teams across all of Netflix, including service owners, platform partners, and other central teams, like our InfoSec and CDN teams to develop and execute on a cohesive strategy for how we evolve traffic flowing through our ecosystem.

If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of how Netflix scales into the future, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Drive the vision and strategy on how to evolve our Network Platform solutions
  • Build, scale, and mentor a cohesive team of amazing engineers
  • Form strong cross-functional partnerships to achieve alignment with many engineering teams and ensure our solutions meet their needs, while maintaining our focus on reliability, resiliency, security

What we are looking for:

  • We are looking for multiple leaders with experience in some, not all, of the dimensions below:
  • Experience building and operating complex distributed systems at scale. 
  • Well versed in Java or other object-oriented languages.  
  • Solid understanding of transport protocols (HTTP, HTTP/2, WebSockets, etc). 
  • Experience in Kernel networking and Embedded software development. 
  • Deep knowledge of networking technologies and abstractions in modern architectures
  • Solid understanding of Layer3/Layer4 networking, QoS, SDN, Network Security. 
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Deep empathy for users and their business goals

624633a7aabfb4a9e2cb5a66.text: Engineering Manager, Machine Learning for Experience Personalization
624633a7aabfb4a9e2cb5a66.description:
As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers of personalization to help our members find the content they’ll most enjoy. We seek to make a personalized user experience that adapts to the needs of each of our members around the world. This means going beyond just what is recommended to personalize how we display the recommendations and the way a member interacts with the user experience. Through this we want to provide each member with the best possible version of Netflix for them instead of a one-size-fits-all experience. We also seek to give each movie, game or TV show its best opportunity to appeal to our members by personalizing how it is displayed on Netflix: its artwork, trailers, metadata, explanations, etc. This allows us to provide each member with the most useful information for them when deciding what to watch and the confidence they’re making a good decision for how to spend their time.

We are looking for a manager to lead the Experience Personalization Algorithms Engineering team. In this role, you will lead the way for a team of machine learning researchers and engineers to develop the next generation of algorithms used to generate and select user experience modules, menus, artwork, trailers, metadata, and other assets shown on Netflix. This includes personalizing how we display recommendations to our members to help them find the best movie, TV show, or game (see this article for an example). This area focuses on machine learning areas around recommender systems, and bandit algorithms but also can include some elements of computer vision and natural language processing.

In this role you will be responsible for building and leading a team of world-class researchers and engineers doing cutting-edge applied machine learning. You will help select and guide projects from end-to-end: idea to production A/B tests. You will partner with people from many disciplines, including user experience designers, asset creation experts, application engineers, data scientists, and user interface teams. Your team will be responsible for the production algorithms, innovating on them, and developing new ones. To be successful in this role, you need a strong machine learning background, to be a quick learner, data-driven, have a passion for personalization, have proven engineering and skills, and the ability to lead large multi-disciplinary, cross-functional teams. You also need to be great at giving and receiving feedback, championing new ideas, empowering others, and balancing the needs of both research and engineering.

What we are looking for:

  • Experience building and leading a high-performing team of researchers and engineers
  • Experience leading in alignment with our unique culture
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to partner with teams spanning many disciplines
  • Broad knowledge of machine learning with strong mathematical foundation
  • Experience leading successful application of machine learning to real-world problems
  • Experience leading and conducting applied research in machine learning
  • Experience leading software engineering and design efforts for large-scale systems
  • Great interpersonal skills
  • MS or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field

You will ideally have experience with:

  • Recommendation Systems, Personalization, Computer Vision, or Search
  • Deep Learning, Bandits, Reinforcement Learning, or Causal Inference
  • Working with UI/UX designers and engineers
  • Java, Scala, Python
  • Spark, TensorFlow, Keras
  • A/B testing
Netflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


Hiring Manager: Justin Basilico

62702c947a9df8a6906d26bb.text: Data Engineering Manager, Studio & Creative Production DSE
62702c947a9df8a6906d26bb.description:
Netflix shows and films are produced around the world and watched by more than 200 million accounts globally, reaching new audiences every day. We aim to give content creators the opportunity to bring their most visionary ideas to life and create joy for our members around the world through innovative storytelling. 

The Studio and Creative Production Data Science & Engineering teams help enable and inform the planning, production, localization, and promotion of Netflix content. Even before filming or animation begins, Netflix Production teams are hard at work preparing for the complex operational challenges of producing live-action and animation content all over the world. Even after the content has been produced, our investment in making content successful has not ended. When a Netflix member opens our app, we have a few precious moments to help them choose a story that is right for them at that moment in time. Presenting evidence -- Artwork, Trailers, and Synopses -- that authentically represents each title and resonates with the member is essential to this effort. We also work to ensure that our global members can enjoy content in their choice of language through dubs, subtitles, and descriptive audio. 

Achieving consistently enjoyable experiences for our members through this process is a tall order, but our production managers, visual effects teams, art designers, video editors, animators, and more are experts in their craft. Perhaps a more unique aspect of Netflix is that these teams deeply leverage data to inform their decision making as they go about their tasks. Our role is to help these teams leverage data-driven methods such as reinforcement learning for Artwork & Video assets personalization and optimization methods for Studio Production workflows to drive better outcomes for our business. 

Given this rich landscape for data & insights, we are looking for a seasoned leader to manage our team of Data Engineers, based in either Los Angeles or Los Gatos. This team owns the core Studio and Creative Production data models that power analytics and machine learning models, partners with Platform and Engineering teams to build and steward complex data pipelines, and sets best practices for data storage, access, and usage by analytics engineers, data scientists, and software engineers throughout the company.

As a leader in this space, you will…

  • Hire, lead, and develop a stunning team of Data Engineers
  • Partner with other teams in Data Science & Engineering to ideate, organize, and execute on analytical projects 
  • Steer deeply impactful work on core Studio data products with Engineering, Machine Learning Infrastructure, and Data Platform partners
  • Lead innovation at Netflix by leveraging the right state-of-the-art methods in data architecture, engineering, and modeling to solve business problems

This role may be for you if…

  • You have been leading data engineering teams for 5+ years 
  • You have a proven track record leading innovative, influential data engineering work in complex business domains  
  • You are a crisp communicator who develops strong relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders
  • You are deeply invested in creating an inclusive team environment and helping each team member grow  
  • You are an experienced partner for Engineering, Machine Learning, and Data Platform teams; able to drive alignment on shared components and advocate from a data engineering perspective 
  • You have deep technical expertise in one or more aspects of data engineering (e.g., data warehousing, data modeling, data processing)
  • You’re comfortable with a collection of Big Data tech (S3, Spark, Elasticsearch, graph databases) and cloud-based (AWS) application development
Culture
You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence decision-making in a fast-paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about the Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture. 

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that an inclusive work environment builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

6298fab47a9df8b1d70d0c43.description:
At Netflix we do one thing - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content on a massive scale. Various technology investments and a unique and creative culture enable us to achieve these business objectives. This also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. We aim to strike the right balance between allowing business innovation and pragmatic risk right-sizing.

The Workforce Security team is responsible for managing corporate security risk across users, endpoints, vendors, and corporate networks. We achieve this mission by understanding the business context, providing opinionated guidance, and shaping the security strategy, architecture, and controls to manage risk in balance with business enablement. We operate across a broad scope and scale our charter through a comprehensive set of key partnerships. 

We are looking for a pragmatic leader for this team to enable our mission and cultivate strong partnerships with business and engineering stakeholders. You will be responsible for leading and cultivating a world-class team of security engineers. You will drive the strategy for workforce security investments in close collaboration with key partners with a pragmatic, risk-focused approach.

Desired background:

  • You are a pragmatic security leader who believes in risk-focused, scalable security approaches.
  • You have experience across corporate security domains (endpoint security, SaaS security, etc.).
  • You prefer collaboration and problem solving over process and mandates.  
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • You have experience partnering and managing relationships with cross-functional partner teams across the business.
  • You have experience hiring, coaching, and cultivating an excellent team.
  • You have experience translating business context to security program needs and prioritizing team investments based on risk. 
  • You are an empathetic leader who cultivates a culture of psychological safety and inclusivity where team members can do their best work.
  • You are a meticulous and responsive cross-team communicator and program leader.
We are looking for thoughtful security professionals who enable our mission and support our culture of freedom and responsibility. You can learn more about life at Netflix by watching our security talks or exploring our open source work.

Our story

Platform engineering is a team of stunning colleagues across the globe focused on providing technical products, tools, and services that enable Netflix to scale and innovate effectively and empower Netflix engineers to focus on building innovative experiences for our members and creators around the world. We deploy hundreds of services, on thousands of instances, across multiple regions, and millions of client devices.  Within Platform Engineering, the teams focused on core infrastructure focus on increasing agility, efficiency, and reliability across our compute, networking, and storage offerings, while reducing operational burden and enabling innovation for application owners.

The Role:

We are looking for an experienced product manager focused on networking to partner with engineering to build product strategies, prioritized roadmaps, and clear product specifications for the core infrastructure on which a majority of the various Netflix businesses run. We are building a strong product management team in Platform Engineering to move towards a more product-focused organization. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Define longer-term product direction and strategy across networking and cloud infrastructure that influences Platform-wide strategy
  • Develop product roadmaps and specifications across networking that inform engineering teams on objectives, scenario prioritization, and customer requirements
  • Partner with our customers (other internal Netflix engineering teams), to better understand their problems and work together to deliver needed solutions
  • Partner with other product managers and engineering teams to create cohesive strategies and roadmaps across organizational boundaries
  • Foster an environment that is customer-focused, data-driven, and hypothesis/ experimentation based
  • Engage deeply with external communities to stay abreast of industry trends and innovations
  • Help evolve the product management discipline and practices within Platform engineering

What we are looking for:

  • A combination of deep technical knowledge in networking and a customer-focused mindset
  • Demonstrated broad understanding of infrastructure technologies at scale, with an expertise in either networking or storage
  • Experience designing large scale production services in public or private cloud
  • Strategic thinker that can relate technology solutions to customer use cases
  • Comfortable handling and navigating ambiguity, working across different disciplines and teams and applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to problem solve without perfect metrics
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • 6+ years of experience in product management
A few more things about us:

As a Platform team, we come from many different countries, and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. Our team includes product managers, program managers, designers, full-stack developers, distributed systems engineers, data scientists, and folks have the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!
Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

62aa7292aabfb44b8e5825ee.description:
At Netflix, our mission is to Entertain the World. Over 200 million members around the globe enjoy our award-winning movies and TV shows, but most of our growth still lies ahead.  

The Acquisition UI team is responsible for continuously improving the customer lifecycle to attract and retain members. We build experiences on all four of our client platforms: Web, TV,  iOS, and Android.  

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer in Test who is passionate about product experiences and is focused on delivering high-quality code.

As a member of the Production Engineering team within Acquisition UI, you will:

  • Own the quality assurance for all customer lifecycle product areas in production.
  • Improve automation test stability by rebalancing the test pyramid, restructuring unstable tests, and writing new tests. 
  • Perform root-cause analysis for test failures and work with our engineering teams to resolve issues. 
  • Consult on test plans and test strategies for new product innovations.  

What sets you apart?

  • Passionate about automation, quality, and writing code
  • Persistent and persevering when solving tough problems
  • A strong sense of ownership and a proactive approach to identifying issues 
  • Deep expertise in software testing via automation, particularly on the web and TV platforms
  • Practical experiences of writing code in scripting/programming languages  - we primarily write our web automation in Javascript
  • Excellent debugging skills in diagnosing issues across a multi-tier architecture
  • Strong partnership with a wide range of service teams

What’s different about us:

  • Big impact - Opportunity to impact products that tens of millions of customers use every single day
  • Data-driven - We use A/B testing to drive feature and product decisions
  • Speed - We move quickly and iterate rapidly, taking ideas from concept to reality in weeks, not months
  • Growth - Learn from other selfless leaders around you, and mentor others
  • Stunning colleagues - Work with amazing talent on every project
  • Inclusive - We embrace different backgrounds, perspectives, and styles because it helps us make better decisions
  • Distinctive culture - we live by our values, learn more about our unique culture  
Take a peek at your future colleagues

Jeff Shi
Jeff is an Engineering Manager within Acquisition UI, leading the Production Engineering team. He has a background in UI Engineering and is passionate about having a well-balanced test structure. 

Deepa Padmanabhan
Deepa is a Senior Software Engineer on the Acquisition UI team. She is passionate about enabling smooth developer experiences and efficient deployments across our platforms. 

Marina Berti
Marina is a Senior Software Engineer on the Production Engineering team. She believes operational excellence is fundamental to a good customer experience and strives to continuously improve the testing and delivery processes.
