62bf2111b5811b1148929f6c.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in 190+ countries. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Our world-leading Product Organization team is responsible for anything a non-member or member touches when they come to the service. This team aims to improve the experiences across the diverse device ecosystem with the goal of delighting our members by offering an amazing, personalized experience that will allow them to discover relevant content.

The Product Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team is deeply embedded within the Product team at Netflix. We are looking for a well-rounded Manager that will be an insightful financial leader to the Engineering team within Product at Netflix. Netflix engineers ship thousands of lines of code every day. Their work translates into new product features, content delivery, and our service algorithms. Engineering spans multiple teams at Netflix focused on creating, building, testing, deploying, streaming, and monitoring the Netflix tech stack and building tools and applications that enable efficiency and scale within our internal studios and games businesses.

The Engineering FP&A Manager will be a trusted business partner to the Engineering organization operating with a lens of scalability at all times. We are looking for a well-rounded people leader who will manage one associate to oversee all consolidated engineering financial reporting, planning, and analysis and directly support the financial responsibilities of the Client User Experience Engineering Team. Our global engineering teams will rely on the financial expertise of this candidate to determine the most optimal solutions using cost-benefit analysis, and anticipate future cost management challenges, all while driving cost optimization through rigorous financial analysis. This role will sit in our Los Gatos offices.

The successful candidate will need to be a self-starter with tremendous skills in working and communicating with cross-functional partners and someone who enjoys problem-solving and building solutions. He/She/They will be able to manage complex work streams that involve multiple stakeholders and build strong relationships across teams. 

Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The position reports to the Director of Product FP&A and is based at the Company’s corporate headquarters in Los Gatos.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Providing financial leadership, P&L management, and strategic support for the Engineering teams
  • Support monthly, quarterly, annual, and long-range financial planning, analysis, & reporting processes for Engineering
  • Think through current and future resource allocations to drive optimal results
  • Drive efficiencies in our processes thru standardization and automation of dashboards, reports, & templates, as well as calendar alignment around key dates & deadline
  • Ability to influence through established relationships, data, and macro business factors at the Director level and up, including VPs
  • Develop high-impact frameworks, analyses, or metrics to improve decision-making in their area of the business
  • Run effective meetings to drive outcomes (e.g., draft agendas, engage relevant partners, runs meetings and discussions)
  • Able to apply analysis/problems solved in one area of responsibility to other areas within their responsibility; proactively engages with those teams to share best practices

Qualifications and Abilities

  • Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of current financial systems and processes, including Workday, Anaplan, Essbase, Tableau, and other headcount planning tools.
  • Help drive financial reporting solutions via collaboration with business partners,  Finance Technology, or Data Science & Engineering team 
  • Demonstrate an ability to prioritize your workload and, as a people leader, show reliable judgment in helping the team understand what they should and should not be working on 
  • Bring greater visibility to long and short-term financial forecasts for our cross-functional business areas, including Games, Studio Product Innovation, Animation Technology, and other areas of strategic innovation within Engineering
  • Create insightful presentations to summarize analyses and facilitate decision-making for leadership
  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders and be able to effectively communicate tracking to forecasts and insights into expense trends with recommendations on the next steps

Experiences

  • Must have 8+ years of experience in a highly analytical environment with relevant experience in a corporate finance setting.
  • Bachelor's degree required
  • Expertise in scenario/sensitivity analysis, and ROI, NPV, and IRR analysis
  • Experience working with relational databases, data, and reports; Workday, SQL, Tableau, and Anaplan knowledge a plus
  • Extremely proficient with MS Excel or G-Sheets and financial modeling; shares a passion for analytics and leveraging information systems to drive insight and distill complexity to build influence.
  • Highly motivated to develop a direct team with a lens of succession planning to ensure optimal performance within the team on a long-term basis
  • Solid understanding of accounting rules and regulations

62d1ce58aabfb471a4942701.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. This scale and experience requires a large engineering organization that collectively works together to give customers the end product they love to use.

Productivity Engineering is the organization tasked with making Netflix engineers more effective by building and supporting the infrastructure to create, build, test, deploy, run and Observe the Netflix stack. As Netflix grows, so does the complexity behind our engineering systems. Our challenge is deceivingly simple: keep the developer experience amazing even as complexity increases. Our work impacts virtually every engineer at Netflix and enables other platform teams to innovate faster. We are looking for a talented engineering leader to join our team.

In this role, you will

  • Drive the team’s strategy and vision towards a connected and opinionated Observability Exploration and Troubleshooting experience that leads to better and faster operational insights.
  • Lead, empower, challenge, and coach a team of exceptional engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap
  • Collaborate closely within the broader Productivity Engineering organization, delivering cohesive solutions

Where you’ll focus

  • Delighting Netflix engineers with amazing user experiences and customer service
  • Work to reduce toil through connected experiences that span metrics, logs, traces, events, heap dumps, and other operational datasets
  • Take more opinions on users' behalf to help engineers manage complexity in extracting insights
  • Provide polished building blocks that are great out of the box but promote extending when needed

What sets you apart

  • Experience building and leading high-performing teams
  • Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset. You initiate the hard conversations
  • Experience working closely with central development platform and tooling team
  • Experience building self-service experiences with strong UI/UX components
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening
  • Thoughtful exercising of strong judgment in ambiguous situations
Does this sound interesting but intimidating? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

62d5c8b2b5811b46a5a6e688.description:
Netflix’s recommendation systems are really good at finding the right content for our members. But as our catalog grows and our member base becomes more diverse, we need more than content recommendations. With large, diverse catalogs and content from across the globe, members need help choosing the right show/movie for that moment. What can we say about an unfamiliar title that will pique their interest? 

We provide this context to members in various ways. Using personalization to find the best artwork and video trailers for a member is one way. We are also working on optimizing text metadata - does this member care about actor/director information or the plot? Do they want to know which other titles are like this one? Do they want to know if they can watch it in one weekend?

Here is a high level overview of what we do.

As a member of this team, you will:

  • Work with machine learning experts to design offline compute systems that leverage continuous explore/exploit models to generate personalized asset and metadata recommendations - images, video trailers, synopses, ratings, similars info, etc
  • Design, implement and support very high throughput, low latency systems that deliver personalized assets in real time. The latency of these systems directly impacts the responsiveness and availability of the Netflix app and the member experience 
  • Participate in system design to ensure our systems scale with the evolving product complexity, innovative A/B tests and our global member base
  • Have the opportunity to work directly on member facing features and A/B tests(“See that artwork? We’re testing auto generated images!”)
  • Work with cross functional teams that include UI and backend engineering teams, product managers, product creative teams, data engineers and data scientists

What we are looking from in you:

  • Strong Java skills and knowledge
  • Experience leading projects or tracks of projects
  • Passion for and ability to define and drive engineering initiatives to improve scalability, reliability and quality
  • Strong debugging and problem solving skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to thrive in a highly cross-functional environment

Nice to have:

  • Experience operating services in AWS or other cloud providers
  • Experience with explore/exploit or personalization systems

Why Netflix?

  • A culture that is unique and built on the idea of Freedom and Responsibility. Our culture is all about context over control, minimal process and loosely coupled but highly aligned teams. Read more about our values here. 
  • We foster an environment where your work and passion for the product can move the business in a meaningful way.
  • As a company, we continue to thrill more than 200 million subscribers across the globe, on 1900 device types whose streaming accounts for more than a third of the internet’s downstream traffic during peak hours in North America!

62e033dfb5811b9737be1032.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Compute Platform’s purpose is to build and support products serving cloud compute needs from building to operating infrastructure impacting all parts of Netflix including Streaming, Games, Studio and Content, Machine Learning, and more. From OS Engineering on our Ubuntu-based fleet to our worldwide highly available compute fabric provided by Titus, our multi-tenant Kubernetes-based container platform and runtime, we take an active role in driving our compute primitives forward, evolving them to meet our customer’s needs. We not only design and develop our large-scale tier one systems, but also operate and support them 24 by 7.

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to join us in leading and growing our Compute Platform. As engineering at Netflix continues to grow and our compute container strategy expands, there is growing demand for efficient and scalable solutions that improve the developer experience and operational effectiveness of all our teams and systems.

About the Role

  • Drive the vision and strategy for our OS engineering and Titus data plane solutionsHire and grow our team of exceptional engineers
  • Empower, challenge, and coach a team of senior engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap
  • Build and maintain strong cross-functional relationships across Platform Engineering partners and customers throughout engineering
  • Collaborate closely within the overall Compute Platform team to function as one team, delivering cohesive solutions

What Sets You Apart

  • A self-motivated exceptional people leader with experience building and leading high-performing teams, ideally with remote or hybrid teams
  • Proactively give and receive feedback with a growth mindset
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening
  • Focus on delighting customers with amazing user experiences and customer service
  • Experience working with and operating production compute infrastructure systems at large scale
  • Thoughtfully exercise strong judgment in ambiguous situations
We believe talent is equally distributed but opportunities are not. Our US-based team is happy to embrace remote work and our core work hours are 10am - 4pm Pacific Time. We believe safe spaces where everyone can be their authentic selves is the key to a strong team so we welcome and embrace all identities, cultures, and backgrounds.

Does this sound interesting? Or does this sound interesting-but-intimidating? Please don’t self-select out, let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!

Netflix is a global company, with a diverse member base, which is why the content we produce reflects that: global perspectives, global stories. As we grow globally, we know that we must have the most talented employees with diverse backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to support our innovation and creativity. We are an equal opportunity employer and strive to build balanced teams from all walks of life.

Want to know more about our team? You can learn about us:
The Netflix culture
Titus, the Netflix container management platform, is now open source
Auto Scaling Production Services on Titus
What is Netflix Compute?

62f69d653d6b62f3903b5229.description:
It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 220 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to easily and rapidly derive actionable insights and make data-informed decisions from our vast amounts of data.

Within the Platform Engineering organization, our Data Platform exists to maximize the value of data throughout Netflix by improving the productivity and innovation of Netflix engineers, data scientists, machine learning practitioners, and business users. Our mission is to provide holistic experiences for persisting, publishing, discovering, transforming, analyzing, and deriving insights from data that simplify, accelerate, empower, and delight. Our Data Platform enables Netflix to scale effectively and evolve rapidly by providing a highly performant, secure, compliant, and flexible data infrastructure that supports the expanding needs of the business. Ultimately, we aim to democratize data by making data more accessible and useful to both technical and non-technical employees.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a senior technical product manager to help drive the next evolution of our Data Platform. Your mission is to simplify and accelerate data experience at Netflix and offer best-in-class experiences to Netflix software engineers, data engineers, analytics engineers, data scientists, machine learning practitioners, and business users.

We’re hiring for several PM roles in our Data Platform. Depending on your background and interests, your focus could be on our high availability, low latency data stores that are used in our member experience or batch and stream processing systems that enable personalization and recommendations, or analytics solutions for insights and decision making. Examples of the types of opportunities you might tackle include unifying data experience and providing holistic end-to-end workflows, managing more for users through higher levels of data abstraction, and/or rethinking how we approach global data challenges like privacy, and residency, replication, and more. The scope and impact of these roles are significant. You'll be responsible for managing a portfolio of products and driving holistic product strategy and prioritization across them.

Product Management is a newer team in Platform Engineering and we’re on a mission to raise the level of product thinking across the organization. This is a unique opportunity for you to help shape our product management practices and partner closely with engineering teams through this evolution.

If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of data at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What You Will Do

  • Deeply understand and triangulate across customer needs, product analytics, and external industry innovation to drive product vision and strategy for Data Platform offerings that maximize business and customer impact
  • Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps
  • Develop product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product and engineering teams that execute on product vision and strategy and inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved
  • Define how we will measure the success and effectiveness of our products and drive the execution and continuous evaluation of those metrics
  • Create strong partnerships with Netflix data users creating continuous feedback loops that allow us to better understand their problems
  • Ensure we are solving the right problems by sourcing input from multiple channels and prioritizing effectively to drive maximum impact for Netflix
  • Ensure that our product evolution thoughtfully addresses product lifecycle and adoption/migration experience and provides clear guidance and recommendations to Netflix data users
  • Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning/road mapping practices

What We’re Looking For

  • Proven track record of managing and evolving a product portfolio and/or driving product vision and strategy
  • A healthy blend of deep technical knowledge with a customer-focused mindset and empathy
  • Demonstrated passion for data platforms, data experience, tools, workflows, and/or data infrastructure
  • Strategic thinker that can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about the end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision
  • Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success
  • Leverages product intuition and judgment to solve problems and make decisions without perfect information
  • Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations
We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix culture.

- Exploring Data @ Netflix

Location: Remote, North America with some travel to LG, LA
Hiring Manager: Dave Schlafman

We are looking for a lead-level product designer to push the boundaries of new content experiences on Netflix. Collaborating with the world’s best content creators, we leverage our product expertise to design experiences where viewers interact and engage with Netflix content in memorable ways. This role will work closely with a talented team of designers, product managers, engineers and external content partners to help millions of members around the world discover and enjoy Netflix in new ways. 

About You
You’re equally comfortable defining new UX patterns and UIs in order to help our team expand the definition of “interactive" across Netflix. You balance a passion for designing gorgeous and emotionally resonant products with a strong desire of understanding user behavior and success through data and consumer insights. When faced with limits and ambiguity, you become more — not less — creative. You love this zone. You bring projects from concept to completion, doing everything possible to ensure their success. 

You’re smart, confident, highly competent—and humble enough not to have an ego. You’re a skilled communicator who welcomes honest, candid feedback, and your first instinct is to collaborate with others to challenge your ideas and make them even better. You partner with a cross-functional team to oversee the experience from conception to launch (and then some).

Responsibilities

  • Initiate, define and lead innovation initiatives and product features from concept through launch.
  • Collaborate with a team of designers and prototypers to explore, test, and evolve cross-platform interactive experiences on Netflix.
  • Partner with external content creators to design and implement new frameworks and features that can be utilized at scale. 
  • Own the full-stack design process—from blue sky design exploration to UX specs to polished UI designs to working with engineers to implement a flawless experience.
  • Develop and maintain positive relationships and collaborations with Product Managers, Engineering, Consumer Insights, and Content partners. 
  • Help to create a strong interactive design point-of-view and help cross-functional teams clearly understand the vision. 

Qualifications

  • 8+ years of experience designing product features for consumer products and apps 
  • Multiple successful game platform product/feature launches that drove meaningful impact to the business
  • A versatile portfolio that showcases deep interaction and visual design skills 
  • Ability to quickly produce a great range of UX/UI concepts, as well as go deep to identify edge cases. 
  • The communication skills to clearly articulate your concepts—and evangelize on their behalf
  • Experience with A/B testing and using data to inform design decisions is a plus
  • Proven leadership and strategic ability to drive initiatives and projects
  • Figma experience and working with an established design systems is a plus 
  • A love of movies, TV shows and interactive media 

Why you’ll love it here:

  • Your work is experiences globally by 300M+ viewers (and growing) in 190 countries 
  • You are empowered to imagine what new forms of entertainment on Netflix look like and create new delight for our members
  • You are surrounded by many talented people that you’re inspired by everyday   
  • On the spectrum from careful to reckless, we live right on the border of reckless (otherwise we’re not pushing boundaries)
  • You get control how you approach solving problems

62fab2b6b5811b85b67ff870.text: Engineering Manager, Machine Learning Platform Experience
62fab2b6b5811b85b67ff870.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 220M+ paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Machine Learning drives innovation across all product functions and decision support needs. Building highly scalable and differentiated ML infrastructure is key to accelerating this innovation.

The Opportunity
We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to lead the Machine Learning Experience (MLX) team, responsible for bringing excellent usability to Netflix’s Machine Learning Platform (MLP). The ML Platform org is chartered to maximize the business impact of all ML practice at Netflix and innovate on ML infrastructure to support key product functions like personalized recommendations, studio innovations, virtual productions, growth intelligence, and content demand modeling among others.

The MLX team partners with functional vertical teams within the MLP org, focussed on each area of ML practice - data & features, model development and serving. The MLX team ensures MLP’s offerings are coherent, user-friendly, self-serve, and continually evolving to meet the growing needs of ML researchers, engineers and data scientists at Netflix. The MLX team owns cross-functional, horizontal projects like Bandits for Personalization, as well as horizontal functions that include but are not limited to ML practice, dog-fooding, design consultancy, solution engineering, and ML education.

We are looking for a leader who has ideally been an ML practitioner or led a team of ML practitioners, so they can empathize with the needs of the customer and be a strong advocate for ensuring our customers have a world-class user experience leveraging our ML Platform.

Expectations

  • Vision: Understanding the media business and how technology is changing the landscape will allow you to lead your team by providing inspiring context!
  • Partnership & Culture: Establishing positive partnerships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix will be critical. We want you to regularly demonstrate the Netflix culture values like selflessness, curiosity, context over control, and freedom & responsibility in all your engagements with colleagues.
  • Judgment: Netflix teams tend to be leaner compared to our peer companies, so you will rely on your judgment to prioritize projects, working closely with your partners - the personalization research leaders.
  • Technical acumen: We expect leaders at Netflix to be well-versed with their technical domain and be an user of the products we are building, so they can provide guidance for the team when necessary. Proficiency in understanding the needs of research teams and how to bring to bear efficient ML infrastructure to meet those needs will be crucial.
  • Recruiting: Building and growing a team of outstanding engineers will be your primary responsibility. You will strive to make the team as excellent as it can be, hiring and retaining the best, and providing meaningful timely feedback to those who need it.

Minimum Job Qualifications

  • Experience leading a team responsible for large-scale ML Infrastructure
  • Outstanding people skills with high emotional intelligence
  • Excellent at communicating context, giving and receiving feedback, fostering new ideas, and empowering others without micromanagement
  • Willing to take action, without being stubborn - ability to recognize your own mistakes
  • Your team and partners see your humility all the time and diverse high-caliber talent wants to work with you

Preferred Qualifications

  • ML practitioner leader or individual contributor experience owning end-to-end ML function for a product domain
  • Built offerings for ML Researchers, Engineers and/or Data Scientists 
  • 10+ years of total experience including 5+ years of engineering management
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Applied Math, Engineering or a related field
  • Exposure to modern experimentation and A/B Testing methodologies for consumer-facing applications
  • Experience building high-scale services on a public cloud like AWS and exposure to Scala and Python
Netflix offers a creative culture that values freedom and responsibility. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other protected class. You can read more about our stance on diversity here. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing moments of joy to 220+ million customers through our shows, movies and games. The Customer Service organization’s mission is to create a world class support experience and swiftly resolve member issues. The Contact Engineering team is a vital part of Customer Service and partners closely with product and operations leaders to build global contact center applications used by our members, agents and operations teams. The team is responsible for building highly scalable and performant agent and operational productivity applications through workflow optimizations and targeted technology solutions to keep business functioning smoothly. This is an exciting time to join the team as we look to reshape the next generation of our global contact center applications.

We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead a team of senior engineers in building and maintaining the suite of contact center applications. As an engineering leader, you will drive strategic projects, deliver business impact aligned with customer service goals and metrics, streamline development of multiple critical initiatives and define the long term technology roadmap to support the product priorities.

Responsibilities:
As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be responsible for technical strategy, guidance, implementation and execution of key contact center applications.  You’ll partner closely with product management, product designers and cross functional partners to craft and evolve the vision, mission, and strategy of the Customer Service organization.  With bias towards execution, you’ll help implement effective project logistics that emphasize quality and drive progress within the team.  You'll lead the engineering hiring plan for the team, from sourcing  through hire. You’ll develop a diverse and inclusive team where team members are empowered to do their best work. You'll mentor engineers and look for opportunities to advance  their careers while keeping them engaged and focused on the product and the company vision.  

About you:
You are self driven, passionate, enjoy developing engineering strategies and have a strong execution track record for delivering high-quality applications.  You thrive in a fast paced development environment with an ability to guide and make rapid decisions.  You can disambiguate situations, driving clear action plans for your team to develop the right engineering solutions.  You are adept at solving complex technical problems and removing roadblocks so your team can focus on delivering the projects. You enjoy coaching, mentoring and developing a strong engineering team and do not shy away from having the tough feedback conversations when needed. You have experience working with a diverse group of cross functional peers - product, design, data science, and business stakeholders influencing and driving overall technical direction and decision making. 

The ideal candidate is someone who has:

  • 7+ years of software engineering experience with 5+ years of experience building and leading engineering teams
  • Solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals and software delivery process
  • Experience in hiring, developing diverse teams, creating an inclusive environment and retaining top talent
  • Experience working with product, design, business and leadership in setting the long term strategic direction for team and products
  • Experience with effectively creating alignments with multiple teams and operating well in ambiguity
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

The Opportunity
With the explosion of Internet TV, Netflix has grown to serve over 220 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries worldwide. The Cloud Engineering organization’s mission is to increase the fleet-wide agility, scalability, reliability, and efficiency of our Platform. To do this, we build compute and networking abstractions that add opinions, drive standards, reduce the operational burden on application owners, and allow us to independently evolve our architecture.
 
We are seeking a Director of Engineering to lead our Platform Networking group. You will lead and grow a team of engineering managers and engineers to develop and implement a cohesive strategy, with teams operating across the entire networking stack, from AWS networking primitives to Layer 7 gateways at scale processing millions of requests per second. 
 
You will be partnering with engineering teams across Netflix as well as working closely with AWS continuing to evolve a network that was one of the earliest to the cloud, remains one of the largest, and constantly embraces new technical approaches. Additionally, you will represent Netflix from a networking perspective working with industry organizations for example representing on the eBPF governing board. 
 
If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic leadership opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix and beyond, we would love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Drive the vision and strategy on how to evolve our Network Platform continuing to simplify software development, reduce costs and drive ever greater scale. 
  • Build, scale and mentor a cohesive team of amazing engineers and leaders
  • Form strong cross-functional partnerships to achieve alignment with many engineering teams and ensure our solutions meet their needs, while maintaining our focus on scalability, reliability, and efficiency

What we are looking for:

  • Strong understanding of cloud architectures and distributed systems at scale
  • Deep knowledge of networking technologies and abstractions in modern architectures
  • Deep empathy for users and their business goals
  • Proven experience building and leading exceptional software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity
  • Tenacity and the ability to balance competing priorities across multiple cross-functional stakeholders and programs
  • Orientation towards long-term impact, but able to strike the right balance between short term goals and longer-term vision
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Want to know more about our Cloud Infrastructure teams? Check out:

  • Evolution of Edge @Netflix
  • Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices
  • How Netflix is able to enrich VPC Flow Logs at Hyper Scale to provide Network Insight
  • Open Sourcing Zuul 2
  • Keeping Customers Streaming — The Centralized Site Reliability Practice at Netflix
  • Open-sourcing Titus
As a team, we come from many different backgrounds and countries and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science and we strive to give people the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity and agility has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment and we are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!
 
Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

632242083d6b62e049802940.text: Content Finance Data Science & Engineering, Manager
632242083d6b62e049802940.description:
Los Angeles, Los Gatos, or US-Remote

Netflix shows are produced and acquired all over the world and watched by more than 220 million accounts globally. In the Netflix Studio, we aim to give content creators the opportunity to bring their most visionary ideas to life and create joy for our members around the world through innovative storytelling. 

The Content Finance Data Science & Engineering team at Netflix is a talented group of data professionals. We help scale our Content and Studio functions by focusing on datasets describing production cost, slate financial plans, and our global workforce of vendors and production talent. These data sets represent tens of billions of dollars - a large portion of Netflix’s revenue - reinvested into entertaining the world with new, original shows. We conduct statistical analyses, develop analytic tools, develop new data sets and pipelines, and build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of producing the best content we can in the best way we can. 

We’re looking for a Manager to lead this team, and in so doing to be a key steward of Netflix’s lifeblood: our investment in content.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead, develop, and mentor a group of Analytics Engineers with diverse skill sets that cut across statistics, modeling, exploratory analytics, solution building, and data engineering
  • Create and evolve a strategic vision for analytic and tooling work in Content Finance
  • Collaborate directly with Product and Engineering teams to develop holistic technical solutions for our finance business teams
  • Take a lead role in determining how business intelligence and self-service reporting should be done at Netflix
  • Be a trusted thought partner for finance business teams in Production Finance, FP&A, and Accounting and their counterparts in other Content & Studio disciplines 
  • Persuade business partners to try new, data-enhanced ways of doing finance, and be with them every step of the journey

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Multiple years of experience building and managing high-performing analytics teams, demonstrating the ability to hire well, inspire well, adapt to business changes, and handle challenging people issues with grace
  • A demonstrated track record of influencing both business and technical partners at a VP level
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, able to act as the bridge between technical audiences and non-technical
  • A background working as a hands-on individual technical contributor in a data field: business intelligence, data engineering, analytics, data science, as examples
  • Knowledge of common analytics and data engineering programming patterns: Python/R, SQL, Spark
  • Expertise in at least one set of data warehousing and reporting technologies; able to guide technology choices from experience
  • Experience with financial systems and knowledge of common financial concepts is a plus (e.g., cash, assets, expenses, currencies, forecasting, accounting, ledgers); business consulting, FP&A, or financial forecasting experience is a plus
  • Passion for content – at the end of the day, the numbers describe TV shows and films that are loved around the world
Culture
You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment. You will work with stunning colleagues who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You can learn more about the Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture.

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

The Client and UI engineering team drives innovation for Netflix members, non-members, and studio productions.  This role is within the Client and UI Engineering organization but will represent teams working on product systems across engineering.

In the role of Technical Program Manager, you will manage engineering investments that enable consumer product innovation.  This body of work is focused on the normalization, centralization and deprecation of client of clients leveraged by infrastructure services. 

As TPM, you will partner with dozens of engineering teams to drive a shared roadmap of programs and ensure that the individual investment and technical priorities reflect the overall strategic goals.

Responsibilities include:

  • Applying strong technical, organizational and communication skills to devise sound technical approaches to abstract goals
  • Contribute to the product systems vision and strategy towards a north start architecture that reduces impediments to product innovation
  • Drive the definition and alignment on a list of top engineering priorities (bi-yearly, annual) that is shared with senior leadership to integrate with product priorities.
  • Define and manage milestones for priority projects to meet cross-organizational objectives
  • Surface and resolve conflicts in ownership or prioritization across teams and technologies 
  • Drive quarterly/annual retrospective and planning meetings to set priorities and distill learnings
  • Facilitate tracking and communication on progress of the programs with a focus on unblocking work, converging timelines and enabling accountability

Tactical:

  • Drive quarterly planning and retrospective meetings for each program to set and review OKRs, respectively. The output from the meetings will be used to provide visibility into the progress of various programs and input into QBR discussions.
  • Drive annual planning and retrospective meetings to distill learnings from the past year and prepare priorities for the upcoming year. The output from the meetings will be used to provide senior leadership with information to influence resourcing decisions.
  • Establish a proposal/project intake process for the shared roadmap that queues up items for discussion and prioritization at monthly PSL meetings. 
  • Facilitate tracking and communication on progress of the programs, e.g. via Airtable, Coda, Jira, or other tools.
  • Coordinate between teams involved in the top engineering priorities to help them unblock work, converge on timelines, and share status updates to enable better accountability. 
  • Surface and resolve conflicts in ownership or prioritization across teams.

Technical and Project Management Qualifications:

  • Software, Systems Design, and Architecture experience
  • Experience in Infrastructure, UI Engineering, or working on SW projects with consumer-facing UI components 
  • Ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, see various perspectives.
  • Able to provide insights into product vs technology tradeoffs
  • Great at adapting solutions to meet short and longer-term needs
  • Can devise and apply various approaches to the execution of complex initiatives
  • Coordination across many independent tracks of work, organization
  • Excels at leading large-scale SW projects
  • Risk identification and Mitigation
  • Can balance strategic and tactical efforts to make tough calls and broadly communicate the decision framework
  • Detail-oriented, can identify what’s missing in planning and execution of software development, test, and launch

Leadership and Communication Qualifications

  • Lead cross-functional teams to build features and experiences through influence versus control
  • Able to inspire others to collaborate and see your vision
  • Bias towards action
  • A great listener
  • Can compose technical specifications and/or wireframes to propose ideas and solutions

About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Platform Engineering’s purpose is to enable Netflix to scale effectively and empower our technical talent to focus on building innovative experiences for our members, partners, and creators around the world. We do this by providing a highly available, reliable, secure, compliant, and performant platform of data, software, and infrastructure solutions that 

1) meet the needs of our growing business
2) accelerate the productivity of Netflix engineers, scientists, and data users
3) maintains cost-efficiency that is at most linear to the growth of our business

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager for the Platform Engineering organization that will be focused on large cross-functional programs that impact almost all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product management, engineering managers, and other technical program managers to execute and align on programs.

What you will do

  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with technical teams (including product, engineering, UI/UX, Data science, etc.) that focus on building a scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure foundation
  • Leverage deep technical domain expertise to drive technical strategy, planning, and execution with engineering partners
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership
  • Champion breaking out OKRs into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays
  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly

More about you

  • You can partner with multiple cross-functional teams to define technical strategy and requirements
  • You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data-driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise 
  • You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: cloud infrastructure, engineering productivity, or data

We'd like to see

  • 10+ years of experience driving large-scale software projects with engineering and product teams
  • 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or technical product/program management experience
  • Experience managing projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes, and coordinating release schedules 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction
  • Experience in platform infrastructure platforms - either developer productivity, reliability tools, and/or AWS cloud infrastructure - storage, compute, networking

6333195daabfb4ef2020183f.description:
How do you spark joy in hundreds of millions of people? It starts with a vision - that technology can give voice to stories around the world. In delivering those much-loved stories, Netflix is responsible for a significant portion of global internet traffic.

To steward that responsibility we work collaboratively with ISPs to deploy Open Connect, Netflix’s Content Delivery Network (CDN), which delivers 100% of Netflix video traffic.  Our team’s mission is to support that delivery, by providing an automation and tooling platform that supports the internal operations and external partnerships needed to provide an amazing viewing experience for all Netflix members.  We are looking for a talented engineering leader, specializing in the infrastructure space, to join us on that mission.

About The Role

  • Balance a blended role spanning people leadership, technical project management, and functional domain ownership
  • Lead, empower, and mentor a team of exceptional engineers by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with the overall business needs
  • Collaborate closely within the broader Open Connect organization, delivering cohesive solutions
  • Form strong cross-functional partnerships, understanding the business and meeting their needs, while maintaining our focus on efficiency, maintainability, and reliability

What Sets You Apart

  • Proven experience building and leading high-performance engineering teams, with a focus on inclusion and diversity
  • Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset, confident to initiate the hard conversations
  • Ability to disambiguate, in a fast-paced environment, driving clear action plans for your team to develop the right solutions
  • Orientation towards long-term impact for prioritization, but able to strike balance between short-term goals and long-term vision
  • Experience working with a diverse group of cross functional peers - engineers, partner engagement managers, operations, and business stakeholders, at all technical levels, influencing and driving overall direction and decision making
  • Strong knowledge of networking technologies and abstractions in modern architectures
  • Experience building and operating complex distributed systems at scale
  • Deep empathy for users and their business goals
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, adept at active listening
Does this sound interesting? Or does this sound interesting-but-intimidating? Please don’t self-select out, let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!

Netflix is a global company, with a diverse member base, which is why the content we produce reflects that: global perspectives, global stories. As we grow globally, we know that we must have the most talented employees with diverse backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to support our innovation and creativity. We are an equal opportunity employer and strive to build balanced teams from all walks of life.

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

At Netflix, our mission is to Entertain the World.  Over 200 million members around the globe enjoy our award-winning movies and TV shows, but most of our growth still lies ahead. 

On the Acquisition UI Experimentation team, we’re passionate about the intersection of our business as the world’s leading streaming video company and the complex engineering challenges that come with that scale.  Our Android platform, in particular, is one of our fastest growing areas internationally, with how people sign up, identify themselves and their devices, and stay engaged all being areas of innovation.  

Our Android app is shipped to tens of millions of users around the world, where the visible product experiences we create on this team are often how people are first introduced to Netflix.  From large-scale A/B tests, foundational client infrastructure, and sophisticated testing and automation, engineers on our team drive highly impactful projects that convince those people to join and stay with our service.

People who excel on our team are growth-oriented, curious, and selfless.  We are part of a global, diverse organization that values inclusion and equity.  We encourage anyone who is passionate about building compelling mobile experiences that touch audiences around the world to apply.

About the role

  • Collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers to build delightful, performant, and accessible user experiences.
  • Contribute to product features and A/B tests by using Android Architecture Components in an MVVM architecture, built with Kotlin.
  • Develop highly maintainable Android client code with effective documentation.
  • Write automated tests with Roboelectric and Espresso, from unit tests to full end-to-end UI automation, to deliver high quality code.
  • Keep an eye out on the latest Android developments such as Jetpack Compose and new APIs available each year, and how we can use them to improve our user experience flows over time.

What sets you apart?

  • Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, our consumer base, and the product and business challenges that we face.
  • Always seeking different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to continuously grow and improve.
  • Taking a thoughtful, practical approach to problem-solving that considers tradeoffs and avoids over-engineering.
  • Comfortable asking questions and seeking knowledge in unfamiliar or ambiguous situations.
  • Endeavors to elevate the knowledge, skills, and abilities of yourself and others that is conducive to fostering an inclusive, collaborative environment.

What’s different about us?

  • Acquisition UI is a team that celebrates and values the business impact we have on Netflix, and not just the engineering contributions we make.  If you have a strong product mindset that loves knowing how your work directly impacts our customer growth and revenue, this is the team for you.
  • We move fast and iterate quickly - we take ideas from concept to reality in a matter of weeks, not quarters.  Expect a broader range of projects compared to other teams.
  • Inclusivity is something we embrace - diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and styles are something we’re proud of.  You can be your authentic self on this team, as we look for culture adds, not culture fits
Take a peek at your future colleagues

Clarence Leung
Clarence is an Engineering Manager within Acquisition UI, leading the Experimentation team, and previously was an Android engineer on the team.  Beyond his passion for wilderness backpacking, he cares deeply about Netflix’s user accessibility, from content to each product feature the team builds.
 
Christopher Luu
Christopher is a Staff Software Engineer on the AUI Production Engineering team, focusing on the Android and iOS platforms. He loves pushing the boundaries on what’s possible on the mobile platforms, while striving for clean, testable, but still fun code.
 
Anna Wygant
Anna is a Senior Software Engineer on the Acquisition UI Experimentation team. When she’s not out snowboarding you can find her creating reusable components and utilities for her fellow developers, or driving A/B tests to discover the best experiences for each unique Netflix market.

Rohit Sahay
Rohit is a remote Senior UI Engineer on the Experimentation team within Acquisition UI. He's passionate about creating exceptional user experiences on the Web to accelerate key growth initiatives at Netflix.

634f05cfb5811b5cd94f743f.description:
Netflix’s recommendation systems are really good at finding the right content for our members. But as our catalog grows and our member base becomes more diverse, we need more than content recommendations. With large, diverse catalogs and content from across the globe, members need help choosing the right show/movie for that moment. What can we say about an unfamiliar title that will pique their interest? 

We provide this context to members in various ways. Using personalization to find the best artwork and video trailers for a member is one way. We are also working on optimizing text metadata - does this member care about actor/director information or the plot? Do they want to know which other titles are like this one? Do they want to know if they can watch it in one weekend?

Here is a high level overview of what we do.

As a member of this team, you will:

  • Work with machine learning experts to design offline compute systems that leverage continuous explore/exploit models to generate personalized asset and metadata recommendations - images, video trailers, synopses, ratings, similars info, etc
  • Design, implement and support very high throughput, low latency systems that deliver personalized assets in real time. The latency of these systems directly impacts the responsiveness and availability of the Netflix app and the member experience 
  • Participate in system design to ensure our systems scale with the evolving product complexity, innovative A/B tests and our global member base
  • Have the opportunity to work directly on member facing features and A/B tests(“See that artwork? We’re testing auto generated images!”)
  • Work with cross functional teams that include UI and backend engineering teams, product managers, product creative teams, data engineers and data scientists

What we are looking from in you:

  • Strong Java skills and knowledge
  • Experience leading projects or tracks of projects
  • Passion for and ability to define and drive engineering initiatives to improve scalability, reliability and quality
  • Strong debugging and problem solving skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to thrive in a highly cross-functional environment

Nice to have:

  • Experience operating services in AWS or other cloud providers
  • Experience with explore/exploit or personalization systems

Why Netflix?

  • A culture that is unique and built on the idea of Freedom and Responsibility. Our culture is all about context over control, minimal process and loosely coupled but highly aligned teams. Read more about our values here. 
  • We foster an environment where your work and passion for the product can move the business in a meaningful way.
  • As a company, we continue to thrill more than 200 million subscribers across the globe, on 1900 device types whose streaming accounts for more than a third of the internet’s downstream traffic during peak hours in North America!

The Role

With nearly 200 million members in over 190 countries and a billion hours of streaming each month, Netflix is the world’s leading online entertainment company. We produce hundreds of new series, movies, documentaries, stand-up specials, and content across various other categories each year. Because of our global footprint, we are able to elevate new types of creators, tell a diverse set of stories and inspire a global audience.

The Content Demand Modeling team, within Data Science & Engineering, plays a central role in informing and supporting content decisions. Arming our creative teams with data-driven insights improves both the efficiency and accuracy of decision-making and helps Netflix produce more hits and create more member joy at better economics. 

We are looking for an exceptional machine learning leader to manage a team of stunning machine learning scientists and engineers that own and innovate upon a suite of high-visibility ML models. These models offer key content metric predictions at all stages in a title’s lifecycle and are leveraged by a broad set of stakeholders across the company to inform a variety of content decisions from planning our slate to production execution to post-launch evaluation and renewals.

Responsibilities

  • Lead a team of applied machine learning scientists and provide technical guidance and mentorship to members of the team.
  • Drive the vision and shape the roadmap of content prediction models, thoughtfully balancing the needs of multiple business stakeholder teams.
  • Amplify the impact of the team and foster trust in model-driven outputs from content strategy & creative stakeholder teams. 
  • Understand and work backwards from the needs, workflows, and decision points of content creators in shaping the team’s roadmap and outputs. 
  • Be a strategic thought partner for the Content, Strategy & Analysis teams, in identifying opportunities for impact from content prediction models.
  • Manage high-quality and robust production-level machine learning models in a rapidly evolving business environment.
  • Collaborate effectively and influence roadmaps of partner data science & engineering teams.
  • Enact Netflix values in daily work and interactions.

At Netflix, our mission is to Entertain the World.  Over 200 million members around the globe enjoy our award-winning movies and TV shows, but most of our growth still lies ahead. 

On the Acquisition UI Experimentation team, we’re passionate about the intersection of our business as the world’s leading streaming video company and the complex engineering challenges that come with that scale.  Our Android platform, in particular, is one of our fastest growing areas internationally, with how people sign up, identify themselves and their devices, and stay engaged all being areas of innovation.  

Our Android app is shipped to tens of millions of users around the world, where the visible product experiences we create on this team are often how people are first introduced to Netflix.  From large-scale A/B tests, foundational client infrastructure, and sophisticated testing and automation, engineers on our team drive highly impactful projects that convince those people to join and stay with our service.

People who excel on our team are growth-oriented, curious, and selfless.  We are part of a global, diverse organization that values inclusion and equity.  We encourage anyone who is passionate about building compelling mobile experiences that touch audiences around the world to apply.

About the role

  • Collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers to build delightful, performant, and accessible user experiences.
  • Contribute to product features and A/B tests by using Android Architecture Components in an MVVM architecture, built with Kotlin.
  • Develop highly maintainable Android client code with effective documentation.
  • Write automated tests with Roboelectric and Espresso, from unit tests to full end-to-end UI automation, to deliver high quality code.
  • Keep an eye out on the latest Android developments such as Jetpack Compose and new APIs available each year, and how we can use them to improve our user experience flows over time.

What sets you apart?

  • Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, our consumer base, and the product and business challenges that we face.
  • Always seeking different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to continuously grow and improve.
  • Taking a thoughtful, practical approach to problem-solving that considers tradeoffs and avoids over-engineering.
  • Comfortable asking questions and seeking knowledge in unfamiliar or ambiguous situations.
  • Endeavors to elevate the knowledge, skills, and abilities of yourself and others that is conducive to fostering an inclusive, collaborative environment.

What’s different about us?

  • Acquisition UI is a team that celebrates and values the business impact we have on Netflix, and not just the engineering contributions we make.  If you have a strong product mindset that loves knowing how your work directly impacts our customer growth and revenue, this is the team for you.
  • We move fast and iterate quickly - we take ideas from concept to reality in a matter of weeks, not quarters.  Expect a broader range of projects compared to other teams.
  • Inclusivity is something we embrace - diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and styles are something we’re proud of.  You can be your authentic self on this team, as we look for culture adds, not culture fits
Take a peek at your future colleagues

Clarence Leung
Clarence is an Engineering Manager within Acquisition UI, leading the Experimentation team, and previously was an Android engineer on the team.  Beyond his passion for wilderness backpacking, he cares deeply about Netflix’s user accessibility, from content to each product feature the team builds.
 
Christopher Luu
Christopher is a Staff Software Engineer on the AUI Production Engineering team, focusing on the Android and iOS platforms. He loves pushing the boundaries on what’s possible on the mobile platforms, while striving for clean, testable, but still fun code.
 
Anna Wygant
Anna is a Senior Software Engineer on the Acquisition UI Experimentation team. When she’s not out snowboarding you can find her creating reusable components and utilities for her fellow developers, or driving A/B tests to discover the best experiences for each unique Netflix market.

Rohit Sahay
Rohit is a remote Senior UI Engineer on the Experimentation team within Acquisition UI. He's passionate about creating exceptional user experiences on the Web to accelerate key growth initiatives at Netflix.

Who are we?
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 220+ million memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. And as of November 2022 we added an advertisement branch to our business, making Netflix service accessible to an even broader member base with ad-supported plans!
 
Ads Data Engineering team sits at the core of building a data ecosystem that will power Netflix’ understanding and decision making about what impact ads have on our business. It is a part of a larger data engineering org within Content and Studio Data Engineering horizontal, with a strong sense of engineering community that fosters technical and personal growth. This team’s main focus is to build rich, connected, and easily accessible data about ad inventories, forecasting, targeting, and much more. Core data about ads is used across multiple business areas and functions, from getting informative analytics to feature development for statistical models. The scope of this team’s work is rapidly growing and there are many opportunities for impacting Netflix’s journey into advertisement. We need an innovative leader, with ad ecosystem experience, to drive the team’s evolution in a quickly evolving business.

Who are you?

  • Beyond talented, you are curious, creative, and tenacious
  • You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear, all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it
  • You have an extensive background and strong technical expertise working with advertising data and understand how to build for scale, privacy, and business impact
  • You have previous experience in building data systems from the ground up
  • A role model for integrity: you have great judgment and can make tough decisions without agonizing
  • You have a high tolerance for ambiguity and fast-changing context
  • You enjoy working on hard problems with new tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making big impact
  • You are experienced in hiring and leading high-caliber data teams with diverse technical strengths
  • You have some people leadership experience: being a strong technical mentor and champion cultivating individual growth

What will you do?

  • Provide technical vision and strategy for building a data ecosystems that enables Netflix to leverage data about ads within cross-functional teams
  • Build strong relationships across business, science, analytics, and engineering partners
  • Balance immediate stakeholder needs vs longer term vision
  • Lead a dream team of data engineers to execute on a shared vision between analytics, engineering and business partners
  • Grow and mentor this team through thoughtful observation and courageous, honest feedback
  • Build a secure and robust data ecosystems for all data related to ads analytics

What (ideally) do you know?

  • Domains related to advertising, data privacy, GDPR
  • How to work with analytics practitioners in various contexts
  • A collection of Big Data tech (S3, Spark, Elasticsearch, graph databases)
  • Cloud based (AWS) application development
  • Team based software development tools and best practices
Netflix Culture
Netflix offers amazing colleagues, constantly evolving technology, fascinating analytical and technical challenges, and a Freedom & Responsibility culture that is truly unique. Ourculture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. You can learn more about Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture.

We do one thing at Netflix - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content at a massive scale. We have a strong engineering organization that enables us to achieve these business objectives and a unique and creative culture that guides us to operate with “Freedom and Responsibility”. This helps keep engineering velocity high, but also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility to do the right thing for Netflix. Instead of controlling engineers with process and security gates, we enable them to build secure code and provide them with adequate security context to make the right decisions for Netflix.

The Team
The Security Technical Program Management team is a force multiplier for the Information Security organization; we partner closely with engineering and business teams across Netflix to deliver impactful and scalable security initiatives. The team is also a key driver for the success of Netflix Security’s partnership program which aims at enabling our customers and stakeholders to meet their goals in a secure way. We collaborate with leaders inside and outside the organization to align on strategic goals and vision to further the security roadmaps for our partnering teams in a business-driven way. We then work with the right stakeholders to establish and drive initiatives that move the needle on this. 

The Opportunity
You will drive large, at-scale security initiatives across multiple stakeholders ranging from central engineering orgs, corporate and studio leadership and teams, product managers, engineering managers, and developers. It is a great opportunity to help mature the security posture in the most rapidly growing parts of our business and gain intimate knowledge of Netflix’s security products and services. These are highly visible and cross-functional efforts that require building and driving technical thought leadership across Netflix’s engineering and business organizations. 

We are leaning into the “T” for this role. By technical, we mean that the ideal candidate has a strong understanding of the overall security domain (specifically workforce or corporate security) and the ability to gain a technical understanding of programs across their lifecycle. TPMs must be skilled at both strategy and execution as well as have depth in their technical domain. 

Onboard, one of the first initiatives you will be responsible for is to drive the vision of the Endpoint Security strategy at Netflix. This includes crafting and executing the overall program including transforming the vision into a program strategy, building the technical strategy, and developing quarterly roadmaps. This program will involve working with numerous stakeholders, across infosec and engineering, on how to reduce the risk and increase our security posture. You’ll explore and solve Endpoint Security challenges in a dynamic business and engineering environment that will expose you to the entire breadth of Netflix assets and technologies.

You will be successful in this role if:

  • You are passionate about leading by influence and advocating for change. 
  • You have a demonstrated ability to establish a vision and execute it.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience.
  • You are able to triage multiple initiatives to make a judgment to tackle the right problems at the right time.
  • You have the ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs technology tradeoffs.
  • You have developed and driven security initiatives such as rolling out endpoint security, vendor security, etc. 
  • You have familiarity with enterprise security principles and best practices, including a working knowledge of endpoint security, network security, and/or supply chain risk management, to name a few.

A few reasons why we love this work and think you will too:

  • You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful security work for the Netflix engineering ecosystem.
  • You will be working with an industry-leading security team with many opportunities to improve existing projects and identify new ones.
  • You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share them across the community.
  • You enjoy learning and working closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, data science and engineering, content delivery networks, and a production studio.

637bd09b7a9df8368d0400ae.text: Systems Engineering Manager - Corporate Systems Engineering
637bd09b7a9df8368d0400ae.description:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing moments of joy to 200+ million customers. The Corporate Systems Engineering (CoSE) team at Netflix focuses on improving the employee experience, collaboration, and productivity of our global employees and support teams. We provide a broad portfolio of enterprise systems and software as a service from Active Directory to Google Workspace. As a centralized engineering team responsible for helping Netflix employees with how they work, we aim to remove friction, simplify workflows by increasing automation, and provide technical solutions so they can focus on bringing engaging stories to our members all over the world.

This role is responsible for setting the vision and leading the team.  You’ll be a key engineering leader in the Netflix Product Organization and contribute widely as a central team leader, especially given the substantial opportunities and need to work cross-functionally.  

You will likely spend your time networking both inside and outside the company, recruiting for your team, building effective and strong partnerships with stakeholders.  You will work closely with teams your team needs to collaborate with, providing and receiving feedback effectively and aligning on shared deliverables as needed.  You will collaborate with your team to set the vision for Systems Engineering within CoSE and work with other leaders within Corporate Engineering to help guide Corporate Engineering as an organization.

What we do:

  • Improve and maintain identity-related workflows supporting critical processes such as onboarding, user and device provision, and offboarding
  • Design and build lightweight integrations between services in our environment (both built in-house and SaaS) that need to exchange data; 
  • Actively work to automate (where possible) and transition (where not) support work to Netflix’s in-house world-class tier 2 support organization;
  • Design the next generation of office-supporting infrastructure such as Active Directory-based authentication services

What we're looking for:

  • You’re deeply passionate about inclusion, diversity, and equity and have some experience improving aspects of these where you’ve worked; 
  • You have experience leading teams with highly diverse skill sets; 
  • You can effectively hire and retain high-impact people from diverse backgrounds with diverse motivations; 
  • You can effectively partner with others in the organization and use your thoughtfulness and empathy to understand the challenges they face and how you can work together to better life for Netflix employees; 
  • You can operate both tactically and strategically and know when best to choose which of these approaches is appropriate in the moment; 
  • You’re humble, have some understanding of where/how you’d like to grow, and thirst for supportive, constructive feedback from others to continue to improve yourself; 
  • You’re courageous and willing to do uncomfortable things like giving people feedback.  
  • You have a passion for systems engineering, AWS, and SaaS management at scale; 
  • You have 3-5 years experience and success, leading engineering teams staffed with new grads mid career and senior, autonomous engineers; 
  • You are well versed in technical principles like cloud engineering, operational excellence, and balancing performance, efficiency, and reliability;
  • You’re deeply interested in organizational culture and health and have enough familiarity with Netflix’s culture to both find it primarily attractive and to have questions about how it manifests on the ground and impacts your ability to do your job.

Does this list of attributes excite you? Better yet, do the majority of these characteristics describe you? If so, we’d love to chat.
