The Role

With nearly 200 million members in over 190 countries and a billion hours of streaming each month, Netflix is the world’s leading online entertainment company. We produce hundreds of new series, movies, documentaries, stand-up specials, and content across various other categories each year. Because of our global footprint, we are able to elevate new types of creators, tell a diverse set of stories and inspire a global audience.

The Content Demand Modeling team, within Data Science & Engineering, plays a central role in informing and supporting content decisions. Arming our creative teams with data-driven insights improves both the efficiency and accuracy of decision-making and helps Netflix produce more hits and create more member joy at better economics. 

We are looking for an exceptional machine learning leader to manage a team of stunning machine learning scientists and engineers that own and innovate upon a suite of high-visibility ML models. These models offer key content metric predictions at all stages in a title’s lifecycle and are leveraged by a broad set of stakeholders across the company to inform a variety of content decisions from planning our slate to production execution to post-launch evaluation and renewals.

Responsibilities

  • Lead a team of applied machine learning scientists and provide technical guidance and mentorship to members of the team.
  • Drive the vision and shape the roadmap of content prediction models, thoughtfully balancing the needs of multiple business stakeholder teams.
  • Amplify the impact of the team and foster trust in model-driven outputs from content strategy & creative stakeholder teams. 
  • Understand and work backwards from the needs, workflows, and decision points of content creators in shaping the team’s roadmap and outputs. 
  • Be a strategic thought partner for the Content, Strategy & Analysis teams, in identifying opportunities for impact from content prediction models.
  • Manage high-quality and robust production-level machine learning models in a rapidly evolving business environment.
  • Collaborate effectively and influence roadmaps of partner data science & engineering teams.
  • Enact Netflix values in daily work and interactions.

Who Will be Successful in this Role

  • In order to be successful in this position, you will need 1) business acumen to understand how data-driven approaches can effectively influence creative decisions (effective bridges between art & science), 2) to collaborate effectively with a broad and complex set of partners and stakeholders across the company and 3) technical acumen to mentor and grow top-notch applied ML individual contributors.

Specific qualifications include:

  • Demonstrated experience in building, managing, mentoring, and inspiring applied science teams, with a proven track record of leveraging machine learning to drive impact.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including proven ability to effectively collaborate with a variety of technical and non-technical  business partners and other data science leaders. 
  • PhD in Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or related field.
  • Experience in developing, prototyping, and deploying machine learning models.
  • High-energy self-starter with a passion for business impact through data science (especially machine learning), tolerance for ambiguity in a fast-paced setting, and a positive attitude.
To learn more about Netflix research, check out the Netflix Research website.

Culture

You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment. You will work with stunning colleagues who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You can learn more about Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture. 

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

639ccf7bb5811b46fcf3cd7c.text: Technical Program Manager (L5) - Third Party Applications Development
639ccf7bb5811b46fcf3cd7c.description:
At Netflix we do one thing - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content at a massive scale. We have a strong engineering organization that enables us to achieve these business objectives and a unique and creative culture that guides us to operate with “Freedom and Responsibility”. Scaling engineering is an interesting challenge and the Managed Vendor Development (MVD) program helps tackle this unique challenge. We extend engineering through a pool of talented contract engineers who build to Netflix engineering standards and best practices. We take on competing projects and deploy our talented engineers to existing teams to accelerate development. Managing this company-wide program requires a talented program manager who can balance program strategy and execution of numerous critical applications. 

The Team
As a force multiplier for the engineering organization, we partner closely with engineering and business teams across Netflix to deliver impactful and scalable projects. We collaborate with leaders across Netflix to understand their strategic goals and vision, translate business problems into requirements, and oversee the development of solutions. We seek to learn what’s critical to business and act as advisors to build our near-term and long-term roadmaps.  We then work with the right stakeholders to establish and drive initiatives that move the needle on this. 

The Opportunity
You will lead our at-scale third-party developed application program. This a very strategic and cross-functional role with a goal to build out this program and drive the engineering solutions to fruition. We are looking for a leader who is passionate, has led highly cross-functional strategic programs, and will streamline the development of multiple critical projects. It will involve work across multiple stakeholders ranging from central engineering orgs, corporate, studio leadership and teams, product managers, engineering managers, and developers. This is a highly visible and cross-functional effort that requires building and driving technical thought leadership across Netflix’s engineering and business organizations. 

We are leaning into the “T” (Technical) for this role. By technical, we mean that the ideal candidate has a strong understanding and curiosity for system design and the overall software engineering lifecycle. You will implement best practices and continuously improve standards for development processes that promote a high standard of product delivery. TPMs must be skilled at both strategy and execution as well as have depth in their technical domain.

You will be successful in this role if:

  • You are passionate about leading by influence and advocating for change. 
  • You have a demonstrated ability to establish a vision and execute it.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience.
  • You are able to triage multiple initiatives to make a judgment to tackle the right problems at the right time.
  • You manage projects through the entire software development lifecycle, create product roadmaps and work closely with project teams to drive project prioritization.
  • You have the ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs technology tradeoffs.
  • You have experience building strong vendor relations and are able to influence and hold them accountable to procure high-quality software engineering resources and deliver projects to fruition.

A few reasons why we love this work and think you will too:

  • You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful business priorities.
  • You get to be creative, pragmatic and make data-informed decisions.
  • You will be uniquely positioned to define and drive the program strategy that can ultimately drive significant business impact.
  • You enjoy solving complex problems and will work with a stunning group of colleagues who are passionate about solving similar problems.
  • You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share them across the community.
  • You enjoy learning and working closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, data science and engineering, content delivery networks, and a production studio.

It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to over 223 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We’ve become the largest entertainment studio in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace. The Content and Business Product organization is a key driver of this growth. We build products that fuel operational excellence and innovation in workflows from script to screen, empowering global Netflix teams in creating amazing shows to constantly delight members! 
 
This role is part of our Content & Media Foundations team, which is focused on developing products to create and manage media assets across the script-to-screen supply chain, including the movie-making process. We are seeking a Product Manager with a history of outstanding accomplishments to join our team.  This role will own the Product Management for a few components of our Content Hub ecosystem focused on providing innovative solutions to enhance the production of live-action content.   
 
As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for helping to build products in partnership with a cross-functional team of engineers, peer product managers, and business stakeholders to deliver scalable media asset management workflows and solutions for our global studio teams and productions that drive impact and optimize the scale and complexity of our business. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways, the boldness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, exceptional organizational influence, and will be equally as excited about media asset formats and seamless user experiences.
 
At Netflix, our product team is small and orchestrates the work of stunning cross-functional teams like design and engineering, so you will have the opportunity to make a big impact, and our unique culture drives our approach to innovation.

In this role you will:

  • Own product management of parts of Netflix’s Content Hub ecosystem focused on providing innovative solutions to enhance the production of live-action content
  • Partner with peer product managers, technical program managers, engineering, design, data science, and insights teams to drive efficiencies in media management workflows
  • Partner with stakeholders to dissect current workflows and integrate custom technology and off-the-shelf offerings to solve the most pressing and highest-impact business problems
  • Foster a learning culture across the cross-functional squad that you lead and inspire them to deliver with a high velocity and understand the impact of their work
  • Socialize project timelines and roadmaps and maintain accountability on deliverables
  • Collaborate with operational teams to roll out products to our employees and partners

What we’re looking for:

  • At least 2 years of Product Management experience and/or a proven record of successfully launching products, features, or platforms
  • Keen understanding of or demonstrated ability to pick up media formats and production/post-production workflows/tools used in the domain
  • Ability to prioritize well and mobilize execution teams and business partners toward a common goal
  • Strong communication skills, in writing and verbally, whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with senior leaders
  • Exceptional analytical skills
  • A passion for Product Management, a strong ability to dive into the unknown and create clarity amid chaos
  • Flexible amid an ever-changing and growing environment

63bf029f7a9df8a920f820da.description:
Come and join the team responsible for localization at Netflix! We are a passionate team dedicated to bringing the Netflix experience to international markets. We are looking for a highly motivated localization program manager who is excited to ensure that the Netflix experience is global and local worldwide..

In this role, you will work with Product, Design, Engineering, different functions within Globalization, and other cross functional teams. You will develop and manage the localization strategy & roadmap, schedules, budget and quality for your component and guarantee the successful launch of the Netflix experience and content internationally.

The environment is fast-paced, requiring the ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision and manage aggressive deadlines. You will need to demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work through ambiguity comfortably and effectively. The right mix of organizational and communication skills is key to success. Attention to detail and a proven ability to manage priorities are also essential. 

You will use your experience & education in:

  • Defining the best localization strategy that guarantees the most effective and efficient launch of Netflix experience in all languages. 
  • Fostering relationships and partnering with key stakeholders to develop localization strategy and roadmap for your area
  • Driving Language and feature launches & their prioritization and appropriate tactics, or the analysis of large scale innovation projects
  • Gathering, analyzing & reporting on the data; looking for opportunities to optimize on workflows, inefficiencies or customer issues that have been reported
  • Establishing and ensuring high quality localization standards, while overseeing the program for your component end to end, from Innovation to QC needs 
  • Evangelizing Globalization to all cross functional stakeholders
  • AB Test analysis, influence & Globalization participation that drives international acquisitions & viewership
  • Manage localization pipelines in line with business needs, collaborating with other Program Managers, Engineering and Product

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in Languages, Localization,  International studies,  Business management, technology management, Communication studies or equivalent experience is applicable
  • 10-15+ years experience in localization program management working on language launches, global software launches, creative content and/or subtitle localization
  • 10+ years of production or program management at senior levels
  • Ability to lead large scale technical, and cross functional programs to delivery
  • Solid in-depth knowledge of internationalization and localization is a plus
  • Working knowledge of industry standard localization tools
  • Fluency in a non-English language is a plus

63c59560b5811b0e0eddafc5.description:
It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 220 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe.

Within the Platform Engineering organization, our Developer Platform exists to maximize the impact of Netflix engineers by providing holistic experiences for building and managing software through the entire lifecycle of development, delivery, operations, and maintenance. Our Developer Platform enables Netflix to scale effectively and evolve rapidly by providing highly reliable, performant, secure, and flexible developer tools, services, and infrastructure to support the expanding needs of the business. Ultimately, we aim for Netflix engineers to spend less time on repetitive engineering tasks, unnecessary complexity, and undifferentiated heavy lifting so they can spend more time helping Netflix entertain the world.

The Opportunity

We are looking for technical product managers to help drive the next evolution of our Developer Platform. Your mission is to simplify and accelerate developer experience and offer best-in-class experiences that empower and delight software engineers at Netflix. We continually strive to manage more for developers so they can innovate more for Netflix.

We are currently hiring for two product domains in our Developer Platform:

Operate
Your mission is to ensure Netflix engineers can easily monitor and understand the health of their systems, rapidly troubleshoot and remediate incidents, achieve high reliability and availability, and reduce operator toil. This product domain focuses on the experience of operating software & systems across environments, including products, experiences, and abstractions for monitoring and alerting, troubleshooting, incident management and remediation, exploration and visualization of metrics, events, logs, and traces (MELT), profiling and diagnostic tools, and production readiness, operational maturity, and service level objectives (SLOs). You'll continually innovate to reduce operator toil, such as applying machine learning to improve availability by detecting and remediating incidents with minimal operator involvement and ensuring emergent recommended operational standards & practices can easily be provided out-of-the-box and updated on both new and existing services.

Developer Experience
Your mission is to ensure Netflix engineers can easily discover, learn, and use our developer platform to build and manage software for their use cases with low friction, cognitive load, and choice burden.This product domain focuses on our engineering console and front door developer experience and cross-cutting, end-to-end user journeys, including product discovery, learning, and integrated knowledge, software catalog and search, software inventory management, ownership, and maintenance, project bootstrapping and provisioning workflows, change campaigns and migration experience, and scorecards to check, measure, report and provide actionable feedback and guidance on alignment to recommended products and software standards & practices. You'll innovate to reduce time to market for platform providers to ship new experiences and capabilities, ensure our products are connected into a unified, consistent experience across developer workflows, where engineers can easily discover and navigate guidance for their use cases with well-paved options and recommendations.

What You Will Do

  • Deeply understand and triangulate across customer needs, product analytics, and external industry innovation to drive product vision and strategy for Developer Platform offerings that maximize business and customer impact
  • Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps
  • Develop product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product and engineering teams that execute on product vision and strategy and inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved
  • Define how we will measure the success and effectiveness of our products and drive the execution and continuous evaluation of those metrics
  • Create strong partnerships with Netflix engineers creating continuous feedback loops that allow us to better understand their problems
  • Ensure we are solving the right problems by sourcing input from multiple channels and prioritizing effectively to drive maximum impact for Netflix
  • Ensure that our product evolution thoughtfully addresses product lifecycle and adoption/migration experience and provides clear guidance and recommendations to Netflix engineers
  • Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning/roadmapping practices

What We’re Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience as a Technical Product Manager
  • Proven track record of managing and evolving a product portfolio and/or driving product vision and strategy
  • A healthy blend of deep technical knowledge with customer-focused mindset and empathy
  • Demonstrated passion for developer platforms, developer experience, tools, workflows, and/or infrastructure
  • Strategic thinker that can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision
  • Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success
  • Leverages product intuition and judgment to solve problems and make decisions without perfect information
  • Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations
We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. 

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $90,000 - $900,000

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

- Machine Learning for a Better Developer Experience (techblog)
- Managed Delivery: Bringing Infrastructure as Code to Spinnaker (video)
- Evolving Continuous Integration at Netflix (video)
- Taming Polyglot Development Using Docker (video)

At Netflix, we are passionate about delivering joy to hundreds of millions of Netflix members around the world, whether they’re traveling to a remote location or at home with family.  The iOS mobile application brings Netflix to our members, wherever they may be, and the iOS Client Foundations team is responsible for building the frameworks, core technologies, and underlying architecture of the Netflix iOS application. 

This team builds paved-path solutions that address the needs of iOS UI product engineers, including app architecture, data access (e.g. GraphQL), quality of experience (QoE), and client observability. This team also operates as a central hub for iOS at Netflix, bringing iOS engineers together across the engineering organization for conversations, learning and community.

We are looking for an experienced engineering manager to lead the iOS Client Foundations team and drive technology investments needed to scale the iOS product. With Netflix’s focus on international growth and new forms of entertainment such as games, there is a growing demand for mobile product innovations that increase value for our members worldwide. The work of the iOS Client Foundations team enables us to iterate quickly on product AB tests while having confidence in the quality of the product. In this role, you will collaborate with other senior, high-performing engineers and leaders to pursue challenging and novel opportunities.

The Role:

  • Lead a team of senior iOS engineers who value inclusion, transparency, autonomy, and humility.
  • Empower, challenge, and coach team members to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback.
  • Effectively identify, prioritize, and manage high-impact initiatives on the team’s technical roadmap.
  • Collaborate, build alignment, and develop strong relationships with engineering partners across client, server, and productivity teams.
  • Support and enable communication across the strong iOS engineering community at Netflix 
  • Strategically manage the engineering challenges and risks associated with shipping complex infrastructure solutions that impact the core product experience on a regular, rapid cadence.
  • Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values.

What sets you apart:

  • Experience building and leading high-performance mobile client engineering teams with high degrees of psychological safety.
  • Proactively gives and receives feedback; is not afraid to have difficult conversations.
  • Seeks different perspectives and relevant context to effectively navigate ambiguity.
  • Familiar with the needs of continuous integration, automation infrastructure, and developer ergonomics of a large and growing group of iOS engineers across multiple teams.
  • Ability to build and own a technical roadmap that serves product engineering teams, through collaboration with engineers and partners across multiple teams and organizations.
  • Human-centric leader who centers empathy and welcomes feedback.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to actively listen, adapt to different styles, establish best practices for a hybrid-remote work environment.
  • Fosters an inclusive team culture that enables team members of all backgrounds to succeed and thrive.

Why Netflix?

  • Collaborate every day with a team that values selflessness, inclusion, and integrity
  • Make your impact on a product loved by hundreds of millions around the world
  • Remote-friendly with a flexible work environment
  • Strong parental leave policy and family forming benefits
At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personaltop of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. 

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $180,000 - $900,000. 

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

63c99593aabfb4d267c022d2.text: Technical Program Manager (L6) - Content & Studio Engineering
63c99593aabfb4d267c022d2.description:
At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 220 million paid subscribers and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Engineering teams within Netflix work hard every day to scale and innovate this content production and member experience in an ever growing complex software landscape.  

Our Team

Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners planning, producing and managing our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content investment and production, from the initial pitch of a title all the way releasing the final content on the Netflix service for play also known as pitch-to-play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. We deliver solutions that enable the business to make smart decisions about how we account, plan, and acquire content. We help make as many titles as we can, as quickly as we can, being smart about timelines, budgets and scarce resources. We deliver our shows to launch on the streaming service bringing joy to members watching titles they love. We do this by forecasting our content budget, automating and optimizing the content production process, globalizing our content with dubbing and subtitles, creating promotional artwork and video assets, and managing the launch of titles and marketing campaigns of our content on and off the service.  With an increasing slate of original content, including shows, films, and games being produced every year, our products manage billions of dollars worth of content-spend. We are looking for a Sr Technical Program Manager to translate our product vision into reality and  allow us to scale our studio efforts across the globe, and do so effectively and efficiently! 

What you will do

  • Support and drive multiple high impact cross-functional programs
  • Approach complex problems with a technical and strategic perspective and develop strategies to address them
  • Leverage your experience with various systems , workflows and user journeys  to improve overall engineering execution
  • Proactively identify inefficiencies, risks and gaps that stifle the program's progress and to implement better and more efficient workflows
  • Establish an overall plan for several teams to rally around by identifying the right teams, the systems involved to build new solutions, align roadmaps, and weigh relative priorities
  • Build strong subject matter knowledge to balance business demands with technological restrictions
  • Assess and evaluate a program's technical implementation with engineering to determine the best strategy for the challenge at hand
  • Drive and participate in the complex technical discussions with audiences of varying technical and subject matter backgrounds
  • Develop and own communication plans for communicating program status, big picture, challenges, and risks to stakeholders effectively and proactively
  • Partner with cross functional engineering and business teams to develop path-to-green plans for programs that trend behind, communicate those corrective actions, and drive them to completion

Key Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or Software Development, Systems Design, or Software Architecture experience
  • A strong understanding of working at the intersection of product management, software engineering, and business stakeholders
  • Deep experience working cross-functionally across several different product development teams and stake-holders to successfully build and deliver scalable solutions
  • Action-oriented and able to solve ambiguous, complex problems with bias to action
  • Experience establishing trust and strong work relationships across multi-disciplinary teams and multiple partners
  • Love to dive into the technology aspect of a program, gaining rich context that enables you to be even more thoughtful and effective in making the initiative happen
  • Adept at looking around the corner and anticipating upcoming challenges in advance - communicating them to the program group and helping create mitigation for evolving headwinds
  • Stellar communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority.
  • Experience developing/launching products/technologies within internal corporate systems
  • As comfortable speaking technically as speaking non-technically and able to bridge between the two
  • Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction.
  • Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, XD and Data Science

At Netflix, we seek to entertain the world. We have more than 200 million members in 190 countries, reflecting that great stories can come from anywhere and be loved everywhere. 

In April 2022, we announced that we are creating a new lower-priced, ad-supported tier for our customers. We are now working toward our goal of providing more choice for consumers and a premium, better-than-linear TV brand experience for advertisers. That said, we are looking for the founding members of this new business area for Netflix! 

The Ads Data Science and Engineering team at Netflix’s mission is to help build the foundation of the ads business at Netflix. We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of creating more choices and joy for our members. As a leader in this space, you’ll work closely with partner teams to think big picture about our business goals and how we achieve them through analysis and experimentation. Your team will apply strong analytical rigor to evaluate ideas, dissect problems, build workflows, provide recommendations and drive success on end-to-end analytics initiatives in this 0 -1 space.

Responsibilities

  • Hire, inspire, and grow high-performing data scientists and analysts.
  • Lead strong partnerships with stakeholders from across the business - from product management, engineering, consumer insights, content, and strategy.
  • Instill an inclusive culture that is innovative and collaborative, both within your team and in the broader organization.
  • Develop a team charter and roadmap that optimizes the impact of the team and reflects evolving business needs.
  • Act as an ambassador between the Product, SP&A and DSE teams by having a deep knowledge of how the Netflix Ads product works.
  • Ensure that your team is producing consistently trustworthy and high-quality technical outputs that influence the business. 

The Ideal Candidate:

  • Demonstrated tenacity, resilience, and leadership experience that enables you to organize and drive cross-functional projects, overcome challenges, and propose solutions. 
  • Be both quantitative and qualitative. You should be able to quickly assess and understand complex systems, but also have high EQ, so that you can be a product ambassador to the rest of the organization, and our Hollywood and global partners. 
  • You are a player-coach. You can develop roadmaps and strategy, but also execute on technical work and ensure that your team produces consistent high quality outputs.
  • Superb communication skills - You must be able to cultivate strong working relationships, communicate effectively, write meticulously, and give outstanding presentations to both technical and creative audiences. 
  • Experience building and leading hybrid analytics and experimentation teams in the Ads space.
  • Capacity and passion to translate business objectives into actionable analyses, and analytic results into business and product recommendations 
  • A passion for TV and movies and defining the future of entertainment

63d992f23d6b6216a21b0c36.text: Engineering Manager, Application and Infrastructure Security
63d992f23d6b6216a21b0c36.description:
At Netflix we do one thing - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content at a massive scale. We have a strong engineering organization that enables us to achieve these business objectives and a unique and creative culture that guides us to operate with “Freedom and Responsibility”. This helps keep engineering velocity high, but also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility to do the right thing for Netflix. Instead of controlling engineers with process and security gates, we enable them to build secure code and provide them with adequate security context to make the right decisions for Netflix.

The Application and Infrastructure Security (AIS) team aims to reduce risk in our engineering ecosystem through strategic security initiatives in high-risk or high-leverage areas. We conduct risk discovery, security strategy development and execution, identification and execution of  high impact security initiatives across Netflix applications and infrastructure (e.g. Network security strategy for Netflix corporate infrastructure, Secure Application Gateway for all internal applications). 

The AIS team operates across a broad scope and helps guide security investments for our engineering stakeholders. We are looking for a strong engineering leader and people manager for this team to enable our mission and scale this program. You will be responsible for leading and cultivating a world class team of senior security engineers. You will drive the strategy for engineering security investments in close collaboration with key partners with a pragmatic, risk focused approach. 

Desired background

  • You are an experienced security leader who believes in risk focused, scalable security approaches.
  • You are highly experienced in managing relationships with cross functional partners.
  • You are adept at scaling team operations and change management.  
  • You have experience leading professional services security teams. 
  • You have a strong technical background across application and infrastructure security domains.   
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • You have experience hiring, coaching and cultivating an excellent team.
  • You have experience translating business context to security program strategy and prioritizing investments based on risk. 
  • You are an empathetic leader who cultivates a culture of psychological safety and inclusivity where team members can do their best work.
  • You are a meticulous and responsive cross-team communicator and program leader.

Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 220+ million memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. And as of November 2022 we added an advertisement branch to our business, making Netflix service accessible to an even broader member base with ad-supported plans!

The Delivery Platforms team is building our Continuous Delivery platform, which facilitates Platform Engineering teams at Netflix to build products for Product engineers to deploy and affect infrastructure in applications that they own. The ability to rapidly and confidently deploy the code that directly affects the Netflix experience is a huge competitive advantage. Whether it's an internal tool, a new recommendation algorithm, or changing the UI to showcase Squid Game, teams across Netflix rely on Delivery Engineering's Continuous Delivery platform to make it happen.

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to lead a team of amazing engineers to improve our Orchestration Platforms for engineers at Netflix. You will partner with engineering leaders across Netflix to ensure alignment about engineering challenges and opportunities. You’ll drive the strategy for a platform that allows the orchestration of tasks related to Delivery in the Software Development Life Cycle which includes a Kubernetes apiserver platform and Continuous Integration.

About the Role

  • Develop and drive the long term vision and strategy for the Orchestration domain for Delivery Engineering
  • Build and lead a high performing engineering team
  • Empower, challenge, and coach a team of senior engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps driving alignment with Product partners
  • Build and maintain strong cross-functional relationships across Platform Engineering partners and customers throughout engineering

What Sets You Apart

  • A self-motivated exceptional people leader with experience building and leading high-performing teams, ideally with remote or hybrid teams
  • Proactively give and receive feedback with a growth mindset
  • You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear, all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it
  • You have great judgment and can make tough bets or decisions without agonizing
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening
  • Experience leading teams that have productized and operated on complex infrastructure systems at scale
  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and/or cloud environments like AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure
  • Familiarity with Continuous Integration systems like Jenkins, CircleCI, or GitHub Actions

A culture of experimentation and data-informed decision making allows Netflix to continuously evolve and improve our product, delivering more joy to existing members and attracting new members from around the globe. This position sits at the nerve center of experimentation at Netflix: our internal Experimentation Platform (XP for short), which provides flexible solutions for designing, launching, and analyzing experiments, and archiving results.

Because experimentation is so pervasive at Netflix, those working on XP are exposed to challenges, and get to collaborate with colleagues, from all corners of Netflix. It’s a great way to learn broadly about ‘how Netflix works’ from a variety of perspectives. 

We’re looking for a manager to lead the Configuration Team within XP. This team owns beta testing, test allocation systems, experimentation administration UI,  as well as our emerging feature flag platform. You can think of the team charter as enabling developers setting up A/B tests with the ambition to grow into owning the entire end-to-end experimenter developer experience at Netflix!

About the opportunity

  • Lead a dream team of software and UI engineers, empowering and growing the team by providing them with context and continuous feedback.
  • Act as an ambassador for experimentation across the company broadly, with a focus on engineering excellence.
  • Build strong relationships across the business through collaborative engineering partnerships.
  • Lead the vision and technical roadmap for our next generation feature flag infrastructure, and related automation platforms, that expand the power of our experimentation practice.
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our roadmaps for experiment setup and allocation systems, in alignment with the overall business needs, maintaining focus on reliability.
  • As a Netflix-wide platform, you’ll constantly support and onboard emerging initiatives at Netflix to help them run their first experiments. 
About our culture
Netflix offers amazing colleagues and a rapid pace of innovation. We embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are always on the lookout for stunning colleagues who bring new perspectives. Our unique culture emphasizes Freedom & Responsibility, and permeates our way of work - hopefully it resonates with you as much as it does with us.

About Us
On the Games SDK team, we are passionate about bringing a new kind of ✨joy✨ to hundreds of millions of Netflix members around the world, whether they’re traveling to a remote location or at home with family. Our members already enjoy TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.  With the launch of mobile games, they can also play a collection of Netflix curated and produced games.

As a leader of the Netflix Games SDK team, you will enable game developers to integrate their games into the Netflix service on Unity, Android, and iOS platforms.  In the process, you will help create an immersive environment for Netflix members to discover and play games..

People who excel on our team are self-motivated and passionate about business and technology innovation.  We believe a big part of our ability to drive global growth comes from fostering inclusion and building diversity within our team.  


We are looking for an experienced engineering manager to lead the Mobile Games SDK team and drive strategy for the SDK product across Android and iOS. 

About the role

640123763d6b6264308750c1.text: Product Manager, Data Platform - Online Data Stores
640123763d6b6264308750c1.description:
It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 220 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe.

Within the Platform Engineering organization, our Data Platform exists to maximize the value of data throughout Netflix by improving the productivity and innovation of Netflix engineers, data scientists, machine learning practitioners, and business users. Our Data Platform enables Netflix to scale effectively and evolve rapidly by providing highly performant, secure, compliant, and flexible data infrastructure that supports the expanding needs of the business. Ultimately, we aim to democratize data by making data more accessible and useful to both technical and non-technical employees.


The Opportunity
We are looking for a senior technical product manager to help drive the next evolution of our distributed data stores at Netflix. Your mission is to simplify and accelerate data experience at Netflix and offer best-in-class experiences to Netflix software engineers, data engineers, analytics engineers, data scientists, machine learning practitioners, and business users.

Your focus will be our high availability, low latency data stores (e.g. Object Storage, Key Value, Distributed Cache, NoSQL DBs, RDMS, Columnar Data Stores, and Graph Databases)  that are used in our member experiences and content production software for our creatives.  Examples of the types of opportunities you might tackle include developing data stores that enable new lines of business like Ads and Gaming, managing more for users through higher levels of abstraction, and/or rethinking how we approach global data challenges like privacy, residency, replication, and more. The scope and impact of this role is significant. You'll be responsible for managing a portfolio of products and driving holistic product strategy and prioritization across them.

If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of data stores at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What You Will Do

  • Deeply understand and triangulate across customer needs, product analytics, and external industry innovation to drive product vision and strategy for Data Platform offerings that maximize business and customer impact
  • Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps
  • Develop product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product and engineering teams that execute product vision and strategy and inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved
  • Define how we will measure the success and effectiveness of our products and drive the execution and continuous evaluation of those metrics
  • Create strong partnerships with Netflix engineering teams to create continuous feedback loops that allow us to better understand their problems
  • Ensure we are solving the right problems by sourcing input from multiple channels and prioritizing effectively to drive maximum impact for Netflix
  • Ensure that our product evolution thoughtfully addresses product lifecycle and adoption/migration experience and provides clear guidance and recommendations to Netflix data users
  • Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning/roadmapping practices

What We’re Looking For

  • 6+ years of experience as a Technical Product Manager with at least 2+ years of domain experience in data stores
  • Proven track record of managing and evolving a product portfolio and/or driving product vision and strategy
  • A healthy blend of technical depth, deep domain expertise with a customer-focused mindset
  • Demonstrated passion and experience in one or more data stores (e.g Object Storage, Key Value, Distributed Cache, NoSQL DBs, RDMD, Columnar Data Stores, or Graph Databases)
  • Strategic thinker that can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about the end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision
  • Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success
  • Leverages product intuition and judgment to solve problems and make decisions without perfect information
  • Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations
We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. 

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $90,000 - $900,000

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 220+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Platform Engineering’s purpose is to enable Netflix to scale effectively and empower our technical talent to focus on building innovative experiences for our members, partners, and creators around the world. We do this by providing a highly available, reliable, secure, compliant, and performant platform of data, software, and infrastructure solutions that:

- meet the needs of our growing business
- accelerate the productivity of Netflix engineers, scientists, and data users
- maintains cost-efficiency that is at most linear to the growth of our business

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager for the Platform Engineering organization that will be focused on large cross-functional programs that impact almost all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product management, engineering managers, and other technical program managers to execute and align programs.

What you will do

  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with technical teams (including product, engineering, UI/UX, Data science, etc.), that focus on building a scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure foundation.
  • Leverage deep technical domain expertise to drive technical strategy, planning, and execution with engineering partners.
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership.
  • Champion breaking out OKRs into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays.
  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly.

What we are looking for

  • Ability to partner with multiple cross-functional teams to define technical strategy and requirements
  • Highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have the ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • A data-driven mindset in your decision making
  • Deep understanding and point of view within cloud infrastructure, engineering productivity, or data

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience driving large-scale software projects with engineering and product teams
  • 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or technical product/program management experience
  • Experience managing projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes, and coordinating release schedules 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction

At Netflix, we seek to entertain the world. We have more than 200 million members in 190 countries, reflecting that great stories can come from anywhere and be loved everywhere. Within Product, we have a very high velocity in innovations in the member experience and we never stop challenging ourselves and are constantly thinking about connecting with our members in new ways or even in new domains! 

Member Product DSE is at the forefront of these innovations with a mission to relentlessly improve Netflix member experience within our streaming and new verticals services across TV, Mobile & Web by surfacing insights and identifying, incubating & enabling product innovations leveraging data, analytics, experimentation & modeling. 

We are looking for a data science leader to join our group and lead a team focusing on improving our machine learning models, UX/design, and experimentation techniques. You will support a team of talented data scientists, work closely with our engineering partners and product leaders, and co-drive algorithmic and UX/design innovations that power how our members experience Netflix. 
In this role, you will need to identify opportunities and direct team resources to the highest-impact areas across core product space, foster strong relationships with these stakeholders, and collaborate to effectively bring projects to life.  

What you will do:

  • Hire and mentor a high-caliber team of Data Scientists, Analytics, and Visualization engineers and help guide them in their career development.
  • Establish strong partnerships with stakeholders to shape the vision of a space, whether that is by helping determine a product strategy or define new metrics.
  • Create an inclusive culture that promotes collaboration and innovation both within your team and across the organization.
  • Develop experimentation and measurement frameworks to increase the velocity of investments and aid complex decision-making.
  • Facilitate ownership and accountability by ensuring that the team is producing trustworthy and high-quality outputs that influence the decisions and direction of member experience.

About you:

  • You have a deep technical background in applied data science, spanning some or all of:  statistics, experimentation, machine learning, causal methods and behavioral analytics. You likely have a M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, Operations Research, etc.
  • You have experience and demonstrated success in leading and building high-caliber, data-focused teams with diverse technical strengths.
  • You are impact driven and have demonstrated success influencing the business by establishing roadmaps and vision for new and existing areas. You are skilled at operating in a complex, cross-functional organization or company where collaboration and integration with other teams across multiple disciplines is essential to the success of your team.
  • You have exceptional communication skills, especially when partnering with engineering & business stakeholders to drive impact and shape strategy. A successful candidate for this role can pivot and tailor their communications based on the audience and their needs.

Netflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 230 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe.

Within the Platform Engineering organization, our mission is to maximize the impact of Netflix engineers by simplifying and accelerating their experience. In cloud infrastructure, we focus on increasing agility, efficiency, and reliability of our compute, networking, and storage offerings, while reducing operational burden and empowering faster innovation. Ultimately, we aim for Netflix engineers to spend less time on repetitive engineering tasks, unnecessary complexity, and undifferentiated heavy lifting so they can spend more time helping Netflix entertain the world.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a principal technical product manager to drive the evolution of our compute platform and serverless strategy at Netflix. Computing workloads represent a significant portion of our cloud spend. Our infrastructure must support the diversity of use cases and workloads that exist across Netflix, including batch, stream processing, stateless and stateful services, offline and online algo & machine learning models, encoding workloads, and more. This is a unique opportunity to drive the product vision & strategy across a broad set of use cases to simultaneously manage more for users and optimize fleet-wide efficiency.

What you will do

  • Deeply understand and triangulate across customer needs, product analytics, and external industry innovation to drive product vision and strategy for compute offerings that maximize business and customer impact
  • Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps
  • Develop product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product and engineering teams that execute on product vision and strategy and inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved
  • Define how we will measure the success and effectiveness of our products and drive the execution and continuous evaluation of those metrics
  • Create strong partnerships with Netflix engineers creating continuous feedback loops that allow us to better understand their problems
  • Ensure we are solving the right problems by sourcing input from multiple channels and prioritizing effectively to drive maximum impact for Netflix
  • Ensure that our product evolution thoughtfully addresses product lifecycle and adoption/migration experience and provides clear guidance and recommendations to Netflix engineers
  • Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning/roadmapping practices

What We’re Looking For

  • 8+ years of experience as a Technical Product Manager
  • Proven track record of managing & evolving a product portfolio and driving product vision & strategy
  • A healthy blend of deep technical knowledge with customer-focused mindset and empathy
  • Demonstrated passion for compute platforms and developer experience, tools, workflows
  • Strategic thinker that can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision
  • Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success 
  • Leverages product intuition and judgment to solve problems and make decisions without perfect information
  • Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’
  • Excellent communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations

More About Cloud Infrastructure @ Netflix

  • Full Cycle Developers at Netflix -- Operate What You Build
  • Building a Media Understanding Platform for ML Innovations
  • Consistent Caching Mechanism in Titus Gateway
  • The Netflix Cosmos Platform
  • Evolving Container Security with Linux User Namespaces

Computing workloads represent a significant portion of our cloud spend. Our infrastructure must support the diversity of use cases and workloads that exist across Netflix, including batch, stream processing, stateless and stateful services, offline and online algo & machine learning models, encoding workloads, and more. This is a unique opportunity to drive the product vision & strategy across a broad set of use cases to simultaneously manage more for users and optimize fleet-wide efficiency. What you will do
  • Deeply understand and triangulate across customer needs, product analytics, and external industry innovation to drive product vision and strategy for compute offerings that maximize business and customer impact
  • Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen, all without commercials or commitments. As Netflix continues to scale across the globe, we are creating and licensing an ever growing catalog of content. We strive to launch and recommend each title on our service in a personalized way, to help each member find the best titles to enjoy.

The Content Systems team is part of our Consumer Engineering organization, working alongside ML researchers and distributed systems engineers. The Content Systems team builds and operates systems focused on enabling the configuration and monitoring of every title’s experience on the Netflix service. Each title has thousands of assets, and is algorithmically surfaced on dozens of canvases that we are continually innovating. Content systems support the behavior of our titles on the product, and ensures each title launch is a success.

Leading this central effort, you will play a highly cross-functional role partnering with content, analytics, product management, application, machine learning, and data teams to ensure we are always surfacing the Netflix catalog in the best way for each member.

What we’ll expect from you

  • You hire, inspire and support the growth of highly talented engineers, inclusively and with clarity of purpose. 
  • You are excited to translate the needs of non-technical partners into measurable goals, automated systems and self-service reporting.
  • You understand how to manage the lifecycle of infrastructure components, and how to build and operate high traffic distributed systems with a direct impact on the customer experience.
  • You are a proactive, effective communicator and have a bias towards action.
  • You forge strong cross-functional relationships, seeking to understand business and partner needs, and delight in enabling your partners’ success.
  • You collaboratively develop and iterate on technical roadmaps, manage expectations, and selflessly navigate competing priorities.
  • You have domain experience with personalization, AB testing, machine learning, cloud computing and Java.
  • You have a BS or equivalent experience in Computer Science or a related field.
  • You are highly aligned with our Values.

What to expect from Netflix

  • Meaningful work: your team directly enables and accelerates Netflix’s ability to innovate globally
  • Impact: you will help shape the future of an industry
  • Freedom & responsibility: our roles are not circumscribed, so we have the freedom to use our judgment to make Netflix better without permission
  • Stunning colleagues: work with amazing talent on every project
  • Inclusive: we embrace different backgrounds, perspectives, and styles because it helps us make better decisions
  • Growth: learn from other selfless leaders around you and mentor others
  • Rigor: our decisions are informed by a mix of good judgment and data

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $373,000 - $699,000. 

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

64821d053d6b62c07b112cbb.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and now games, across a wide variety of devices, genres and languages. As a global household brand, we strive to bring joy to users by connecting them with stories and artists through a delightful and high-quality experience. 

The Consumer Connect and Authenticate team at Netflix enables secure access to Netflix (streaming and games) with member login and authentication at scale, serving device context and capabilities for our content discovery and product experiences, and the protocols for device and app connections. We are looking for an Engineering Manager to deliver high-impact results and drive the development and innovation of our authentication experiences, device connect and capability systems and backend services. To do this, you will need to partner with engineering teams across Netflix as well as work closely with X-functional partners.

This role is remote-inclusive and our teams work in a hybrid-working model. 

About You

  • You are an inclusive leader with a proven track record of building and leading high-performing diverse teams.
  • You are a delightful partner for your engineering, product, and business colleagues.
  • You have a proven track record of taking innovative projects from concept to production, preferably in the authentication domain. 
  • You are inherently curious and enjoy building high scale, low latency applications.
  • You are a proactive, effective communicator and have a bias towards decisive action.

Scope of the role

  • You will be a leader of the Consumer Connect and Authenticate engineering team, employing inclusive practices to manage a hybrid-located team with a range of tenures and experiences.
  • You will innovate in the consumer authentication and devices domain with an architectural and long-term leverage vision, both of Netflix's needs and looking ahead to the industry trends.
  • You will build roadmaps, in partnership with the team and stakeholders, with the right prioritization and execution for product and engineering initiatives that delight our consumers.
  • You will be a trusted advisor and collaborator in effectively prioritizing cross-functional partnerships and projects with Product Management, Data Science, Security and Engineering teams.

Must-Have

  • Technical Depth and Vision - Demonstrated success in building/leading complex architectures and distributed systems, with preference in the authentication / login / registration domain. Vision to define what needs to be planned technologically to be able to meet future needs of Netflix, including scale, operational stability and loosely coupled architecture for customer facing services. 
  • Engineering mindset - Constantly reviews the engineering practices in the team / org for improvements and efficiency. Technically curious and stays engaged in the technical innovation and encourages learning in the team.
  • Mature Leadership -Thoughtful, candid and strong interpersonal skills. Can lead and mentor senior engineers. Inclusive. Leads  with Context and not control. Ability to identify and hire and grow dense talent. Can provide candid feedback and deal with less than expected performance  quickly. 
  • Internal partnership - A strong partner for product management and engineering leaders. Equally passionate about working with engineering and non-engineering stakeholders.
  • Selflessness - Will lead with “Netflix First” attitude.  Do the right thing for Netflix.

Nice to Have

  • Experience leading remote teams
Our team includes people of all genders, varied sexual orientations, parents, folks who are self-taught, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds. Diverse teams are strong teams, and we encourage those with varied identities and experiences to apply.

To achieve this, we need to create and deliver compelling content to over 230 million members all around the globe. We leverage technology  to enable us to excel in producing, distributing and promoting content while making the most efficient use of our multi-billion dollar content budget.

Content Infrastructure & Solutions (CIS) provides infrastructure to address cross-cutting concerns related to content creation and media processing. Examples of products and services in our portfolio include massively scalable compute infrastructure to run media encoding for our entire catalog, services to manage media assets, orchestration platforms for complex studio workflows and connecting data across the entire ecosystem. 

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager to drive large cross-functional programs that directly contribute to the pitch-to-play process. Our mission is to entertain the world. To achieve this, we need to create and deliver compelling content to over 230 million members all around the globe. We leverage technology  to enable us to excel in producing, distributing and promoting content while making the most efficient use of our multi-billion dollar content budget. Content Infrastructure & Solutions (CIS) provides infrastructure to address cross-cutting concerns related to content creation and media processing. Examples of products and services in our portfolio include massively scalable compute infrastructure to run media encoding for our entire catalog, services to manage media assets, orchestration platforms for complex studio workflows and connecting data across the entire ecosystem.  We are looking for a Technical Program Manager to drive large cross-functional programs that directly contribute to the pitch-to-play process. This individual will partner closely with engineers, product managers, other technical program managers and senior leadership to execute, track and deliver high impact strategic programs. What you will do
  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with technical teams (including engineering, UI/UX, Data science, etc.), product management and business stakeholders.
  • Leverage deep technical domain expertise to partner with engineering on  technical strategy, planning, and execution. 
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress, and report status to a diverse audience.
  • Champion breaking out high level objectives into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays.
  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources.

  • Functional Skills: 
  • You can partner with multiple cross-functional teams to define technical strategy and requirements
  • You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs. technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise 
  • You have domain expertise in cloud or data infrastructure
  • Basic Qualifications:

  • Technical program management - driving large scale software projects/programs with engineering and product teams

  •  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction

64af03ee3d6b6264f8c7baac.text: Site Reliability Engineering Manager, Open Connect CDN Platform
64af03ee3d6b6264f8c7baac.description:
Bay Area/ Los Angeles/ Seattle, USA (Remote)

How do you spark joy in hundreds of millions of people? It starts with a vision - that technology can give voice to stories around the world. In delivering those much-loved stories, Netflix is responsible for a significant portion of global internet traffic.
To steward that responsibility, we work collaboratively with ISPs to deploy Open Connect, Netflix’s Content Delivery Network (CDN), our in-house custom-built network and server infrastructure responsible for delivering 100% of Netflix's video traffic. We strive to deliver a great Netflix viewing experience in over 190 countries so our customers can watch whatever, whenever, interruption free.
We are seeking a seasoned SRE Manager with extensive experience in building and  leading a team that’s focused on working to help us deploy, support, and evolve a highly reliable & available CDN platform. To achieve this you must have experience with designing, deploying, analyzing & managing large-scale distributed Internet systems. 
Come join us and play a meaningful role in our journey to entertain the world!

About The Team

The Open Connect Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) Platform team is responsible for our CDN Platform & infrastructure that’s deployed in over 100 countries. The team collaborates with Netflix Engineering teams and external ISP partners, with focus on finding ways to continuously improve the design and operation of the Open Connect services. Our primary goals are to make them more scalable, reliable, efficient, and secure. We do this by instrumenting for observability that provides us the insights required for effective monitoring & remediation. The group is also responsible for automation, continuous deployment, enabling rapid software releases without service impact. 

Responsibilities

  • Applying your strong understanding of SRE principles and practices
  • Lead, empower, and mentor a team of engineers by providing them with the appropriate context and continuous feedback
  • Guide a team with a mix of systems & software engineering skills while executing on projects focused on scalability, reliability, and availability
  • Collaborate closely within the broader Open Connect organization and form strong cross-functional partnerships (Network Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Development, et al)
  • Establish a track record of resolving issues in a live production environment and implementing strategies to minimize them
  • Consistently deliver timely execution on complex projects with excellent quality

Qualifications

  • Proven experience building and leading high-performance SRE teams
  • Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset, confident to initiate the hard conversations
  • Ability to disambiguate, in a fast-paced environment, driving clear action plans for your team 
  • Experience working with a diverse group of cross functional peers - engineers, partner engagement managers, operations and business stakeholders, at varying technical levels, influencing and driving direction and decision making
  • Strong understanding of Unix/Linux operating systems fundamentals
  • Strong knowledge of networking technologies (routing, BGP, protocols) 
  • Proficient in a programming language such as Python or Go
  • Experience designing, analyzing & operating distributed systems at scale
  • Great written and verbal communication skills, adept at active listening
  • Experience managing geographically distributed teams

Things that show how we think

  • Measuring Real-Life Latency of the Internet: A Netflix Story
  • Mastering Near-Real Time Telemetry and Big Data
  • FreeBSD optimization used by Netflix to serve 800 Gb/s from a single server
  • Resiliency Practices in Managing CDN
Netflix is a global company with a diverse member base, which is why the content we produce reflects that: global perspectives and global stories. As we grow globally, we must have the most talented employees with diverse backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to support our innovation and creativity. We are an equal-opportunity employer and strive to build balanced teams from all walks of life. 
Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically  $100,000 - $600,000. This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy.
