Company
Netflix is a global video streaming service with over 245 million members worldwide. We are committed to pushing the boundaries of what's possible and transforming the way people interact with technology. Our engineering culture is centered around continuous learning, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence.

Role
We are seeking an experienced and passionate Software Engineering Manager to lead our Orchestration and Delivery team. This role involves guiding the engineering team in the design, development, and implementation of integration and delivery pipelines; thereby facilitating rapid and reliable application development and deployment across various client platforms. The ideal candidate will be an inspiring leader, a technical expert, and an effective communicator, dedicated to fostering an environment of continuous improvement and good development practices.

Team
This team develops continuous integration and delivery platforms for many client applications. Our integration systems run thousands of tests to validate Netflix applications on every commit from hundreds of engineers and our deployments run AB tests that use advanced statistics and real-time insights to detect in-field issues (read more about it in Safe Updates of Client Applications at Netflix blog post). As the team invested in systems to continuously evaluate application changes, it has led to increased development velocity, which arguably led to better development practices and quality of applications. 

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of engineers, providing technical guidance and career development support
  • Foster a culture of continuous learning and development best practices within the team.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional partners to identify, design, and implement integration and delivery pipelines for various projects, ensuring scalability and reliability.
  • Develop and maintain metrics to monitor integration and delivery system stability, performance, and deployment success rates; and use these insights to drive continuous improvement.
  • Champion the development and deployment of new orchestration tooling and frameworks to improve developer experience and operational efficiency.
  • Stay current with the newest trends, tools, and technologies in the field, assessing their relevance to our ecosystem.

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in software development, with 2+ year focused on CI/CD practices and tools.
  • At least 3 years of experience in a leadership or management role within a software engineering team.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to navigate cross-functional team dynamics.
  • Familiarity with systems such as Jenkins, Github actions, Gradle, Fastlane, Spinnaker etc. is a plus
Join us and be part of an innovative environment to continue delighting our next hundred million customers around the globe. Netflix offers a culture that values freedom and responsibility, enabling us to do our best work. And everyone here also strives hard to foster an inclusive team culture that enables team members of all backgrounds to thrive and succeed. Learn more about life at Netflix.

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. 

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $180,000 - $900,000

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Within Product, we have a very high velocity in innovations in the member experience and we never stop challenging ourselves and are constantly thinking about connecting with our members in new ways or even in new domains! 

Member Product DSE is at the forefront of these innovations with a mission to relentlessly improve Netflix member experience within our streaming and new verticals services across TV, Mobile & Web by surfacing insights, and identifying, incubating & enabling product innovations leveraging data, analytics, experimentation & modeling. 

We are looking for an engineering and data leader to join our group and lead a team focusing on improving our data visualization capabilities, knowledge management, and improving access to data and insights through robust analytics and data modeling. You will support a team of talented analytics, visualization and software engineers, work closely with our data science, consumer research and product partners co-drive innovations that power delivery of high quality, actionable insights. 

In this role, you will need to identify opportunities and direct team resources to the highest-impact areas across core product and data science space, foster strong relationships with these stakeholders, and collaborate effectively to bring projects to life.  

What you will do:

  • Hire and mentor a high-caliber team of Analytics and Visualization engineers and help guide them in their career development.
  • Establish strong partnerships with stakeholders to shape the vision of a space, whether that is by helping determine analytics and viz strategies.
  • Create an inclusive culture that promotes collaboration and innovation both within your team and across the organization.
  • Develop visualization frameworks that contribute to the viz platform vision and enablement.
  • Ensure that the team builds scalable analytics frameworks, including managing semantic layer in partnership with Data Engineering teams.
  • Build internal products that foster reliable access to information by integrating novel technologies into our stack. 
  • Facilitate ownership and accountability by ensuring that the team is producing trustworthy and high-quality outputs that influence the decisions and direction of the entire organization. 

About you:

  • You have a deep technical background in engineering, spanning some or all of:  visualization and/or analytics engineering, software engineering, machine learning and/or behavioral analytics. 
  • You likely have a B.S or M.S. in a field such as Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, Operations Research, etc.
  • You have experience and demonstrated success in leading and building high-caliber, engineering focused teams with diverse technical strengths.
  • You are impact driven and have demonstrated success influencing the organization strategy by establishing roadmaps and vision for new and existing areas. 
  • You are skilled at operating in a complex, cross-functional organization or company where collaboration and integration with other teams across multiple disciplines is essential to the success of your team.
  • You have exceptional communication skills, especially when partnering with engineering & business stakeholders to drive impact and shape strategy. A successful candidate for this role can pivot and tailor their communications based on the audience and their needs.
Netflix culture
Netflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. 

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $310,000 - $1,200,000.

We are now working toward our goal of providing more choice for consumers and a premium, better-than-linear TV brand experience for advertisers. That said, we are looking for the founding members of this new business area for Netflix! 

The Ads Data Science and Engineering team at Netflix’s mission is to help build the foundation of the ads business at Netflix. We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of creating more choices and joy for our members. As a leader in this space, you’ll work closely with partner teams to think big picture about our business goals and how we achieve them through analysis and experimentation. You will lead the team that enables Netflix to understand ads performance, enhance targeting capabilities, and inform advertiser effectiveness via developing Measurement solutions and creating business metrics. Your team will apply strong analytical rigor to evaluate ideas, dissect problems, build workflows, provide recommendations and drive success on end-to-end analytics initiatives in this 0 -1 space.

  • Hire, inspire, and grow high-performing data scientists and analytic engineers.
  • Lead strong partnerships with stakeholders from across the business - from product management, engineering, consumer insights, content, and strategy.
  • Instill an inclusive culture that is innovative and collaborative, both within your team and in the broader organization.
  • Develop a team charter and roadmap that optimizes the impact of the team and reflects evolving business needs.
  • Act as an ambassador between the Product, Engineering, Strategy, and DSE teams by having a deep knowledge of how the Netflix Ads product works.
  • Ensure that your team is producing consistently trustworthy and high-quality technical outputs that influence the business. 

The Ideal Candidate:

  • Demonstrated tenacity, resilience, and leadership experience that enables you to organize and drive cross-functional projects, overcome challenges, and propose solutions. 
  • Be both quantitative and qualitative. You should be able to quickly assess and understand complex systems, but also have high EQ, so that you can be a product ambassador to the rest of the organization, and our Hollywood and global partners. 
  • You are a player-coach. You can develop roadmaps and strategies, but also execute on technical work and ensure that your team produces consistent high-quality outputs.
  • Superb communication skills - You must be able to cultivate strong working relationships, communicate effectively, write meticulously, and give outstanding presentations to both technical and creative audiences. 
  • Experience building and leading hybrid data science and analytics teams in the Ads space.

About Netflix
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment provider with over 247 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries around the world. This success has depended on an industry-leading engineering organization building cloud-native services with exceptional resilience. Cloud Infrastructure Engineering delivers the platform underneath these services by following three tenets: simple, scalable, speed. We build simple, elegant solutions that are easy to adopt, highly available and efficient at internet scale, and support rapid development and exploration for engineers across the company.

About the Team
Network Services & Insights re-architects the approach to managing and exposing modern cloud networking features, building on top of Netflix’s own federated resource management platform. We apply time-tested software principles to develop a network management platform that is user-focused, intent-first, and built in layers using composable modules with clear schemas and single responsibility principle. The team connects the dots across other networking teams, products and features to allow us to ship end-to-end experiences, not org charts. We additionally develop and operate some of Netflix’s largest distributed systems offering topology, health and performance insights, solutions for the identification & consumption of network resources, and structured network data access.

About the Role
We are looking for an engineering leader passionate about infra and developer productivity to support the team in building the next generation of Netflix’s intent-based networking & observability. You will be owning some of our key bets, shipping overarching abstractions, and creating APIs enabling Netflix developers to completely change the way they interact with the products developed by the org.

What you will do

  • Own vision, strategy, and the end-to-end outcomes of an intent-based network platform and app-facing network observability at Netflix
  • Effectively collaborate across several partner teams, focus on the user, prioritize ruthlessly, and get things done
  • Support a team of stunning colleagues, keep them challenged and growing professionally
  • Make data-driven decisions, make bets, learn from failures, be in situations without obvious right answers, and create an environment where rapid iteration is the top goal

Who we are looking for

  • A leader who has a passion for platforms and a background in infra / infra-adjacent developer productivity space
  • Someone driving eng excellence, technically mature, emotionally intelligent, knowing what they don’t know and able to listen and learn, advance conversations even when the right thing is unclear, ambiguous or unknown
  • Proven track record of shipping and solving hard problems with tricky technical or organizational constraints
  • Organized, informed, effective communicator and influencer using context, not control
  • Outcome-focused and able to think from the first principles
  • Not only someone who’s strongly aligned with the culture (we really mean it), but who would embody it on the team
  • Experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity, ensuring that we can attract and retain the best talent from anywhere and that all voices are heard to inform our direction

657b857bb5811bf02d982580.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across various genres and languages. Members can watch or play as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. 

Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence powers numerous aspects of the Consumer Experience, including innovation in content discovery and personalization for members, identifying and attracting new members to our product, optimizing our payment processing, and many more. 

The Opportunity

The Consumer Model Compute & Serving Foundations team provides the foundation for model computation, inference, and serving for all ML/AI innovation across the various Consumer ML domains. The team is responsible for developing all the building blocks required to run ML models at scale. These building blocks include a model serving platform, an event-driven model compute framework, a compute orchestration engine, and many more.

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader for this area, which is a central focus of our business. You will be highly cross-functional in partnering with other engineering, product management, machine learning, and data teams to take Netflix’s ML/AI initiatives to the next level. To be successful in this role, you need a strong ML infrastructure background and a passion for building scalable, robust systems that enable and accelerate our ability to apply large and complex ML models across a wide range of Consumer domains. 

Minimum Job Qualifications

  • 3+ years of engineering management experience
  • Experience leading a team responsible for building high-traffic distributed systems and ML infrastructure to support large-scale ML models with a direct impact on the customer experience
  • Strong technical acumen and can act as a credible technical advisor to the team, set and enforce a high-quality bar for code and system design, and be a mentor for the team
  • A track record of hiring and growing diverse, highly talented tenured engineers deep into their careers to maximize their impact
  • Excellent at communicating context with the team, stakeholders, partners, and leadership, giving and receiving feedback, fostering new ideas, and empowering others without micromanagement
  • Passion for translating the needs of ML practitioners into infrastructure offerings with an eye toward automated and self-serve capabilities
  • Demonstrated ability to develop, drive, and execute a technical vision and roadmap
  • Comfortable managing a majority-remote team with partners distributed across (US) geographies & time zones

Preferred Qualifications

  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Applied Math, Engineering, or a related field
  • 10+ years of software engineering experience 
  • Experience building high-scale services on a public cloud like AWS, Azure, or GCP and comfortable with Java
  • Built ML infrastructure offerings for ML Researchers, Data Scientists, and other ML practitioners
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $180,000 - $900,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

6582207b3d6b62858e544706.text: Technical Program Manager Intern, Developer Education (Summer 2024)
6582207b3d6b62858e544706.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 240+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is reinventing entertainment from end to end. We are revolutionizing how shows and movies are produced, pushing technological boundaries to efficiently deliver streaming video at massive scale over the internet, and continuously improving and personalizing how content is presented around the globe. 

Platform Engineering’s purpose is to enable Netflix to scale effectively and empower our technical talent to focus on building innovative experiences for our members, partners, and creators around the world. We do this by providing a highly available, reliable, secure, compliant, and performant platform of data, software, and infrastructure solutions that:
1: Meet the needs of our growing business
2: Accelerate the productivity of Netflix engineers, scientists, and data users
3: Maintains cost-efficiency that is at most linear to the growth of our business

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager intern for the Platform Engineering organization that will be focused on large cross-functional programs that impact almost all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product management, engineering managers, and other technical program managers to execute and align on programs.

We are looking for individuals with the following qualifications:

  • Current student pursuing a degree in a technical or non-technical field with an expected graduation date around December 2024 or Spring/Summer 2025
  • Broad experiences with multiple technical skills across different technologies, with experience writing code and contributing to open source projects
  • Basic intermediate proficiency with Python, Java, or Node (at least 2 preferred)
  • Demonstrate strong skills with data analysis (including SQL, database querying) and data visualization (including experience with Tableau)
  • Beginner knowledge of semantic search and generative AI
  • Outstanding people skills, partnerships, cross-functional relationships

Nice to have:

  • You are interested in partnering with multiple cross-functional teams to define technical strategy and requirements
  • You enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have a strong desire to learn how to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs. technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a functional understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise 

What will you learn and do?

  • You will learn about real-life decision-making challenges at Netflix, and help us develop innovative solutions.
  • You will learn broadly about how the Platform Engineering organization at Netflix strengthens and helps optimize all aspects of our global entertainment business. 
  • You will collaborate with stunning colleagues in the Platform Engineering and Platform Product organizations and beyond.
  • You will have the opportunity to present your work at key internal forums within Netflix. 
The Summer Internship
At Netflix, we offer a personalized experience for interns, and our aim is to offer an experience that mimics what it is like to actually work here. We match qualified interns with projects and groups based on interests and skill sets, and fully embed interns within those groups for the summer. Netflix is a unique place to work and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture.

Internships are paid and are a minimum of 12 weeks, with a choice of a few fixed start dates in May or June to accommodate varying school calendars. Our summer internships in 2024 will be located — depending on the team — either in our Los Gatos, CA, or in our Los Angeles, CA, office. 

Netflix is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

The overall market range for Netflix Internships is typically $25/hour - $110/hour.
This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only hourly rate), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager passionate about building great playback experiences alongside adaptable, inclusive teams. You will be part of a cross-functional group of platform engineers, testers, and distributed systems engineers leading the evolution of Netflix playback across our entire device ecosystem. 

Primary responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with various organizational departments to drive the execution of playback initiatives across Netflix.
  • Leverage the insights and experience from this work to influence the improvement of underlying technologies, architectures, and operations.
  • Apply strong technical, organizational, and communication skills to devise sound technical approaches to abstract goals.
  • Identify the systems involved to build new solutions, align roadmaps, and weigh relative priorities.
  • Establish an overall plan for numerous teams to evolve the playback ecosystem.
  • Identifying and mitigating technical risks.
  • You are a strong communicator with exceptional listening skills. You can operate independently, challenge the status quo, and always play for the larger team.

What sets you apart?

  • A passion for driving toward clarity and simplicity.
  • Always thinking about the quality of experience implications of the team’s work.
  • You are a thought partner to your platform and backend stakeholders.
  • You balance competing concerns and make tough calls on where to cut scope vs. invest more, and how to make resourcing trade-offs across different domains.
  • As comfortable speaking technically as non-technically and able to bridge between the two.
  • 8+ years of experience in product management, technical program management, software engineering, or leading software development projects.

Desired Technical Skills

  • Systems design, and architecture experience.
  • Ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and see various perspectives.
  • Able to provide insights into business, product, and technology tradeoffs.
  • Great at adapting solutions to meet short and longer-term needs.
  • Expertise in low-latency streaming, hardware, and infrastructure.

Desired Project Management Skills

  • Can devise and apply various approaches to the execution of complex initiatives.
  • Coordination across many independent tracks of work and organizations.
  • Risk identification and mitigation.
  • Can balance strategic and tactical efforts to make tough calls and communicate the decision framework.
  • Detail-oriented, can identify what’s missing in planning and execution of software development, testing, and launch.

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 250 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. This scale and experience requires a large engineering organization that collectively works together to give customers the end product they love to use.

Productivity Engineering is the organization tasked with making Netflix engineers more effective by building and supporting the infrastructure to create, build, test, deploy, run and Observe the Netflix stack. As Netflix grows, so does the complexity behind our engineering systems. Our challenge is deceivingly simple: keep the developer experience amazing even as complexity increases. Our work impacts virtually every engineer at Netflix and enables other platform teams to innovate faster. We are looking for a talented engineering leader to join our team. 

In this role, you will

  • Drive the team’s strategy and vision towards a connected and opinionated Observability Exploration and Troubleshooting experience that leads to better and faster operational insights.
  • Lead, empower, challenge, and coach a team of exceptional engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback
  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap
  • Collaborate closely within the broader Productivity Engineering organization, delivering cohesive solutions

Where you’ll focus

  • Delighting Netflix engineers with amazing user experiences and customer service
  • Work to reduce toil through connected experiences that spans metrics, logs, traces, events, heap dumps and other operational datasets
  • Take more opinions on users behalf to help engineers manage complexity in extracting insights
  • Provide polished building blocks that are great out of the box but promote extending when needed

What sets you apart

  • Experience building and leading high-performing teams
  • Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset. You initiate the hard conversations.
  • Experience working closely with central development platform and tooling team
  • Experience building self service experiences with strong UI/UX components
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening
  • Thoughtful exercising of strong judgment in ambiguous situations

Does this sound interesting but intimidating? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you!

About Netflix

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Productivity Engineering, feel free to listen to this podcast.

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $300,000 - $900,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Want to know more about our team? You can learn about us:
- The Netflix culture
- Productivity Engineering Podcast
- Edgar: Solving Mysteries Faster with Observability | by Netflix Technology Blog
- Lumen: Custom, Self-Service Dashboarding For Netflix | by Netflix Technology Blog
- Netflix FlameScope

65a745173d6b62d982284da6.description:
At Netflix, our mission is to entertain the world by connecting our members to an extensive library of amazing stories from all over the globe. We are revolutionizing storytelling as we deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to 200+ million members across 190+ countries in 30+ languages. Developing data-driven algorithms and systems to help Netflix creators produce shows and movies in line with their vision is an important part of that mission.

The Studio Media Algorithms team is at the forefront of innovation to enhance and support the vision of the creators of movies, TV shows, and other multimedia content. This team's work is responsible for increasing member value, and driving efficiency of the content creation process, ultimately creating more joy for viewers all over the world.

We are looking for an experienced manager with successful experience in leading scientists and engineers in the ML, computer vision (CV), and/or computer graphics (CG) domain. In this role, you will lead and grow a high-impact team to develop algorithms that help storytellers around the world create unique content that our members around the world enjoy. The goal is to aid artists by allowing them to focus on the more creative aspects of production, and also enabling new possibilities in creation through innovation and collaboration. The team partners with the creative teams in our Netflix Studio as well as the product management and engineering teams to identify and prioritize areas of impact and develop and test new algorithms and tools.

To be successful you will need a strong background in machine learning/computer vision/graphics, engineering, and leadership that aligns with our unique culture - be great at empowering others, giving and receiving feedback, fostering inclusion, championing new and diverse ideas, and balancing the needs of both research and engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of researchers and engineers with expertise in various disciplines, such as ML/DL, CV, and Graphics that leverage algorithms to assist content creation.
  • Grow the team by attracting diverse and outstanding talent in the field.
  • Provide mentorship to individual contributors on the team and guide technical thinking.
  • Foster an inclusive environment, where all viewpoints are welcomed and encouraged.
  • Partner closely with business stakeholders and engineering teams to integrate work outputs into the content production workflow.
  • Provide thought leadership and identify new areas where algorithms can play a significant role.
  • Work with senior management and executives to develop the technology vision for the Netflix Studio.
  • Think broadly about the Netflix business and contribute to efforts beyond your domain.

What we are looking for:

  • Demonstrated leadership experience in building, managing, mentoring, and inspiring applied research teams
  • Expertise in computer vision or computer graphics, deep familiarity with machine learning fundamentals, and experience of impactful R&D as an individual and/or technical lead 
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills and ability to inspire and influence without authority 
  • Strong business acumen and ability to identify and prioritize areas of high impact and define metrics for success
  • Experience in collaboration with technical and non-technical partners, creatives, and senior leaders

Even better if you have experience with one or more of:

  • Research experience with a successful track record of delivering business impact and/or academic publications in top CV, ML, or CG venues
  • Individual contribution of leadership in the multi-media content production domain
  • Software engineering in languages such as Python, Java, or C++ and deep learning tools such as PyTorch and TensorFlow
  • Passion for movies/TV/video games!

Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 235+ million memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages increasing our accessibility to Global markets around the world. Growth Data Science and Engineering is part of our product organization within Data & Insights. We power insights to make all the impactful decisions around what countries we launch and grow our membership in, what plan and pricing strategies we employ in those countries, and how we vary our signup flow to make Netflix more accessible and appealing to more potential members.  We also partner in various countries to bring Netflix to life on various devices and subscriptions. Lastly, we take great care and consideration to ensure our customers globally have their payment of choice so that all of our members have a great experience signing up and renewing Netflix monthly. 

The Growth Data Engineering team sits at the core of building an analytics and data ecosystem that powers Netflix’s understanding and decision-making about how our product is performing and maximizing global member growth. We provide insights and data that help measure the customer experience from acquisition through to recurring subscriptions.  It is part of a larger vertical organization for Growth, with a strong sense of our Netflix product and a data community that fosters technical, and personal growth. 

Growth Data Engineering is seeking a senior manager to lead a team of seasoned engineers building analytical data sets that help drive product, research, and data decisions in its Growth & Acquisition strategies  (Monetization, Commerce, and Experimentation)

Who are you?

  • You are a natural people leader who also demonstrates humility. You care deeply about growing and coaching your team toward success. You invest in your relationships so that you have an understanding of the whole person and their perspective.
  • You have experience in measuring and acquiring customers through a Digital Channel and can think through how to measure monetization strategies linked to plans, pricing, visitors, etc.
  • You have experience with measuring Experimentation results from various visitor and member tests through the acquisition flow in a Digital Channel.  You are able to partner with Data Science and Engineering teams to help ensure we measure the right things well with high-quality data. 
  • You have a repertoire of learnings and experience in working with product teams and designing data that informs good digital product decisions and strategies.
  • You are curious, place an emphasis on team performance, and work hard to craft a high-performing team that supports the business goals and each other. 
  • You are forward-looking and have a strength in business acumen that you use to be able to anticipate the investments Netflix should be making to improve efficiency, innovation, and alignment. You identify areas for continuous improvement and persistently advocate for action to address them.
  • As a leader you prefer to give context, delegate, coach, and watch amazing people exceed their roles, going beyond your expectations.
  • You have an impeccable eye for technical talent, and influencing hiring decisions across organizations. You understand both the importance and the effort required in building and maintaining an additive and diverse high-performing team.
  • You’re not afraid of hard conversations and are gifted at coaching your colleagues through difficult situations. You are comfortable sharing your perspective on challenging people dynamics.
  • You seek to de-escalate tense situations and are creative & flexible in finding balance with partners to maximize impact.
  • You are a strong communicator, and self-aware about how others perceive your comments. As someone in a leadership role, you aim to be assertive, not passive nor aggressive, in providing input, support, and feedback.
  • You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear, all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it
  • You have experience in either leading people or projects that build data and software for product analytics, and data science or machine learning
  • A role model for integrity: you have great judgment and can make tough decisions without agonizing.
  • You enjoy working on hard problems with new tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making a big impact.  You are skilled at guiding your team through and fostering adaptability in the face of different magnitudes of change and ambiguity.
  • You know what good and great data architectures look like and you are able to help your team succeed in making a great strong data architecture for acquisition and monetization.

What will you do?

  • Build a vision and strategy for your team, and use your natural intuition and curiosity in understanding business and technology to guide a team by providing relevant context and inspiration.
  • Engage, coach, and guide a team of high-performing engineers to be a high-performing team with a winning reputation for helping the business succeed.
  • Create strong relationships across product, data science, analytics, and engineering leaders and partners that foster collaborative success toward Netflix’s highest priorities
  • Grow and mentor individual team members to reach their full potential through thoughtful observation and courageous, honest feedback 

What (ideally) do you know?

  • You are passionate about the customer and have worked to provide impactful data that influence product direction or customer experiences
  • You know how to work with data science and analytics practitioners in various contexts
  • You are passionate about data as a product
  • You have expertise with a variety of Big Data tech (S3, Spark, Elasticsearch, graph databases), and know what it means to work in large-scale data environments
  • You have experience in Growth, Acquisition, Experimentation, and Monetization teams/strategies, or similar that help companies achieve global growth 
  • You have seen large-scale data architectures with high volume and low latency
  • You have many years of experience leading digital data teams and understand the nuances of data needs that come with making good product strategy decisions.

Bring your passion for games and backend systems to help us achieve our next big objective, to reinvent video games on a global scale. Netflix fundamentally changed how the world watches television, with over 240 million members enjoying award-winning TV series, documentaries, and feature films.  Join our team to help pioneer a next-generation video game platform that caters to a diverse, global member base.

About Game Systems
Our goal is to empower developers to seamlessly integrate and launch their greatest hits on Netflix. This role is leading a team of highly capable engineers to build and operate the product and infrastructure enabling the developer platform.  It includes features like cloud saves, leaderboards, achievements, and social capabilities.  It also includes core technologies like Web API and developer environments.  

In this role:

  • A successful manager leads by role modeling the Netflix culture, the following experience, qualities, and behaviors will help you thrive in the position:
  • 2-3 years of video game platform experience
  • 5+ years of management experience
  • Credible technical advisor to influence complex software systems
  • Strives for high-quality and high-value results
  • Can articulate complex ideas in simple terms
  • Able to establish and maintain healthy partnerships
  • Effective project manager internally and cross-functionally
  • Grow individuals and boost collective performance
  • Establish psychological safety and trust
  • Strategic in thinking, provide a vision for the future

A few more things about us:

As a team, we come from many different backgrounds and countries, and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science and we strive to give people the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity and agility has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and we are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $180,000 - $900,000.

65b8223eb5811b5be7fc7bc8.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 238M paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Machine Learning drives innovation across all product functions and decision-support needs. Building highly scalable and differentiated ML infrastructure is key to accelerating this innovation.

The Opportunity

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to lead the Inference Platform team in the Machine Learning Platform organization. Our organization is chartered to maximize the business impact of all ML practitioners at Netflix and innovate on ML infrastructure to support key product functions like personalized recommendations, studio innovations, virtual productions, growth intelligence, and content demand modeling among others.

The Consumer Inference team is responsible for building products, libraries, and services that make it easy for researchers to take their offline ML ideas and easily deploy them to various production environments for consumer facing applications.  This team plays a critical role in transitioning ML algorithms into products where it can realize value for Netflix.  As a part of this role you will lead a team responsible for the following.

Consumer Scale Inference: Libraries and systems that enable flexible and high-performance processing of data and ML models for Netflix’s 238 million members across a diversity of modeling paradigms.

Model Lifecycle Management: Easy deployment, retirement, and configuration of ML models in online and offline environments.

GPU Inference: Increasingly complex ML models have introduced more opportunities to leverage hardware to meet cost-efficiency and performance needs.

ML Observability: Tools for self-service detection and remediation of ML quality issues in production settings.

To be successful in this role you will need the following skills:

  • Vision: Understanding where the ML needs across a diverse set of use cases are today and will be in the future will allow you to lead your team by providing clear technical and business context.
  • Partnership & Culture: Establishing positive partnerships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix will be critical. We want you to regularly demonstrate the Netflix culture values like selflessness, curiosity, context over control, and freedom & responsibility in all your engagements with colleagues.
  • Judgment: Netflix teams tend to be leaner compared to our peer companies, so you will rely on your judgment to prioritize projects, working closely with your partners - the personalization research leaders.
  • Technical acumen: We expect leaders at Netflix to be well-versed in their technical domain and be a user of the products we are building, so they can provide guidance for the team when necessary. You should have some prior experience running ML infrastructure systems at scale.
  • Team Building: Building and growing a team of outstanding engineers will be your primary responsibility. You will strive to make the team as excellent as it can be, hiring and retaining the best, and providing meaningful timely feedback to those who need it.

Minimum Job Qualifications

  • Prior experience leading a team responsible for ML infrastructure
  • Strong product sense – you take pride in building well-designed products that users love.
  • Outstanding people skills with high emotional intelligence
  • Excellent at communicating context, giving and receiving feedback, fostering new ideas, and empowering others without micromanagement
  • Willing to take action, without being stubborn - the ability to recognize your own mistakes
  • Your team and partners see your humility all the time and diverse high-caliber talent wants to work with you

Preferred Qualifications

  • 10+ years of total experience including 3+ years of engineering management
  • Prior experience working on ML inference or model lifecycle management, ideally at large scale
  • Experience with deploying Tensorflow, PyTorch, XGBoost in production.
  • Exposure to modern ML serving systems and frameworks, such as Ray Serve, NVIDIA Triton, ONNX runtime.
At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $180,000 - $900,000.

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

About Us

At Netflix, we are passionate about delivering joy to our 260+ million Netflix members around the world, whether they’re traveling to a remote location or at home with family. The TV Release Quality team is dedicated to understanding and ensuring the quality of our flagship TV streaming application, allowing us to deliver a stunning experience to members across the globe. 

We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager who is passionate about quality to lead the TV Release Quality team. The TV Release Quality team is dedicated to testing, measuring, understanding, and communicating the overall quality of our TV streaming application both before and after it is released to production. The team will focus on improving and innovating in the spaces of our test automation framework, metrics, observability, and alerting. This team will also set a strategic vision for test automation and quality in the TV space, collaborating with stakeholders and partners across Netflix. 

About the role

  • Build and lead a team of senior UI engineers who value inclusion, transparency, autonomy, and humility.
  • Set a strategic vision for test automation and quality in the TV space.
  • Collaborate, build alignment, and develop strong relationships with engineering partners across client, server, and productivity teams.
  • Effectively identify, prioritize, and manage high-impact initiatives on the team’s technical roadmap.
  • Empower, challenge, and coach team members to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback.
  • Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values.

What sets you apart

  • 5+ years of building and leading high-performance UI client engineering teams with high degrees of psychological safety.
  • Proactively gives and receives feedback; is not afraid to have difficult conversations.
  • Seeks different perspectives and relevant context to effectively navigate ambiguity.
  • Experience crafting and implementing a successful quality strategy for UI products
  • Familiar with the needs of automation infrastructure, observability, and alerting that supports a large and growing group of UI engineers across multiple teams.
  • Ability to build and own a technical roadmap that serves TV UI engineers across multiple teams.
  • Familiar with general Javascript development as well as test libraries and frameworks such as Puppeteer and Jest.
  • Human-centric leader who centers empathy and welcomes feedback.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to actively listen, adapt to different styles, and establish best practices for a hybrid-remote work environment.
  • Fosters an inclusive team culture that enables team members of all backgrounds to succeed and thrive.

Why Netflix?

  • Collaborate every day with a team that values selflessness, inclusion, and integrity
  • Make your impact on a product loved by hundreds of millions around the world
  • Remote-friendly with a flexible work environment
  • Strong parental leave policy and family forming benefits
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

65c17ec27a9df800b345f065.text: Technical Program Manager (L6) - Machine Learning Platform
65c17ec27a9df800b345f065.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch videos and play games as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. 

Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence are central to accelerating Netflix’s business and elevating the experience for members. ML/AI are being used throughout the company, from personalization to business planning to operations optimization. The Machine Learning Platform (MLP) is responsible for enabling new technological development at Netflix and improving researchers’ and engineers’ productivity. MLP covers all phases of machine learning development at Netflix, including data processing, training, evaluation, deployment and operations.

We are looking for a product-minded Technical Program Manager who’s passionate about maximizing ML engineer and research productivity. You’ll drive the processes and tracking that help our teams and partners execute efficiently. You’ll be a steward for our internal measurement and goal tracking. And, you’ll coordinate high-profile projects in partnership with Product Managers and Engineering Leaders throughout Netflix.

Excellent candidates have deep experience in program, project or product management for developer platforms. They demonstrate initiative, especially in ambiguous areas with unclear ownership. They’ll show uncanny communication skills and a strong ability to bring different teams to consensus.

Primary responsibilities:

  • Drive the execution of cross-functional ML Platform initiatives at Netflix across the various stakeholders for MLP, from Consumer Engineering, Algorithms Engineering, Studio and Content engineering and Data Science organizations
  • Establish and follow-through on regular measurement of success metrics like adoption and productivity
  • Define and drive effective execution processes on the ML Platform team
  • Manage and oversee operations including SLA definition & measurement, cost optimization, and data governance
  • Apply strong technical, organizational, and communication skills to devise sound technical approaches to abstract goals.
  • Establish an overall plan for numerous teams to rally around and successfully launch new productivity improvements for Netflix engineers
  • Own regular communication to senior Netflix management as well as broad communication to MLP consumers at Netflix
  • Identify and mitigate risks to execution in large-scale projects

Skills and Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of experience in product management, technical program management, software engineering, or leading software development projects.
  • Extensive experience working and innovating on developer platforms, especially those for machine learning
  • Knowledge and experience in defining, measuring, and improving developer productivity
  • Demonstrated initiative in clarifying ambiguous projects and driving them to completion
  • Strong technical background for close collaboration with engineers and ML practitioners both working on and consuming the platform.
  • At minimum, familiarity with Big Data technologies like Spark (and, preferably, with ML technologies like Tensorflow / PyTorch). Candidates should also have strong familiarity with cloud computing environments & tech (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure)
  • Mastery of development process management (e.g. Agile, Scrum) and the related tools (e.g. Jira)
  • Demonstrated leadership experience working effectively with engineers, data scientists, ML practitioners, Product Managers, etc. 
  • Excellent written communication skills and ability to present technical content to non-technical audiences. Ability to partner with different functions to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact.
  • Strategic thinking and ability to incorporate larger business context into algorithm and product development.
  • Experience in identifying tradeoffs, surfacing needs for clarity, and driving decision-making
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $300,000 - $900,000

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

65c3be257a9df8e75345f838.description:
About Us

Netflix is transforming the way people enjoy TV shows, movies, live events, and games. While we already serve 260 million members across 190 countries, our major growth phase is still to come. Our team develops the TV, web, and mobile applications used by members to discover and enjoy great entertainment. Our purpose is to increase member satisfaction by proving our product ideas through a mix of creativity and analytical thinking. Achieving this requires skilled, inquisitive leaders who can not only contribute widely but also spearhead technical solutions that can scale across a diverse range of devices and ambitious product targets.

Job Overview

We're looking for a seasoned Engineering Manager capable of spearheading and inspiring a vibrant team aimed at enhancing the Netflix user experience on TV, mobile, and web platforms. This position entails improving app performance, reducing errors, enhancing accessibility, and up-leveling the aesthetic appeal of our apps. The perfect fit would be someone who truly thrives on delivering stellar user experiences.

We have a unique culture that enables you to do your best work and grow as a technologist, leader, and person. 

What we’ll expect from you

  • Nurture a team: hire, mentor, manage, and inspire a dream team
  • Lead the charge on performance optimization initiatives to ensure a fast, reliable, and responsive user interface
  • Drive efforts to reduce errors and improve the resilience of our apps
  • Foster an environment of innovation that elevates the visual polish and accessibility of our apps
  • Define and execute an impactful roadmap in partnership with product management, design, data analytics, consumer research, and other engineering teams 
  • Shepherd technical direction: collaborate with cloud and device experts to identify technical requirements and evolve our architecture
  • Drive progress by creating clarity for cross-functional teams and leading through influence

What to expect from Netflix

  • Meaningful work: your team creates solutions that bring top TV shows and movies to the world
  • Impact: your work is enjoyed by millions of people every day
  • Freedom & responsibility: while we have responsibilities, our roles are not circumscribed, so we have the freedom to make Netflix better without permission
  • Colleagues: work with amazing talent on every project
  • Growth: learn from other selfless leaders around you and mentor others

Qualifications

  • Proven experience in a hands-on engineering role with expertise in frontend technologies and a strong understanding of backend services.
  • Leadership experience in managing a team of software engineers, with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects.
  • Knowledge of performance optimization techniques for client applications and a strong product sensibility
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically, balancing long-term vision with the urgency of immediate needs.
  • Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with a diverse and distributed team.
  • Experience with accessibility best practices is highly desired.
  • Passion for movies, TV series, and technology with an understanding of the streaming media industry is a plus.
We celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. 

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits.

65c5364e3d6b62e1ea871904.text: Manager,  Data Science and Engineering - Production Intelligence
65c5364e3d6b62e1ea871904.description:
At Netflix, our mission is to entertain the world by connecting our members to an extensive library of amazing stories from all over the globe. We are revolutionizing storytelling as we deliver content to 260+ million members across 190+ countries in 30+ languages. Developing data-driven methods and systems to help Netflix teams plan and manage the operations supporting content production is a critical part of that mission. 

We’re looking for a Manager to lead the Studio Intelligence Data Science & Engineering team. This talented team operates at the heart of Netflix’s business: helping Content and Studio functions forecast and plan our content financials and scheduling. This work informs decision-making on investments for new original shows. We develop new data sets and pipelines, deliver analytic tools, conduct statistical analyses, and build machine learning models, all with the goal of helping our creative teams produce the best shows and movies.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead and mentor a group of Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers with diverse skill sets that cut across statistics, machine learning, analytics, and data engineering
  • Craft and evolve a strategic vision for research and implementation of forecasting algorithms and analytics in content planning

About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

About the Team:
Platform Engineering aims to enable Netflix to scale effectively and empower our technical talent to focus on building innovative experiences for our members, partners, and creators worldwide. We do this by providing a highly available, reliable, secure, compliant, and performant platform of data, software, and infrastructure solutions that:

- meet the needs of our growing business
- accelerate the productivity of Netflix engineers, scientists, and data users
- maintain cost-efficiency that is at most linear to the growth of our business

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager for the Platform Engineering organization focused on large cross-functional programs that impact almost all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product management, engineering managers, directors, and VPs across multiple organizations to execute on programs.

Responsibilities

  • Leading multiple cross-functional programs in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science.
  • Provide deep domain expertise to formulate technical strategies with engineering partners.
  • Leverage the insights and experience from your work to influence the improvement of underlying technologies, architectures, and operations.
  • Drive engagement with internal partners by working with them to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones.
  • Effectively optimize the scope and schedule of deployments, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks.
  • Craft clear communication of progress toward goals, reporting status to stakeholders and leadership.

Requirements

  • 10+ years of experience driving large-scale software projects with engineering and product teams.
  • Deep understanding of infrastructure release management.
  • Direct experience in big data, online data store or data analytics infrastructure is beneficial.
  • Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams, driving large-scale technical strategies, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions.
  • Able to identify gaps in solutions and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience.
  • Self-starter who enjoys quickly bringing organization and direction.
  • Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values.

What sets you apart?

  • You can drive from strategy to execution with minimal direction.
  • You are highly skilled and experienced and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies.
  • You have the ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs.
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health.
  • You have a data-driven mindset in your decision-making.
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise.
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. Content Data Engineering team sits at the core of building a data ecosystem that powers Netflix’s understanding and decision-making about content.   • You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it
  • You have an extensive background and strong technical expertise working in a data domain and understand how to build for scale and business impact
  • You are a role model for integrity, transparency and courage
  • You have great judgment and can make tough decisions without agonizing
  • You have a high tolerance for ambiguity and fast-changing context
  • You enjoy working on hard problems with new tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making a big impact and delighting your stakeholders

  • Build strong and productive relationships across business, science, analytics, and engineering partners

About Us

Netflix is transforming how people enjoy TV shows, movies, live events, and games. While we already serve 260 million members across 190 countries, our major growth phase is still to come. Our team develops the TV, web, and mobile applications members use to discover and enjoy great entertainment. Our purpose is to increase member satisfaction by proving our product ideas through creativity and analytical thinking. Achieving this requires skilled, inquisitive leaders who can contribute widely and spearhead technical solutions that can scale across a diverse range of devices and ambitious product features.

Job Overview

We're looking for an Engineering Manager capable of originating and sourcing impactful ideas and leading a vibrant team aimed at elevating the Netflix user experience on TV, mobile, and web. This position entails improving app performance, reducing errors, enhancing accessibility, and up-leveling the aesthetic appeal of our apps. The perfect fit would be someone who truly thrives on delivering stellar user experiences.

Our unique culture enables you to do your best work and grow as a technologist, leader, and person.

What you'll do

  • Team leadership: hire, mentor, and inspire a dream team
  • Product leadership: define and execute an impactful roadmap in partnership with product leaders, design experts, data analysts, consumer researchers, and other engineering teams 
  • Technical leadership: collaborate with cloud and device experts to define technical requirements and evolve our architecture
  • Project leadership: drive progress using your domain expertise, by creating clarity for cross-functional teams, by using the broad Netflix business context you’ll develop on the job, and by leading through influence
  • Culture leadership: be a role model of and advocate for Netflix culture

Why work at Netflix

  • Impact: work on products that bring top TV shows and movies to over 260 million customers around the world
  • High performance: work with exceptional talent on every project
  • Growth: you will learn from and mentor others
  • Freedom and responsibility: improve Netflix without permission

About you

  • You’ve shipped consumer-facing client applications (e.g., web, mobile, or TV)
  • You have built and led software engineering teams
  • You know performance optimization techniques for client applications 
  • You can run with ambiguous requirements, be decisive when appropriate, and take smart risks 
  • You’re unafraid to take on new challenges and learn quickly to be effective in a new domain
  • You’re proactive and results-oriented
  • You communicate and collaborate effectively and can advocate for controversial positions
  • You demonstrate user experience insights and have a usability and accessibility perspective
  • Passion for movies, TV series, and technology with an understanding of the streaming media industry is a plus
We celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. 

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits.

65d53e39aabfb4701736e71c.text: Product Manager - Partner Device Tools and Services
65d53e39aabfb4701736e71c.description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. The Client and Partner Technologies team is charted with enabling brilliant Netflix experiences on partner devices and building foundational client systems and tools.  As a Product Manager for Partner Device Tools & Services, you work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to support our technical engagements and roadmaps with partners such as Samsung, MediaTek, Amazon, and regional partners like Comcast and Sky.

Using both qualitative insights and quantitative metrics to guide decisions and measure success, you will be responsible for driving, developing and executing different software and hardware product roadmaps. This is a dynamic role interfacing with device partners, partner engineering teams and hundreds of internal engineers to drive efficiency and quality, ensuring members around the world have the best Netflix experience. 

What Sets You Apart?

  • Track record of technical product transformation, finding new opportunities and building them to scale
  • Comfortable working with ambiguity. This role is fast-paced, fluid, and will frequently evolve based on partner, strategy, and product priorities
  • You welcome candid feedback and can constructively give it as well
  • Self-starter who enjoys quickly bringing organization and direction
  • Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values

Required Skills

  • Deep experience with software test tools and shipping high quality products
  • 7+  years of experience in product management, technical program management, software engineering, or leading software development projects
  • Strong depth-of-knowledge of embedded platforms and the consumer electronics market
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Ability to think strategically and lean on data to inform decision-making
  • Can balance consumer, partner, and business interests while considering technical integration tradeoffs
  • Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams and organizations, driving large-scale technical execution plans with measurable milestones, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
