65d909b7aabfb4b06f36e93c.text: Lead Engineer, Game Studio: Transmedia Pipeline R&D
65d909b7aabfb4b06f36e93c.description:
As the lines between games, film, tv, and animation continue to blur The Game Studio Transmedia Pipeline R&D team will be the vital team working within the Netflix Game Studio organization across the wider company to ensure we’re paving a way towards a future where creatives and teams can seamlessly collaborate across those mediums in a way only Netflix can and ensure our company wide technology investments that enable productions do so with equivalent eye towards game developer needs.

The Lead Engineer will build, lead, and manage this initially small team to help us pave the way towards a future where world class IPs can be easily collaborated on via all mediums.  This will involve a high degree of influence and collaboration outside their immediate team, and great candidates will thrive in bringing disparate stakeholders together and identify opportunities and projects in this still largely ambiguous space.  They will be expected to contribute directly with hands-on work, especially earlier in the life of the team.  

Responsibilities

  • Cross-Netflix relationship, collaboration, and alignment: Working across Netflix organizations as well as Netflix Game Studio game development teams, to drive creation and adoption of new “transmedia” technical and creative capabilities across all mediums for our top and new IPs by identifying and creating effective ongoing collaboration on investments and projects.
  • Team Leadership: Able to work across disciplines with minimum process to organize work and create predictability in an unpredictable space.  Able to build bridges and collaborate well with several Netflix game platform partner teams and help their team to succeed individually and together with them.
  • People and Project Management: Manage this small, senior, multi-discipline team and ensure team focus and health. 
  • Working across disciplines:  Building and maintaining a high degree of empathy and effective outcomes for disciplines such as design, art, techart, etc in addition to engineering such that solutions are high impact for all that could benefit with “transmedia pipelines”
  • Pipeline/tool R&D hands on work: Especially early on, this person will lean in to do hands on work in pipeline/asset/tools software development work.  Both to understand more directly what it will take to succeed and contribute to it, and to educate the future composition of the team over the long term.  This will include hands-on coding, scripting, and documentation in collaboration with other software teams at Netflix.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science 
  • 7+ years experience in engineering oriented roles in or adjacent to games, Visual effects (VFX), simulation, or related projects/industries
  • One or more Lead Engineer/Engineering Manager role on a team faced with ambiguous but strategic challenges with some aspect of VFX, games, pipeline, or other projects that have challenging performance and/or artistic requirements
  • Exceptional communication and leadership skills
  • Strong engineering fundamentals, hands on experience with Python, C++, batch processing. 
  • Exposure and familiarity with at least one full featured game engine and how assets move through them (Unreal, Unity, internal AAA studio engines, etc.)

Bonus Skills

  • Worked on shipping games or other high complexity interactive projects that have complex asset pipelines
  • Familiarity with more than one major game engine and its art pipelines
  • Built or managed tools and/or multi-stage complex art pipelines in VFX/film or games
  • Experience managing workflows across disparate OS’s and tools (Mac, Linux, Windows, source control, DCC applications, etc.)
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $500,000 USD. 

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Location: Remote Friendly

About the team
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Developer Enablement team sits at the intersection of Engineering and Learning & Development, and ensures that the technical learning strategy is well integrated with the overall employee learning journey at Netflix. Our mission is to help all Netflix engineers, scientists, and solution developers be as informed and productive as possible by ensuring they have access to curated knowledge, education, and support resources, when and where they need them. 

Team initiatives include new hire engineering onboarding, continuing education, JIT/on-demand training, overall knowledge strategy for technical training execution, and delivery of Engineering wide programs to build community and drive a culture of learning.

About the role

General Program Manager 5 with breadth and depth of experience in Developer Enablement

We are looking for an innovative, proactive General Program Manager who is passionate about technical training, content creation, discovering and applying data insights, and has a strong opinion on documentation strategies. The Developer Education (DevEd) team’s mission is to transform the engineering landscape of onboarding and continuing education programs into a more interactive, impactful, and engaging experience. Your team is responsible for all engineering onboarding and continuing education training, planning, delivery, and development, including communication campaigns, metric tracking and reporting, defining and aligning training personas, and cross-team partnership training implementation. We’re looking for a self-starter who is excited to give and receive feedback, can ruthlessly prioritize, and is passionate about technology, learning, and can think outside of the box to help us scale. You should be someone who loves discovering new data and metrics, is quick to soak in information and make a smart decision based on data, and brings focused energy to the team and engineering community.

Will require travel to the Netflix offices for onboarding and quarterly on-sites.

What you will do...

  • Manage and prioritize requests for new and updated technical training and documentation.
  • Guide content creation alongside stakeholders, continually scanning for necessary updates, learning gaps, or outdated material.
  • Manage Paved Road, Manuals, and other documentation platforms, partnering with GTM to create documentation for new tooling.
  • Responsible for data reporting, signaling, and trending, using data from ESO, Manuals, and Search, to make informed decisions about content creation and documentation.
  • Partner with internal and external program managers, instructional designers, technical writers, and facilitators for developer education program execution.
  • Foster a culture of learning that promotes inclusion and diversity in our teams, interactions, and learning models.

Your experience must include or demonstrate…

  • Discovering and applying data insights, including experience measuring leading and lagging learning metrics and using those insights to guide strategy and operations.
  • Creating and editing engaging documentation, with a strong opinion on documentation strategy including sustainability, maintenance, and archiving.
  • Managing and prioritizing a large number and variety of requests for new and updated technical training, including guiding content creation alongside stakeholders.
  • Designing and implementing diverse learning formats using blended instructional methods.
  • Navigating diverse stakeholder groups, forming and sustaining successful partnerships by influencing up, down, and across.
  • Creating and maintaining a learning culture that amplifies the organization’s potential.

We are looking to hire a TPM role for Developer Enablement within the Platform Engineering organization. The role is for a generalist TPM who can drive both platform wide or domain based programs that cut across multiple engineering teams and product teams. I’m looking for candidates with extensive documentation lifecycle and ecosystem knowledge and experience including working knowledge of GenAI solutions and applications.

Platform TPM Context
This role will create vision, strategy and action plans for driving  the documentation lifecycle and ecosystem within Platform Engineering. These are highly visible and cross-functional efforts that require building and driving technical thought leadership across all engineering organizations across Netflix. 

A successful candidate will have experience in engineering productivity. They will have experience leading complex cross team and cross organization programs, and bringing them to a successful conclusion. They will have demonstrated experience building and fostering relationships across many stakeholders. They will thrive stepping into an ambiguous situation and bring order and alignment.

Our TPM team is currently staffed with 2 Individual Contributor Technical Program Managers who have backgrounds in Engineering, Product Management, Program Management, Data Analysis and visualization, and Generative AI. Our TPMs are technically adept and partner directly with product and engineering functions, aligning and mobilizing teams to deliver high impact business outcomes. The team has grown organically over the last year with a new leader. We are looking for an experienced TPM to join the team to lead new programs across Platform Engineering within the Productivity Engineering lens.

In a TPM, we want to see...

  • Passion for documentation and information architecture
  • Lead technical discussions and show thought leadership
  • Strategic execution and delivery on a vision focused on results
  • Ability to build strong relationships and rally the team
  • Ability to influence program/product direction and simplify complexity
  • High emotional intelligence and ability to assess people dynamics

What would be additive for the team/group:

  • Unique perspectives and lenses: We aim to be (at least) as diverse as the user base we serve, so that we build inclusive products/experiences. We would benefit from perspectives across dimensions of diversity that are not currently represented on our TPM team. 
  • Perspectives on partnering with PM groups: As we introduce Product Management to Platform Engineering, we’re evolving our definition of the TPM role and partnership model. We would benefit from experience and perspectives on how best to set up the model and partnership for success.

65dfb5207a9df8013790c89d.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is also one of the largest studios in the world and empowers storytellers from all over the globe to tell the stories you fall in love with. Producing content globally, at this scale is a unique challenge; this is where our organization comes in. 

Studio Production Engineering plays a pivotal role in Netflix's content creation and delivery journey. The seamless magic of your favorite show starting with a click is the result of thousands of intricate processes behind the scenes. Our tools are the unsung heroes, enabling many of these workflows. We empower Netflix studios to bring creative excellence to life, build tools to bring operational excellence and accomplish economies of scale. Our solutions aim to elevate the ROI of the $15 billion dollars spent on content creation through cost/time efficiency, data driven decision making. We also provide technology to manage end-user access and build tools that help with resourcing workflows resulting in the production and delivery of the highest-quality content.

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager with platform/infrastructure domain experience to drive high-impact cross-functional next-generation production solutions that scale for the growing business needs. This role requires strong collaboration with product managers, data science engineering, business stakeholders, peer technical program managers, and senior leadership to execute, track, and deliver high-impact strategic programs in the Studio space.

What's Different About Us?

  • Huge Impact - you will directly impact the workflows that help plan, produce and manage  billions of dollars worth of content spend
  • Speed - we move quickly, iterate rapidly, and learn constantly
  • Unique Culture - we live by our values

Responsibilities

  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science, that deliver technical solutions.
  • Influence without authority and manage a large scope of initiatives and deliverables.
  • Provide deep domain expertise to form technical strategies with engineering partners.
  • Drive engagement with internal partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones, effectively optimize scope and schedule, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks.
  • Craft clear communication of the big picture, challenges, progress toward goals and report status to stakeholders and leadership.

We would love to work with you if:

  • You have 10+ years of technical program management experience driving large scale software projects/programs with engineering and product teams. 
  • You have proven experience driving large-scale software projects, managing the definition of technical strategies, and building long-term scalable solutions.
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view on product growth and discovery solutions.
  • You are highly skilled, and experienced, and enjoy orchestrating multiple programs with many moving parts and creating partnerships with cross-functional teams.
  • You are able to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience.
  • You are a self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction.
  • You can exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values.
  • You truly believe that diversity is key to a team’s health and success.

Bonus Points if:

  • You have application security domain experience - awareness of AuthN and AuthZ constructs.
Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering both candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California, and Los Angeles, California (with occasional travel to other offices).

65e640f3b5811b17115ec39c.description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

In April 2022, we introduced a new, more affordable, ad-supported tier for our customers, marking a significant milestone for Netflix. Our focus is now on expanding choices for consumers and providing advertisers with a premium TV brand experience that surpasses traditional linear formats. The challenge ahead involves scaling our ad tech to maximize its impact on our business.

At Netflix, the Ads Data Science and Engineering team plays a crucial role in establishing the foundation of our ads business. Our mission encompasses conducting comprehensive analyses, developing analytic tools, and creating predictive models using machine learning, all with the overarching goal of enhancing choices and joy for our members. As a leader in this domain, you'll collaborate closely with partner teams to strategize on overarching business goals. Your team will be at the forefront of developing and implementing advanced optimization algorithms and machine learning models, driving significant enhancements to our advertising systems. With a commitment to analytical rigor, your team will evaluate ideas, dissect problems, build workflows, provide recommendations, and lead end-to-end analytics initiatives in this transformative space.

Responsibilities

  • Hire, inspire, and grow high-performing data scientists and analysts.
  • Lead strong partnerships with stakeholders from across the business - from product management, engineering, consumer insights, content, and strategy.
  • Instill an inclusive culture that is innovative and collaborative, both within your team and in the broader organization.
  • Develop a team charter and roadmap that optimizes the impact of the team and reflects evolving business needs.
  • Act as an ambassador between the Product, Engineering, Strategy, and DSE teams by having a deep knowledge of how the Netflix Ads product works.
  • Ensure that your team is producing consistently trustworthy and high-quality technical outputs that influence the business. 

The Ideal Candidate

  • Demonstrated tenacity, resilience, and leadership experience that enables you to organize and drive cross-functional projects, overcome challenges, and propose solutions. 
  • Be both quantitative and qualitative. You should be able to quickly assess and understand complex systems, but also have high EQ, so that you can be a product ambassador to the rest of the organization, and our Hollywood and global partners. 
  • You are a player-coach. You can develop roadmaps and strategies, but also execute on technical work and ensure that your team produces consistent high quality outputs.
  • Superb communication skills - You must be able to cultivate strong working relationships, communicate effectively, write meticulously, and give outstanding presentations to both technical and creative audiences. 
  • Experience building and leading hybrid Data Science and MLE teams in the Ads space.
  • Capacity and passion to translate business objectives into actionable analyses, and analytic results into business and product recommendations 
  • A passion for TV and movies and defining the future of entertainment

65e674803d6b62683de0e3cf.text: Senior Engineering Manager, Model Development Infrastructure, Machine Learning Platform
65e674803d6b62683de0e3cf.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Machine Learning drives innovation across all product functions and decision-support needs. Building highly scalable and differentiated ML infrastructure is key to accelerating this innovation.

The Opportunity
We are looking for a seasoned engineering leader to lead one of the broad horizontal teams within our Machine Learning Platform (MLP) org. MLP is chartered to maximize the business impact of all ML practices at Netflix and innovate on ML infrastructure to support key product functions like personalized recommendations, studio innovations, virtual productions, growth intelligence, and content demand modeling among others.

The Model Development Infrastructure team’s charter spans three main areas: 
- A scalable Training Platform to develop deep models trained on high-end GPUs 
- Metaflow - our popular open-sourced ML Infra solution for Data Scientists 
- A new team focused on infrastructure for Foundation and Generative AI models, including customizing, fine-tuning, and serving large language models. This team focuses on all aspects of customizing OSS foundation models & LLMs, including identifying state-of-the-art techniques for hardware acceleration, serving, and optimal ML performance. The leader will need to hire and grow strong talent in this competitive area.

This is a high-visibility role that requires building great partnerships with senior engineering and data science leaders. We are looking for a leader with experience leading ML practitioners or ML platform engineers, so they can be a strong advocate for ensuring the internal customers have a world-class user experience on our ML Platform.

Expectations

  • Vision: Understanding the entertainment business and how technology is changing the landscape will allow you to lead your team by providing inspiring context.
  • Partnership & Culture: Establishing positive partnerships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix will be critical. Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment provider with over 260 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries around the world. This success has depended on an industry-leading engineering organization building cloud-native services with exceptional resilience. Cloud Infrastructure Engineering delivers the platform underneath these services by following three tenets: simple, scalable, speed. We build simple, elegant solutions that are easy to adopt, highly available and efficient at internet scale, and support rapid development and exploration for engineers across the company.

Netflix has built a reputation as a world leader in Performance Engineering and the Netflix Performance Tech blog is one of the de-facto resources in the Industry. The Netflix performance engineering team is a small, very senior, and highly impactful team who have massive impact across Netflix engineering by being a trusted expert to countless teams getting involved in the hardest problems and most critical projects to ensure Netflix is always delivering the very best performance to its customers. 

We are looking for an engineering leader passionate about performance optimization to lead this space at Netflix. You will own a long tenured and deeply experienced team of performance engineers. You have a background in the domain with strong technical expertise enabling you to grow and guide members of the team as well as choose the right problems for Netflix to invest in.  You have a track record of growing very senior engineers to be industry leaders. 

You will influence some of our key bets enabling great engineering at every level of the stack to result in experiences that delight our customers at massive scale. The team connects the dots across products and features to allow us to ship end-to-end experiences, not org charts.  You will enable the team to continue to develop industry-leading tooling and analytics in partnership with other industry leaders allowing us to stay at the very forefront of our domain.

What You Will Do

  • Own vision, strategy, and the end-to-end performance optimization of Netflix on the Cloud. 
  • Effectively collaborate across several partner teams, focus on the user, prioritize ruthlessly, and get things done.
  • Support a team of world-class colleagues, keeping them challenged and growing professionally.
  • Make data-driven decisions, make bets, learn from failures, be in situations without obvious right answers, and create an environment where rapid iteration is the top goal.
  • Develop groundbreaking tooling and analytics, cooperating with other industry leaders to continue to push what best-in-class performance optimization is. 
  • Own Netflix’s relationship with key Vendor partners and push the boundaries of performance on multiple architectures.

Who We Are Looking For

  • A leader who has a strong and deep background in the performance domain with experience of internet scale platforms and their associated complexity. 
  • Demonstrated experience growing and developing world-class engineers.
  • Someone who believes deeply in engineering excellence and deriving the very best out of our systems and people. 
  • A proven track record of navigating an ambiguous space, solving hard problems with tricky technical or organizational constraints, and identifying the right ones to address.
  • An organized, informed, effective communicator and influencer using context, not control; outcome-focused and able to think from the first principles.
  • Experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity, ensuring that we can attract and retain the best talent from anywhere and that all voices are heard to inform our direction.
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 250 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Production Finance Engineering is responsible for building tools and technologies that enables Netflix to plan and spend our members' money effectively across hundreds of titles that are produced and launched every year. It all starts with creating a budget on how we want to spend the money on a title. From that point onwards, we track every dollar spent on the title by ingesting huge volumes of production accounting data and helping keep the production cost on track. The need to improve production economics is at the core of making Netflix a differentiator amongst its competitors and the work we do as part of this team is critical in making that happen. 

We're looking for an Engineering Manager who can create a strong vision and viable roadmap as well as build and lead a team of world class software engineers. In this role you will optimize workflows across various aspects of Content Accounting and Financial reporting. You will help the team overcome technical challenges that come with the ever increasing volume and complexity of our productions -- all while maintaining the accuracy and timeliness of our financial data.

As a Engineering Manager you will:

  • Lead a full stack team of UI, backend and full stack engineers with varying levels of industry experience.
  • Drive success with minimal process and a heavy emphasis on individual responsibility.
  • Support your team by helping them understand priorities and enabling them to ignore distractions and non-productive influences.
  • Work closely with various cross functional partners like product, design, data science and stakeholders in being a sounding board.
  • Be an exemplar of the Netflix culture

About You:

  • Domain Experience. You have built financial applications and understand the building blocks and foundations required to build a complex financial solution.
  • Engineering excellence. You have experience leading in a variety of contexts, during which you’ve built scalable, robust, and fault-tolerant systems. You have a solid knowledge of the whole web stack: front-end, back-end, databases, cloud applications, integrations.
  • Mentorship / Guidance: You have a proven track record of leading a large team of software engineers with varying levels of experience from interns and new college grads to seasoned engineers. You know that the most important part of your job is setting the team up for success. Through mentoring, teaching, and reviewing, you help other engineers make sound architectural decisions, improve their code quality, and get out of their comfort zone.
  • Execution: You care tremendously about execution and feature velocity. You hold yourself personally accountable, jumping in and taking ownership of problems that might not even be in your team's scope.
  • Hiring know-how. You're a thoughtful interviewer who constantly raises the bar for excellence. You believe that what seems amazing one day becomes the norm the next day, and that each new hire should significantly improve the team.
  • Are Detail Oriented. You value data accuracy and also understand the nuances of the projects in flight.
  • Project Management. You have led large cross functional initiatives by leveraging project management tools like Jira, Trello, etc. and can bring that experience to the team. 
  • Hybrid Team Management. You have experience managing a hybrid team of in-person and remote engineers. Remote inclusivity is at the heart of communication and collaboration that you continue to practice and instill on the team. 

Bonus Experience:

  • Experience working in any studios
  • Built studio productions facing tools 
  • Experience with AWS

The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000.

The Developer Enablement team sits at the intersection of Engineering and Learning & Development, and ensures that the technical learning strategy is well integrated with the overall employee learning journey at Netflix. Our mission is to help all Netflix engineers, scientists, and solution developers be as informed and productive as possible by ensuring they have access to curated knowledge, education, and support resources, when and where they need them. 

Team initiatives include new hire engineering onboarding, continuing education, JIT/on-demand training, overall knowledge strategy for technical training execution, and delivery of Engineering wide programs to build community and drive a culture of learning.

About the role

General Program Manager 5 with breadth and depth of experience in Developer Enablement

We are looking for an innovative, proactive General Program Manager who is passionate about technical training, content creation, discovering and applying data insights, and has a strong opinion on documentation strategies. The Developer Education (DevEd) team’s mission is to transform the engineering landscape of onboarding and continuing education programs into a more interactive, impactful, and engaging experience. Your team is responsible for all engineering onboarding and continuing education training, planning, delivery, and development, including communication campaigns, metric tracking and reporting, defining and aligning training personas, and cross-team partnership training implementation. We’re looking for a self-starter who is excited to give and receive feedback, can ruthlessly prioritize, and is passionate about technology, learning, and can think outside of the box to help us scale. You should be someone who loves discovering new data and metrics, is quick to soak in information and make a smart decision based on data, and brings focused energy to the team and engineering community.

Will require travel to the Netflix offices for onboarding and quarterly on-sites.

What you will do...

  • Manage and prioritize requests for new and updated technical training and documentation.
  • Guide content creation alongside stakeholders, continually scanning for necessary updates, learning gaps, or outdated material.
  • Manage Paved Road, Manuals, and other documentation platforms, partnering with GTM to create documentation for new tooling.
  • Responsible for data reporting, signaling, and trending, using data from ESO, Manuals, and Search, to make informed decisions about content creation and documentation.
  • Partner with internal and external program managers, instructional designers, technical writers, and facilitators for developer education program execution.
  • Foster a culture of learning that promotes inclusion and diversity in our teams, interactions, and learning models.

Your experience must include or demonstrate…

  • Discovering and applying data insights, including experience measuring leading and lagging learning metrics and using those insights to guide strategy and operations.
  • Creating and editing engaging documentation, with a strong opinion on documentation strategy including sustainability, maintenance, and archiving.
  • Managing and prioritizing a large number and variety of requests for new and updated technical training, including guiding content creation alongside stakeholders.
  • Designing and implementing diverse learning formats using blended instructional methods.
  • Navigating diverse stakeholder groups, forming and sustaining successful partnerships by influencing up, down, and across.
  • Creating and maintaining a learning culture that amplifies the organization’s potential.

Other attributes that will excite us…

  • A sense of humility, adaptability to change, and a bias towards action.
  • Strong technical understanding and skill set with an ability to communicate with engineers and create and understand technically complex training.
  • Good understanding of the education space for engineers and data scientists, including learning styles and approaches.
  • A track record of consistently and successfully delivering technical education and community-building training and events.

  • Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap
  • Collaborate closely within the broader Productivity Engineering organization, delivering cohesive solutions

Where you’ll focus

  • Delighting Netflix engineers with amazing user experiences and customer service
  • Work to reduce toil through connected experiences that spans metrics, logs, traces, events, heap dumps and other operational datasets
  • Take more opinions on users behalf to help engineers manage complexity in extracting insights
  • Provide polished building blocks that are great out of the box but promote extending when needed

  • Experience building and leading high-performing teams
  • Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset. You initiate the hard conversations.
  • Experience working closely with central development platform and tooling team
  • Experience building self service experiences with strong UI/UX components

660c3040b5811b95132d47e1.text: Technical Program Manager (L5) - Security and Privacy
660c3040b5811b95132d47e1.description:
About Netflix
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

The Team
The Security and Privacy Technical Program Management team is a force multiplier for the security organization; we partner closely with engineering and product teams across Netflix to deliver impactful and scalable security initiatives. We collaborate with leaders inside and outside the organization to align on strategic goals and vision to further the security roadmaps for our partnering teams in a business-driven way. We then work with the right stakeholders to establish and drive initiatives that move the needle on this. 

The Opportunity
You will drive large, at-scale security initiatives across multiple products and central engineering orgs with stakeholders ranging from senior leadership, product managers, engineering managers, and developers. It is a great opportunity to help mature the security posture in the most rapidly growing parts of our business and gain intimate knowledge of Netflix’s products and services. These are highly visible and cross-functional efforts that require technical thought leadership across Netflix’s engineering and product organizations. 

We are leaning into the “T” (Technical) for this role. By technical, we mean that the ideal candidate has a strong understanding of the overall security domain and the ability to gain a technical understanding of programs across their lifecycle. TPMs must be skilled at both strategy and execution as well as have depth in their technical domain. 

As we expand from SVOD into Live events, onboard you will lead the Live security and Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) prevention programs that are business critical and have a unique set of challenges to navigate through. Both programs are closely related and focus around preserving the high availability of our streaming service. You will be responsible for crafting and executing the overall program. This includes translating the vision into a program strategy, leading critical initiatives, building the technical execution plan, stakeholder management, and overseeing the development of quarterly roadmaps. 

You will be successful in the role if…

  • You are passionate about leading by influence and advocating for change. 
  • You have a demonstrated ability to establish a vision and to execute on it.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience.
  • You are able to triage multiple initiatives to make a judgment to tackle the right problems at the right time.
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs technology tradeoffs.
  • You have familiarity with consumer product security principles and best practices, and have developed and driven security initiatives such as DDoS and fraud prevention, to name a few. 

A few reasons why we love this work and think you will too:

  • You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful security work for the Netflix business and engineering ecosystem.
  • You will be working with an industry leading security team with many opportunities to improve existing projects and identify new ones.
  • You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share them across the community.
  • You enjoy learning and working closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, data science and engineering, content delivery networks, and a production studio.
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

We are looking for an experienced technical program manager who can partner closely with engineering managers, engineers, product managers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs.   • Leverage deep knowledge and functional expertise to drive road mapping, execution planning and cross-functional alignment across multiple stakeholder groups.
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership.

  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly.

  • You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies

  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise.

6628299a7a9df81210e4c8a0.description:

As a global household brand, we strive to bring joy to users by connecting them with stories and artists through a delightful and high-quality experience. 

Consumer Identity and Access organization provides innovative and trusted Identity & Access solutions at scale that enable seamless product experiences for Netflix streaming and games. We collaborate closely with engineering and product teams across Netflix to deliver impactful and scalable initiatives. We are seeking a talented Technical Program Manager to partner with engineering managers, product managers, and engineering teams across multiple organizations to execute programs. 

About You

  • You are passionate about leading by influence and advocating for change.
  • You have a proven track record of taking innovative projects from ideation to production.
  • You are a proactive, effective communicator with great judgment and a bias towards action.
  • You have a high tolerance for ambiguity and fast-changing context.
  • You are a delightful partner for your engineering, product, and business colleagues. 
  • You have familiarity with identity and access principles and best practices. 

Scope of the role

  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs in collaboration with product, security, and engineering.
  • Drive engagement with partners by working with them to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones.
  • Leverage the insights and experience from your work to influence the improvement of underlying technologies, architectures, and operations.
  • Effectively optimize the scope and schedule of execution, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks.
  • Craft clear communication of progress toward goals, reporting status to stakeholders and leadership.

Must-Have

  • Proven experience managing complex technical projects in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong understanding of program management methodologies, tools, and best practices.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify and mitigate risks, solve problems, and drive results.
  • Highly organized with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
Our team includes people of all genders, varied sexual orientations, parents, folks who are self-taught, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds. Diverse teams are strong teams, and we encourage those with varied identities and experiences to apply.

The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000.

662ad13aaabfb490410d95ac.text: Engineering Manager, Big Data Analytics Platform
662ad13aaabfb490410d95ac.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment provider with over 260 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries around the world. This success has depended on an industry-leading engineering organization building cloud-native services with exceptional scale and resilience.

Big Data Analytics Platform (BDAP) team is responsible for providing orchestration and compute technologies to ETL and to access nearly 1 ExaByte of data in the Netflix Warehouse. It is also responsible for the underlying table format, Iceberg (an industry standard table format and an open source project that originated in this team), metadata, security and the life-cycle of the data (janitoring, compacting etc). Two Engineering Manager roles are open in the BDAP team.

Engineering Manager, Big Data Orchestration
The Big Data Orchestration (BDO) team provides an opinionated, cost-efficient, reliable, easy-to-use orchestration platform to meet Netflix’s analytics and machine learning needs. 
BDO enables scheduling, orchestrating, and executing big data workflows and jobs. The core of Orchestration is Maestro, the next-generation Data Workflow Orchestration platform to meet Netflix's current and future needs. It is a general-purpose workflow orchestrator that provides a fully managed workflow-as-a-service (WAAS). The team built Maestro from the ground up, enabling high throughput, horizontal scalability, and advanced parametrized, event-based scheduling.

The BDO team is building an ETL framework for incremental data processing for increased data accuracy, freshness, and easy backfill to directly impact the cost and operational efficiency of Analytics and ML. Orchestration is powered by the federated job execution engine, Genie under the hood, which abstracts away query engine specifics from users. The suite of Orchestration products includes sophisticated error classification and intelligent job auto-remediation using Pensive and Nightingale.

Engineering Manager, Big Data Compute Spark
The Big Data Compute Spark (BDCS) team provides high-performance, scalable, distributed data processing at rest with the customized-for-Netflix fork of Apache Spark on Hadoop to meet Netflix’s large scale data analytics and machine learning needs. 
This team of 7 people (and growing) is central to batch data processing and analytics in the Data Platform at Netflix. It provides support for Spark to ETL data into the Exabytes-scale data warehouse and a variety of ways (for casual and power users) to access that data using Spark.
The team is working on integrating Spark accelerators to further drive performance, evaluating containerization platforms to run Spark, building better batch and real time observability into Spark workflows and no/low touch ways to use Spark. 
This is a dream team of highly passionate and intelligent engineers who work well together. The team works on solving challenging problems at scale that have a huge impact on the Data Platform. The team has PMC members and committers who shape and contribute to open-source projects. 

Check out some of our talks on Spark.

What you will do:

  • Partner to deliver the vision, strategy, and adoption of current and future technologies
  • Form trusting cross-functional partnerships to align many engineering teams and ensure our solutions meet their needs, selflessly prioritizing work beyond the scope of your own domain
  • Build, scale, and grow a team of outstanding engineers, challenge them to bring their best selves to work every day, and deliver industry-leading results in stability, performance, and efficiency
  • Balance smart risks, investment in foundational technical work, paying off tech debt, and incremental improvements to deliver timely results across multiple critical strategies

What we are looking for:

  • An experienced engineering leader who can drive a team of amazing and geographically distributed engineers to do their best work while building and maintaining strong partnerships with peers and stakeholders
  • Ability to dive deep as needed to facilitate technical strategy trade-offs and zoom out to understand the big picture to shape the product
  • Experience building and running extremely reliable platform systems supporting high-scale and critical workloads, including running a 24x7 on-call, 99.95+% availability, fast response and short mean-time-to-restore service
  • Bring rigor to decision making and drive down ambiguity with the right mix of collecting data, seeking input, farming for dissent, and making pilot investments to build understanding or confirm direction
  • Proven track record helping a team deliver timely results on critical priorities against many demands for their time, and partnering with product and engineering management to influence the right areas for investment
  • Experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity, ensuring that we can attract and retain the best talent from anywhere and that all voices are heard to inform our direction
  • Experience in Orchestration, Spark and/ or Big Data Analytics technologies is not a must, but very desirable
A few more things about us:
As a team, we come from many different backgrounds and countries, and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science and we strive to give people the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity and agility has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and we are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here. 

Blogs and Talks:
Maestro Blog
Incremental Processing Blog
Auto Remediation Blog
Evolving from Rule Based Classifier to Machine Learning Powered Auto Remediation 
Maestro presentation at AWS Re:Invent
Robust Foundation for Data Pipelines at Scale
Building a Scalable Workflow Scheduler with Netflix Conductor
DataWorks summit: Iceberg table format
Big Data Storage: SubSurface
Trino enjoying the view (Common Views)
Make data fluid with Apache Druid
Iceberg Right Ahead!

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You
choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

About the Team:
Platform Engineering aims to enable Netflix to scale effectively and empower our technical talent to focus on building innovative experiences for our members, partners, and creators worldwide. We do this by providing a highly available, reliable, secure, compliant, and performant platform of data, software, and infrastructure solutions that:

- meet the needs of our growing business
- accelerate the productivity of Netflix engineers, scientists, and data users
- maintain cost-efficiency that is at most linear to the growth of our business

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager for the Platform Engineering organization focused on large cross-functional programs that impact almost all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product management, engineering managers, directors, and VPs across multiple organizations to execute on programs.

Responsibilities:

  • Leading multiple cross-functional programs in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science.
  • Provide deep domain expertise to formulate technical strategies with engineering partners.
  • Leverage the insights and experience from your work to influence the improvement of underlying technologies, architectures, and operations.
  • Drive engagement with internal partners by working with them to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones.
  • Effectively optimize the scope and schedule of deployments, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks.
  • Craft clear communication of progress toward goals, reporting status to stakeholders and leadership.

Requirements:

  • 10+ years of experience driving large-scale software projects with engineering and product teams.
  • Deep understanding of infrastructure release management.
  • Direct experience in big data, online data store or data analytics infrastructure is beneficial.
  • Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams, driving large-scale technical strategies, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions.
  • Able to identify gaps in solutions and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience.
  • Self-starter who enjoys quickly bringing organization and direction.
  • Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values.

What sets you apart?:

  • You can drive from strategy to execution with minimal direction.
  • You are highly skilled and experienced and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies.
  • You have the ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs.
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health.
  • You have a data-driven mindset in your decision-making.
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise.
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Location: West Coast (preferred) or USA - Remote

Great entertainment thrills and inspires. Around the world, we connect hundreds of millions of people with the best television, films, live events, games, and more.  And our product is at the heart of making these connections. To build best-in-class product experiences, we develop thoughtful long-term strategies, bring the best talent together, and let them creatively problem-solve with a strong and unique work culture. 

We are looking for a seasoned data science leader for our Member Engagement & Experiences domain. In this role, you will need to be both technical and strategic and play a critical part in the evolution of our service to support a broader suite of entertainment offerings. You will be a business leader who deeply influences cross-functional strategy and culture and drives technical excellence in analysis and decision-making for products and algorithms. Your team’s expertise will cover various disciplines including causal inference, AI/ML, stats/analytics, econometrics, quant psychology, etc. 

Responsibilities

  • Lead strong partnerships with stakeholders from across the business - from product management, engineering, merchandising and marketing, consumer insights, finance, design, etc.
  • Act as an ambassador for member impact grounded in data and great judgment
  • Hire, inspire, and grow high-performing data scientists and analysts. Instill an inclusive culture that is creative and collaborative, both within your team and in the broader organization
  • Develop a team charter and roadmaps that optimize for business impact and technical excellence
  • Ensure that your team is producing consistently trustworthy and high-quality technical outputs that influence the business

The Ideal Candidate

  • Demonstrates tenacity, resilience, and leadership experience to organize and drive cross-functional work and decisions, overcome challenges, and propose solutions 
  • Is both quantitative and qualitative. Is able to assess and understand complex systems, as well as market conditions, competitive pressures, and consumer needs in markets around the world 
  • Has high EQ
  • Is a player-coach. Develop roadmaps and strategies. Oversees execution of technical work and ensures that the team produces consistently high-quality outputs
  • Has superb communication skills - Is able to cultivate strong working relationships, communicate effectively, write meticulously, and give outstanding presentations to both technical and creative audiences
  • Has experience building and leading hybrid analysis and causal inference teams in consumer product
  • Has a PhD / MS degree in a quantitative or computational field (focus on causal inference/experimentation / scaled measurement preferred) 
  • Has the capacity and passion to translate business objectives into actionable analysis, and analytic results into business and product recommendations 
  • Is passionate about TV, movies, games,  and defining the future of entertainment

To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $360,000 - $920,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here.

663e7152aabfb4b0ab61aebd.description:
At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating how entertainment is imagined, created, and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 260 million paid subscribers, and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Producing content globally, at this scale is a unique challenge; this is where our organization comes in. 

Studio Production Engineering (SPE) plays a pivotal role in Netflix's content creation and delivery journey. The seamless magic of your favorite show starting with a click is the result of thousands of intricate processes and workflows behind the scenes that are enabled by our tools. We empower Netflix studios to bring creative excellence to life - develop tools to achieve operational excellence and economies of scale. Our solutions aim to elevate the ROI of the $15 billion dollars spent on content creation through cost/time efficiency, and data-driven decision-making.

User & Access Management Engineering, part of SPE, manages experiences, platforms, backend services and data facilitating the goal of seamless user onboarding and managing access to Netflix Content and Studio ecosystem. We are seeking a talented Engineering Manager to lead our dynamic team of local and remote engineers and drive the development and innovation of our complex infrastructure while improving the overall security posture.

As an Engineering Manager you will:

  • Provide technical vision and strategy for building platforms that scale for the growing needs of Content & Studio.
  • Build strong relationships and work closely with various cross-functional partners including product, engineering, design, data science, security team and stakeholders across time zones.
  • Support your team by helping them understand priorities, drive down ambiguity bringing focus, provide context and empower them to bring their best and create impact.
  • Participate in architecture decisions for technology innovation and be a thought partner/sounding board for your team, stakeholders, and partners.
  • Coach and lead a dream team of UI, backend, and full-stack engineers to execute a shared vision between engineering, product and security partners.
  • Be an exemplar of the Netflix culture

About You:

  • You are an inclusive leader with a proven track record of building and leading high-performing diverse teams.
  • You have an extensive background and strong technical expertise working in backend infrastructure and platforms, and understand how to build for complexity, scale and business impact.
  • You have a solid knowledge of distributed systems architectures and understanding of the whole web stack: front-end, back-end, databases, and integrations.
  • You are well versed in technical principles like cloud engineering, operational excellence, and balancing performance, efficiency, and reliability
  • You have a proven track record of taking innovative projects from concept to production.
  • You are inherently curious and enjoy leading through challenges. You balance short-term needs along with long-term vision. 
  • You are a proactive, effective communicator with great judgment and a bias towards action.
  • You are a role model for integrity, transparency and courage.
  • You enjoy enabling your team to work on hard problems with tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making a big impact
  • You have at least 2 years experience with hiring, leading engineering teams staffed with a range of experienced engineers and coaching through personal and professional growth.

Bonus Experience if:

  • You have application security domain experience - awareness of AuthN and AuthZ constructs.
  • You have a background working with Security Engineering or IAM foundational principles.
To learn more about Content Engineering, feel free to listen to this video.

Our team includes people of all genders, varied sexual orientations, parents, folks who are self-taught, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds. Diverse teams are strong teams, and we encourage those with varied identities and experiences to apply.

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. 6645d0fb3d6b625e30de5640.description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Content Infrastructure & Solutions (CIS) empowers engineers working on content and studio applications to be innovative and agile in supporting our massive global content production needs. We do that by providing scalable and resilient infrastructure to address integrated large-scale media, assets, data, workflow, and communication use cases. Examples of this organization’s work include massive-scale media processing platforms (1, 2), workflows (conductor), and data processing at scale.

The Content MiddleWare Infrastructure team(MWI), a part of the Content Infrastructure & Solutions group, provides Studio and Content Engineering specific, highly leveraged, and fully managed data, workflow, and messaging & communication platforms facilitating the goal of the Connected Studio. To learn more about what the MWI team does, check out the following tech blogs: workflow (1, 2), search (1, 2, 3), data movement (1, 2).

The Media Infrastructure Platform team (MIP) is part of a media-focused engineering group that provides highly available infrastructure for content production and processing, storage, and access, across all Netflix productions and licensed content. Infrastructure pieces like massive-scale media processing platforms (1, 2), and media storage infrastructure (1, 2)  are key systems we build. All of this is custom-built on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure.

We are hiring managers in PL to build and lead either of the following teams:

  • MWI Data Search Team: This team will own Graph Search (1, 2, 3), a Search-as-a-Service platform, within the MWI Data team. Graph Search streamlines search functions across various entities and workflows, notably in the Content Engineering domains but not limited to them. It offers a unified user experience encompassing both backend services and reusable front-end components. Graph Search is currently leveraged by around 70 applications and serves thousands of end users. This team may also contribute to the other infrastructure such as Ontology, SDSP, EARS, and RAW Hollow by collaborating with the rest of the MWI Data term in the US. 
  • MIP Media Infra and Operational Tooling Team:  This team will 1) develop key portions of our media processing and media storage infrastructure in close collaboration with the broader Media Infrastructure Platform team, and 2) own the development of operational tooling for the broader Content Infrastructure and Solutions organization.  You’ll have the unique opportunity to work both on developer-facing tooling as well as high scale distributed systems in the deep and interesting domain of media processing at Netflix scale and to uplift Netflix’s operational tooling. In particular, we want to evolve our operational tooling to make contemporary concepts like SLO management a first-class concept. While there has been some prior exploration in the operational tooling space, there is significant freedom to evolve this area from its current early state into a mature and thriving

What you will do

  • You will lead a team of software engineers to deliver high-impact results, your responsibilities in this role:
  • Partner with the product manager, engineers, and other engineering managers in the broader team to deliver the vision, strategy, and adoption of platform solutions across content and studio engineering, and ensure that we’re building the right features to power other engineering teams to effectively design and build search solutions at scale.
  • Collaborate closely with the rest of the MWI Data or MIP team in the US, drive the alignment of roadmaps for Search and other data infrastructure products (such as Ontology, Search, EARS, and RAW Hollow) or Cosmos, and ensure that we offer a cohesive and streamlined experience to our stakeholders across all the products MWI or MIP owns. 
  • Foster a strong accountability culture in the team and help the team deliver the results reliably and in a timely manner to support the needs of critical business stakeholders.
  • Act as a credible technical advisor to the team; help the team make thoughtful, informed decisions in ambiguous situations
  • Form trust cross-functional relationships with partners and stakeholders in PL and US within Netflix, connect the dots and drive adoption to maximize the business impact, ensure our solutions meet their needs, and selflessly prioritize work beyond the scope of your own domain.
  • Effectively communicate complex ideas and influence decisions across a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • Balance business needs with strong engineering principles, ensure investment in foundational technical work, paying off tech debts and incremental improvements to deliver timely results.
  • Lead, coach, hire, and develop a team of outstanding engineers, challenge them to bring their best selves to their daily work, and deliver exceptional results in stability, performance, efficiency as well as developer experience.
  • Build and nurture an inclusive team culture where every member feels empowered, accepted, and respected.

What we are looking for

  • Experience in building and managing high-performing teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity. Ability to attract and retain the best talent, and ensure that all voices are heard to inform our decisions while fostering a strong culture of accountability, where individuals take ownership of their responsibilities and contribute to the team’s collective success.
  • Ability to foster a team culture of open and direct communications, where team members feel empowered to offer constructive and positive feedback and acknowledge achievements and areas for improvement.
  • Experience building and operating extremely reliable platform systems supporting large-scale and critical use cases, including running 24x7 on-call, highly available, and fast response services.
  • Long-term strategic thinker with a strong platform mindset, and ability to define and articulate product vision and strategy and how they fit into the broader objectives of the organization.
  • Ability to prioritize strategically and align the team’s work with larger business goals. Have the courage to pivot based on broader impacts.
  • Ability to build and maintain strong partnerships with cross-functional partners and stakeholders with excellent communication and collaboration skills. Capable of influencing the strategic direction of partners and stakeholders.
  • Proven track record helping a team deliver timely results on critical priorities against many demands for their time, and partnering with product and engineering management to influence the right areas for investment
  • Bring rigor to decision-making and drive down ambiguity with the right mix of collecting data, seeking input, farming for dissent, and making pilot investments to build understanding or confirm direction.
  • Experience driving teams to adopt specific KPIs/leading indicators of system health, observing and tuning the systems to prevent predictable outages.
We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

664cf774b5811b8972a7badf.description:
Company
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. The Client and Partner Technologies (CPT) organization is charted with enabling brilliant Netflix experiences on partner devices and building foundational client systems and tools. Partner Enablements Apps group within CPT is looking for a software engineering manager to lead our Ecosystem Platform and Reliability team.

Role
We are seeking an experienced Software Engineering Manager to lead our Ecosystem Platform and Reliability team. This role involves establishing long-term technical strategy, driving the development and evolution of the core services to power our suite of web applications to scale partner management, device lifecycle management and partner payment channels, collectively known as Enablement Apps. The team is also responsible for the reliability and support for Enablement Apps, which includes first tier support for internal and external partners .
The ideal candidate will be an inspiring leader, an effective communicator, dedicated to fostering an environment of continuous improvement and good development practices, and enjoys working in the office a few days per week (some of the team and close partners are local and work in person a few days per week).

Team
The Ecosystem Platform and Reliability team develops the foundational software platform for Enablement Apps. We provide a unified approach for developing and delivering cloud and data systems leveraged by application teams and other stakeholders. The team makeup is primarily senior software engineers based in California and globally for our regional reliability teams in Hsinchu, Taiwan and Amsterdam, Netherlands.
The core service offering is a gateway for partners to execute the engineering and business interactions with Netflix. It also allows Netflix employees to manage hundreds of millions of devices and related partnership financial operations. 

Responsibilities

  • Thoughtful leadership with experience in hiring, coaching, and retaining strong engineering talent with various needs for personal and professional growth.
  • Lead a team of globally distributed engineers, providing technical guidance and career development support.
  • Foster a culture of continuous learning and development best practices within the team.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional partners to identify, design, and implement scalable and performant solutions for our evolving applications.
  • Coordinate and prioritize migration and deprecation of legacy services.
  • Champion data quality and engineering excellence.
  • Establish a strong and mature foundation for the core services for all Enablement Apps including but not limited to: Testing - unit/automated testing to minimize downtime, Monitoring & alerting, Scalable on-call support (i.e. balanced enough for the team to not always feel like they’re on-call and we have the right level of support)
  • Stay current with the newest trends, tools, and technologies in the field, assessing their relevance to our ecosystem.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in software development, with 3+ years leading a backend services platform team.
  • At least 3 years of experience in a leadership or management role within a software engineering team.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to navigate cross-functional team dynamics.
  • Comfortable working across multiple time zones in the US, Asia, and Europe when communicating with global distributed team members.
  • Familiarity with systems such as Jenkins, Github actions, Gradle, Spinnaker etc. is a plus.
